loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine Sangaré est  âgé  de 28 ans, il réside avec sa femme et ses 2 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Sido Sonincoura de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il fréquenta l’école coranique qu’il abandonna en classe de 4ème années (système éducatif Malien). Il commença alors à mener des activités génératrices telles le jardinage auprès de son père. C’est grâce aux recettes tirées de cette activité qu’il commença à vendre de l’huile alimentaire au marché château depuis  7 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Il effectue sa vente à l’aide d’une pompe manuelle qui lui sert de mesure. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire la demande clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est en relation depuis 12 mois. Après 1 prêt individuel correctement remboursé, il est à son 2ème prêt  qu’il  compte utiliser pour acheter, 200 litres d’huiles alimentaires, soit 10 bidons de 20 litres  sur place à Ségou auprès des grossistes. Lamine Sangaré vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à un clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il envisage  réaliser une bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir aux  charges familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Son ambition est d’agrandir et de diversifier  son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine Sangaré is 28 years old. He resides with his wife and two children in a traditional family with other households in the Sido Sonincoura district of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He attended Koranic school, and in the fourth grade (of the education system of Mali), he dropped out. Then he started to run income-earning businesses, such as gardening, with his father. Thanks to the income derived from this business, he started selling vegetable oil at the Chateau marketplace seven years ago and enjoys a large number of customers and fame. Sales are made using a manual pump, which measures the oil. Concerned about satisfying continually growing customer demands, he has turned toward Soro Yiriwaso, with which he has been associated for 12 months. After one individual loan, properly repaid, he is now on his second loan, which he intends to use to buy 200 liters of vegetable oil (either in 10- or 20-liter containers) locally in Ségou from wholesale merchants. He sells at the retail level while accepting cash or credit from customers composed of men and women. He envisions realizing a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will enable him to provide for his family and to increase his working capital. His ambition is to expand his business and to diversify it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Né le 16 Décembre 1979 à Sikasso, Monsieur Ibrahima S. est un célibataire vivant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans le quartier Médine de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, il s’est vite initié à l’activité de coiffure des hommes il y a maintenant plus de six  ans. Il a appris ce métier auprès d’un ami. En plus de  ses prestations, il vend divers articles à l’adresse de sa clientèle. Avec ses 6 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et  reçoit  beaucoup de commandes matériels de salon et divers, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Il  décida alors d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il est à son premier prêt individuel et compte acheter,  5 cartons de savons pharmapure, une douzaine de parfums de différentes qualités, 2 cartons de déodorants, 1 carton d’insecticides,(destiné à la vente) et  5 paires de peignes, brosses, 2 tondeuses, des pommades pour cheveux (pour son activité de coiffure). Les marchandises sont achetées à Bamako (la capitale du Mali) avant d’être  utilisées ou revendues dans son salon situé au bord de la route RN7 à une clientèle composée de  jeunes mélomanes de la capitale de Kénédougou. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born December 16, 1979 in Sikasso, Mali, Ibrahima S. is a bachelor who lives in a large, traditional extended family in the Medine neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali.)

Not having had the opportunity to continue in school, he became a men’s hairdresser six years ago. He learned the profession from a friend. He also sells various merchandise to his hairdressing clients. With his 6 years of experience, he has a good reputation and receives many orders for salon-related and other products. But he lacks capital to purchase inventory. This is why Ibrahima decided to participate in the lending program of the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso.

It will be his first individual loan. He plans to buy 5 boxes of Pharmapure soaps, a dozen perfumes of varied qualities, 2 cartons of deodorant, 1 carton of insecticide for resale, 5 pairs of combs and brushes, 2 electric shavers, and hair gel (for use on his hairdressing clients.) He purchases this merchandise in Bamako, the capital of Mali, and resells or uses it in his salon, which is located along route RN7. His clientele consists primarily of young music-lovers from the capital of Kénédougou in the south.

With this loan, he expects to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which he will use for his personal and family living expenses, make his loan payments, and invest the rest back into his business.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for resale and use in his salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his farm acreage to pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Elizabeth M. from Mbozi. She is married and responsible for supporting two orphans. Elizabeth has been running a shoe shop since 2007. This involves purchasing shoes on a wholesale basis and reselling at retail. She works at the business for nine to twelve hours per day, six days a week, assisted by one employee. Elizabeth currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shoes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her products. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Perpetua N. from Mbozi. She is married with three children between the ages of six and thirteen. She is also responsible for supporting two dependents who are orphans. Perpetua owns a small duka (or neighborhood shop) in the city, where she has been selling common household and grocery items since 2003. She works at the business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, assisted by one employee. Perpetua currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more sugar, rice, salt and other home needs for reselling. In the future, she plans to open the same type of business at a new location. Perpetua thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, salt and other home needs for reselling

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is twenty years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso, in the Western Region. She works hard to make a living. Esther trades in all kinds of food items and vegetables. She sells on a table top at the market square. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices. Esther has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items to resell

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is forty-one years old. He is married and has three children, all currently in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso in the Western Region. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family.

Kofi is a trader, trading in secondhand shoes. He sells at the local market and also hawks (goes door-to-door) and treks to other towns to sell. He buys his goods from Kumasi at affordable prices. He has been in business for a year now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy secondhand shoes in bulk

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo, Dilmer, y sus hijos: Verónica de 26, Jonathan de 23, Jacky de 22 en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica al comercio por temporada, actualmente está vendiendo bolsas plásticas, lo cual le es muy rentable porque se contacta con las empresas que realizan estas bolsas al por mayor, entonces ella compra grandes cantidades y las vende en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad. Felipa quiere vender cada vez más, para que con las ganancias pueda tener un negocio más estable, lo ha pensado mucho y se ha decidido por implementar una bodega en su vivienda, es por ello que está ahorrando para lograr su objetivo, ya que le resultaría mucho más cómodo y beneficioso para su economía.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, ya que su grupo es muy exigente y responsable a la hora de cumplir con las cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará bolsas y también algunos productos para ir abasteciendo su tienda, la cual espera abrir muy pronto.
texts.en:
Felipa is 34 years old, and lives with her husband Dilmer and their children: Verónica (26), Jonathan (23), and Jacky (22) in their own home. For a year she has had a seasonal business selling plastic bags, which is very profitable because she contacts the firms that sell these bags wholesale, then purchases large quantities and sells them in different markets in the city. Felipa would like to sell more and more, so that the earnings could make her business more stable. She has thought about it a lot and has decided to put a store in her house, and for this reason she is saving to achieve this objective, given that this would be more convenient and beneficial for her economic wellbeing. This is her fourth loan with MFP, she has always been very punctual in her payments, since her group is very successful and responsible and makes its payments on time. With the money that she requests now she will buy bags and also some products in order to supply her store, which she hopes to open very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise and invest in a new business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is twenty-six years old. She is single and has one child who is in school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming community in the region.

Margaret is a trader, trading in textile materials. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community and treks to other communities to sell. Margaret has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy textile materials in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es una emprendedora mujer de 37 años, vive con sus hijos: Nilton, Josep y Luisa de 17 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a brindar el servicio de llamadas telefónicas por celular en los alrededores de uno de los centros comerciales más conocidos de su localidad. Además de trabajar en un pequeño puesto, tiene tres jóvenes muchachas que trabajan para ella en otros puestos del mismo centro comercial. Esther está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le permite sentirse independiente, y con las ganancias puede brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Para el futuro tiene pensado comprar más puestos (módulos móviles) para obtener mayores ingresos, pues sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá lograr todos sus objetivos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más equipos celulares de mejor calidad para que sean más durables y así podrá contratar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Esther is an enterprising woman who is 37 years old, and lives in her own home with her children: Nilton, Josep and Luisa, who is 17 years old. For a year she has had a call center business, where she provides her customers with the ability to make telephone calls from a cellular phone in the outskirts of a commercial center that is very well known in her locality. In addition to working a small stand, she has three young women who work for her in other stands in the same commercial center. Esther is very happy with her work, since it makes her feel independent and provides her children with a good quality of life. For the future, she intends to buy more stands (movable modules) in order to obtain an increased income. She knows that with a lot of effort and dedication she can achieve all of her goals. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual in all of her payments. With the money she is requesting now she will buy more cellular equipment of better quality so it will be more durable, and this way she can hire additional people.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cellular telephones

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny es un joven trabajador de 28 años, vive con su esposa, Doris, y sus hijos; Alexander de 13 y Válerie de 12, en su casa propia. Desde muy joven aprendió a conducir auto, desde entonces, esta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de sustento económico, con la cual solventa los gastos de toda su familia. Generalmente sale muy temprano por la mañana a “taxear”, como él lo llama, y termina a las 6 o 7 de la noche, llegando muy cansado a su hogar. Jhonny trabaja con muchas ganas y energía, y esa alegría les transmite a sus pasajeros, de los que ya tiene varios clientes fieles. 
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se compromete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la reparación de algunas fallas mecánicas de su auto para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a hard working, 28 year old young man. He lives with his wife, Doris, and their children. Alexander is 13 and Válerie is 12. They live in their own house. He learned to drive a car when he was very young. Since then he converted this activity into his primary source of income, which he uses to pay all of the family’s expenses. He generally leaves very early in the morning to “taxear” (taxi around), as he calls it. He finishes at six or seven at night; he arrives home very tired. Jhonny works with great passion and energy. This happiness is transmitted to his passengers. He already has many loyal customers. This is his second loan with MFP. He promises to make his payments punctually. He will use the money he is now asking for to repair some mechanical problems with his car. He will do this to be able to offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his auto

loans.name: Dwene Ansa Group

texts.en: Doris is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all attending school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Doris is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Dwene ansa’, meaning reason before. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 32 años, es natural de Iquitos (región selva), pero vivió en Brasil gran parte de su vida. Ahora vive en Perú con su pareja en la casa de los padres de ella y esperan iniciar una bonita familia. Hace 5 años se dedica a brindar servicio mecánico automotriz, pues desde muy joven fue muy hábil para este oficio, por ello, implementó un taller en la ciudad de Lima, donde refacciona todo tipo de autos. Esta actividad es muy apasionante para él y lo bueno es que tiene un ayudante, pues no se da abasto solo para reparar todos los vehículos que llegan a sus manos. Ahora con una persona más, aprovecha algunos momentos para brindar servicio de taxi en su auto y así obtener más ingresos. Para el futuro, Julio quiere que su taller tenga equipos variados y de última tecnología para la reparación de automóviles.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará aceite y algunas herramientas para poder reparar más automóviles.
texts.en:
Julio is 32 years old and a native of Iquitos (a jungle region). He lived in Brazil for most of his life, but now he lives in Peru with his partner in the home of his parents. They hope to start a nice family.

Five years ago, he started providing services as an auto mechanic. He has become an expert at his job despite being so young. Julio opened a repair shop in Lima where he fixes all types of cars. He is very passionate about his work and the best part is that he has an assistant, because sometimes he receives more vehicles than what he is capable of handling by himself. Now that he has an employee, he is able to provide taxi services in his own automobile during his spare time so that he can generate more income. In the future, Julio would like to acquire a variety of equipment for his repair shop so that he can have the latest technology available to perform automotive repairs.

This is his first loan with MFP and he has agreed to make his payments on time. With the money he requested, he will purchase motor oil and additional tools so that he can repair more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & tools for his repair shop

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
Macaria tiene 41 años, vive en su casa (propia) con su pareja y sus hijos; Jhon de 16, Ricardo de 11, Gisel de 7 y Emerson de 4 añitos de edad, quienes son su razón de salir adelante. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes para captar la atención de mayor clientela, pues Macaria se encarga de surtir y abastecer muy bien su negocio para que sus vecinos puedan encontrar todo lo que necesiten. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la decoración de locales para diversos eventos y celebraciones. Ella tiene mucha fe a su trabajo, ya que sabe que todo es cuestión de creatividad y esfuerzo para echar a andar un nuevo negocio y lograr los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de su familia. Para el futuro, Macaria quiere tener una peluquería y no descansará hasta ver este sueño hecho realidad.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella acostumbra a solicitar préstamos individuales, pero también es parte de un grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza y seguirá abasteciendo su tienda.
texts.en:
Macaria is 41 years old. She lives in the house she owns with her partner and children; Jhon who is 16, Ricardo who is 11, Gisel who is 7 and Emerson who is 4 years old. They are her reason to succeed. As of more than 10 years ago she has worked selling beer from her home. She also has a grocery store in order to reach a larger clientele. Macaria is in charge of properly stocking and supplying her business so that her neighbors can find everything they need there. In addition, she works decorating venues for various events and celebrations. She has a great deal of confidence in her work since she knows that in starting a business and attaining the necessary level of income for her family’s well being, it’s all a matter of creativity and effort. In the future Macaria wants to have a hair salon and she won’t rest until she has made this dream a reality.

This is her fourth loan with PRISMA Microfinance. She has experience in applying for individual loans and also group loans. With the money she is applying for she will buy greater quantities of cases of beer and will continue to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandice increase

loans.name: Mame Khaty

texts.fr: Mame Khaty N. est une femme de 45 ans elle est mariée et a la charge de ses 2 neveux. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 4 ans et demi. Avec son crédit elle veut développer une activité de vente de draps de lit. Elle s'approvisionne à la capital, à Dakar pour revendre à Ziguinchor sa ville. Ses bénéfices lui permettent à contribuer au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame Khaty N. is a 45-year-old married woman who has two nephews to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO for four and a half years.  With this loan, she wants to develop a business selling bed sheets.  She stocks up in the capital of Dakar to resell in her town of Ziguinchor.  Her profits enable her to contribute to her family's welfare. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and advance her commerce

loans.name: Rosario Edith

texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the Sun and Moon village bank
She is 40 years-old, married, and has two children who are 13 and 12. Rosario sells clothes, shoes, perfumes, toys, and many other things that her clients order. 
She started working when she finished school at the age of 16. One day she went to a shop and saw that they were selling perfumes at low prices. She bought the perfumes and sold them. Afterwards she went to other shops and asked for bulk sale prices and increased her sales little by little.  
Rosario and her family also have a little farm in which she invests. Sometimes she uses her loans to buy fertilizers and seeds. After 8 years with FINCA Peru, Rosario says things have changed for the better because now she has her own house and more clients. 
Rosario needs a loan of 1000 soles so that she can invest in more sweatshirts, sheets, summer clothes, shoes, and perfumes. Her dream is to have her own shop when her children are older.

loans.use: more sweatshirts, sheets, summer clothes, shoes, and perfumes.

loans.name: Angèle Marei Marthe

texts.fr: Angèle est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 ans. Elle est couturière de profession, depuis 4 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO et le crédit qu'elle y reçoit lui permet de développer son activité de confection et vente de vêtements. Elle vend également des vêtements et draps de lit qu'elle importe de l'Europe. Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle aide à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Angele is a 42 year-old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 2 children. She is a seamstress by training, and for the past 4 years and a half she has been a member of the Community Bank Boucotte Place Gao. The loan she receives will help her with business where she makes and sells clothing. Aside from clothing she also sells linen that she imports from Europe. With the income she earns she contributes towards the improvement of the family's living conditions.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cook and serve porridge

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra D. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants. Elle réside à Amoussoukope. Son activité consiste à acheter du maïs dans les villages environnants et de venir les revendre au marché. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit faire des stocks afin d’éviter des ruptures de stocks et aussi accroître la capacité de son commerce. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abra D. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants. Elle réside à Amoussoukope. Son activité consiste à acheter du maïs dans les villages environnants et de venir les revendre au marché. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit faire des stocks afin d’éviter des ruptures de stocks et aussi accroître la capacité de son commerce. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de maïs pour stockage et revente

loans.name: San Francisco De Asís Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal San francisco D. Asís, se encuentra ubicado en L. Comunidad D. Pampabamba, en el distrito D. María Parado D. Bellido, provincia D. Cangallo, departamento D. Ayacucho. 

Eda es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Eda se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes y D. ropa en las ferias, en lo cual es apoyada por su familia. Eda, solicita un préstamo para poder comprar abarrotes en Ayacucho y ropa en L. capital, D. esa manera poder surtir sus negocios. Eda, se encuentra ahorrando para L. educación D. sus hijos.

Susana, es soltera, tiene un negocio en el cual venD. comida al público y también atienD. pedidos para compromisos. ElL., es apoyada por sus hermanos y por personal que contrata en ocasiones. Susana, requiere D. un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con mercadería y poder generar mas ventas.
texts.en:
The San Francisco D. Asís Communal Bank is located in the Pampabamba community in the María Parado D. Bellido district, Cangallo province, Ayacucho department. Eda is married and has three children. Eda sells groceries and clothing at the fairs. Her family helps her. Eda is asking for a loan to be able to buy groceries in Ayacucho and clothing in the capital. This way she will be able to stock her businesses. Eda is saving for her children’s education. Susana is single. She sells food to the public. She also takes orders for functions. Her siblings help her, and she hires people on occasion. Susana needs a loan to stock her business with merchandise to be able to generate mO. sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina es una empeñosa mujer de 39 años, vive con su esposo, José, y sus hijos; José Antonio de 18, Kevin de 14 y Estiven de 6 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se viene dedicando a la venta de golosinas en los ómnibus de transporte público, trabajo con el que se siente muy contenta, pues obtiene buenas ganancias. Lina está asociada con un grupo de amigas, quienes en conjunto ponen el capital para comprar golosinas al por mayor. Lina trabaja todos los días y ahora su esposo también ha incursionado en este negocio, entonces juntos obtienen mejores ingresos, lo lamentable es que no pueden pasar mucho tiempo con sus hijos. Lina tiene muchas esperanzas de seguir mejorando, para el futuro quiere tener un negocio en su propia casa, ya que sabe que la juventud no será eterna y debe asegurar su vejez.
Lina es una cliente muy antigua en MFP, anteriormente era parte de un banco comunal, pero ahora ya está trabajando sus créditos en forma individual. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más las golosinas, al igual que sus socias y así aumentará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lina is an enterprising 39 year old woman. She lives with her husband, José, and their children. José Antonio is 18, Kevin is 14, and Estiven is 6. They live in their own house. For eight years she has been selling sweets on public buses. She is very happy with her work; she gets good earnings. Lina is associated with a group of friends who put their money together to buy sweets wholesale. Lina works every day, and now her husband is also getting into this business. Together they get greater earnings. The sad part is that they cannot spend much time with their children. Lina hopes to continue improving. In the future she wants to have a business in her house. She knows that youth does not last forever, and she needs to provide for her old age. Lina has been a client of MFP for a long time. She was previously a part of a communal bank, but now she is working her loans as an individual. With the money she is asking for she will buy more sweets, like her colleagues, and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una alegre mujer D. 45 años, actualmente vive soL. en su casa propia. ElL. posee una bodega que implementó en su vivienda, donD. ofrece diferentes productos comestibles como: golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, arroz, azúcar, etc. y es por eso que su negocio es muy frecuentado. Además, cuenta con L. ventaja D. estar ubicada en un lugar por donD. transitan muchas personas. María está muy contenta porque su negocio crece poco a poco y piensa seguir invirtiendo en él.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda y así obtener más clienteL..
texts.en:
María is a happy 45 year old woman. She currently lives alone in her own house. She has a store that she set up in her house. She sells different food products like sweets, soft drinks, crackers, rice, and sugar, etc. That is why her business is highly frequented. Also, she has the advantage of being located in a place where lots of people travel. María is very happy because her business is growing little by little. She plans to keep investing in it. With the money she is now asking for she will buy more products to stock her store and get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Los Claveles De Pomabamba Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Los Claveles D. Pomabamba, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Pomabamba, en el distrito D. María Parado D. Bellido, provincia D. Cangallo, departamento D. Ayacucho. 

Rufina, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Rufina desD. muy temprana edad se dedicó a la venta D. animales, lo cual sigue haciendo hasta hoy con la ayuda D. su esposo y D. sus hijos. Negocio con el cual sostiene su hogar y educa a sus hijos. Rufina solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar más animales para continuar con sus ventas. 

Yolanda, es viuda y tiene 06 hijos. Yolanda se dedica a la compra y venta D. quesos, los cuales  trae D. las comunidades cercanas y venD. en su comunidad con la ayuda D. sus hijos menores. Yolanda, solicita un prestamo para poder adquirir mas quesos y D. esa manera tener que ofrecer mas variedad.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Claveles D. Pomabamba” is located in the community of Pomabamba, in the María Parado D. Bellido district, province of Cangello, in Ayachucho. Rufina is married and has three children. At an early age Rufina decided to make a living by selling animals which she still does today. Her husband and children help her with the work. She is able to maintain her household and proviD. her children with an education with the money she earns from this business. Rufina is asking for a loan to buy more animals with so she can continue with her sales. Yolanda is a widow and the mother of six children. Yolanda buys and sells cheeses for a living. She buys in the small communities nearby and then sells them in her community with the help of her younger children. Yolanda is asking for a loan to be able to purchase for cheese so she can offer more of a variety.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The communal bank "Los Claveles de Pomabamba" asks for a loan of 3100 soles so its members can invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo, José Carlos, su hijo David de 22, su nuera y su nieta recién nacida. Ella es docente de profesión y trabaja en una escuela de su localidad. Adicionalmente, junto a su esposo tiene un auto, con el que él realiza taxi y ella administra las ganancias. María quiere para el futuro tener un negocio más rentable y que pueda realizar en su casa, es por ello que está ahorrando el dinero necesario para hacerlo realidad, sabe que todo lo logrará a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, al igual que su esposo quien se esfuerza mucho por lograr sus objetivos.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando refaccionará su auto para que su esposo pueda brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and lives with her husband José Carlos, their son David (age 22), their daughter-in-law and newborn granddaughter. She is a teacher by profession and works at a local school. In addition, she and her husband own an automobile which he uses as a taxi while she handles the finances. María would like to have a more profitable business in the future that she can manage from home. Until then, she is saving money in order to make that happen. Anything that is worth accomplishing requires much effort and dedication, so she and her husband work hard to achieve their goals.

This is María’s first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. The money she is requesting will be used to repair her automobile so that her husband can provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo, Julio, que tiene 34 años y es albañil, ellos tienen una hija de 16 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una tienda que implementó en su casa. Este negocio le permite trabajar en su hogar y atender a su familia al mismo tiempo, aunque muchas veces no puede salir con libertad, ya que atiende de lunes a domingo y esto le resulta muy cansado, pero no se amilana, ya que sabe que todo es por un fin, pues gracias a su negocio su familia tiene seguridad económica. Patricia realiza su trabajo con gran alegría y está muy ilusionada de seguir mejorándolo, ya que quiere tener una tienda muy bien implementada para obtener mayor clientela.
Este es su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella es muy puntual en sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará golosinas para surtir su tienda, ya que son muy demandadas y así espera incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Patricia is 35 years old and lives with her husband Julio who is 34 years old and a bricklayer. They have a 16-year old daughter. For 2 years, she has made a living selling groceries in a store that she started in her home. This business allows her to work at home and take care of her family at the same time. However, she sometimes can't go out freely since her business is open Monday to Sunday. This is very tiring for Patricia but she doesn't give up as she knows that she does it for a great purpose. Thanks to her business her family has economic stability. Patricia works with great joy and is very eager to improve her business since she wants to have a better store to get more customers. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is very punctual at making her payments as are her follow members of the communal bank. With the money she is asking for, Patricia will purchase sweets to stock her store in hopes to increase her sales as they are on high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Mariama Siré

texts.fr: Mariama Siré D. est une femme de 67 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Kandialang Socé depuis 8 ans et y a eu 16 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe au niveau de son marché local un petit commerce de pâte d'arachide, d'oignon, de tomate et d'autres sortes de légumes.
texts.en:
Mariama Sire D. is a 67 year-old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 8 children; only one is in school. She has been a member of the Community Bank Kandialang Soce for the past 8 years and she seen success with 16 previous loans. She manages a small business in the local market selling peanut butter, onions, tomatoes and other types of vegetables.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small business.

loans.name: Rosas Group

texts.es:
Rosas es un grupo de 11 personas que forman parte del Centro Focal Collpani, una de sus integrantes es Elena T. de 54 años, vende carne hace dos años en su mismo domicilio y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Las demás integrantes tambien tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de abarrotes, fruta, café, api, cosméticos, detergentes, tenis, otras se dedican a actividades económicas de producción como es el tejido de manta y chompa.
Todas desean mejorar sus negocios, por lo que necesitan el crédito, algunas comprando mercadería como la carne, fruta de temporada, arroz, fideo, azucar,perfumes, detergentes y otras comprando materia prima como la lana.
texts.en:
Rosas [Roses] is a group of eleven people who make up part of the Collpani Regional Office. Elena T., 54, is one of its members. She has been selling meat in her own house for two years, and she needs a loan to buy merchandise. The rest of the members have their own businesses, including sales of groceries, fruits, coffee, Api [a sweetened corn and cinnamon drink], cosmetics, detergents, and sneakers. Other members are in business producing items such as hand-woven ponchos and sweaters. They all want to improve their businesses, so they need loans, some to buy merchandise like meat, seasonal fruit, rice, noodles, sugar, perfumes, and detergents, and others to buy raw materials, like wool.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Sun and Moon village bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children who are 24, 20, and 14 years old. The youngest is still in school. Silvia has a sewing business, and sells clothes for children and jump suits for schools. She began her business 5 years ago, receiving orders for her family’s workshop, where she had learned how to sew.

Recently, she bought a machine with her savings and with the help of her husband, and started her own sewing business. Silvia works alone in her house.
 
Silvia has been with FINCA for four years and since she joined things have changed for the better. With her loans, she has invested in her business and FINCA has also given her the opportunity to save. With her savings, Silvia was able to cover her children's needs.

Silvia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she is going to invest in materials, cloth and accessories, thread, and lint materials. Her dream is to create her own business, have machines and staff, and to have many locations.

loans.use: To buy materials, cloth and accessories, thread, and lint materials.

loans.name: Exito Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Éxito, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia D. Huanta a 48 km. del departamento D. Ayacucho, el cual esta ubicado a 2,625 msnm.

Fortuna es viuda y tiene 03 hijos, se dedica a vender comida, ella cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos quienes la ayudan en el negocio. Fortuna, solicita un préstamo con el cual implementará su negocio con muebles para la comodidad D. su clientes. Fortunata, está ahorrando  para pagar los estudios profesionales D. sus hijos.

Teresa es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, negocio en el cual recibe ayuda su esposo e hijos. Teresa desea abastecer su negocio con mas mercadería, por ello requiere D. un préstamo. Teresa tiene como meta el adquirir un auto, con el cual podría llevar mercadería a las demás comunidades.
texts.en:
The Éxito Communal Bank is located in the Huanta province, which is 48 km from the Ayacucho department. It is 2,625 meters above sea level. Fortuna is a widow with three children. She sells food. She counts on her children’s support, and they help her with the business. Fortuna is asking for a loan to set her business up with furniture to make it comfortable for her customers. Fortunata is saving to pay for her children’s education to become professionals. Teresa is married and has three children. She sells groceries; her husband and children help her. Teresa wants to stock her business with more merchandise. She needs a loan to do that. Teresa’s goal is to get a car, which she would be able to use to take her merchandise to other communities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Paraiso De Antapasco Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Paraíso D. Antapasco, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Antapasco, distrito D. San Antonio D. Antapasco, provincia D. Angaraes, departamento D. Ayacucho.

Eleodora es divorciada y tiene 01 hija. Eleodora se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cuyes, los cuales venD. en el mercado D. su comunidad, con el apoyo D. su hija. Eleodora, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual incrementara la crianza D. sus cuyes. Eleodora, tiene como meta el poder cultivar alfalfa para la alimentación D. sus cuyes.

Aurea es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Aurea como otras personas D. su comunidad se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cuyes, con el apoyo D. su esposo e hijos. Eleodora solicita un préstamo, con el cual cultivará alfalfa, la cual estará destina a la alimentación D. sus cuyes. Aurea destinará sus ahorros en la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Paraíso D. Antapasco Communal Bank is located in the Anapasco community, San Antonio D. Antapasco district, Angaraes province, Ayacucho department. Eleodora is divorced and has one daughter. Eleadora raises and sells guinea pigs. She sells them, with help from her daughter, in the community market. Eleadora needs a loan to expand her business of raising guinea pigs. Eleodora’s goal is to be able to grow alfalfa to feed her guinea pigs. Aurea is married and has three children. Aurea, like other people in the community, raises and sells guinea pigs. She does this with help from her husband and children. Eleodora is asking for a loan to grow alfalfa. The alfalfa is to feed her guinea pigs. Aurea’s savings are for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es:
Celia H. de 32 años, casada con tres hijos se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de chatarras como botellas, plásticos, cosas que tengan cobre y bronce, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 4 años, negocio que aprendió de su comadre, tiene su tienda en la ciudad de  El Alto avenida La Paz, donde adquiere y vende su mercadería, todos los días. Celia quiere ampliar su negocio y necesita el préstamo para seguir operando en su negocio.

Al igual que Celia las demás integrantes del grupo Rayito de Luna cuentan con diferentes negocios como la venta de fruta, verdura, jugo de quinua, llaucha (empanadas con mucho queso), ropa y tienda de abarrote.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Celia H. is 32, married, and has three children. She has a business of buying and selling junk like bottles, plastics, and things that have copper and bronze. She has been doing this work for four years. She learned the business from her friend. Her store, where she acquires and sells her merchandise everyday, is on La Paz Avenue in the city of El Alto. Celia wants to expand her business, and she needs a loan to continue operating her business. Like Celia, the other members of the Rayito de Luz Group has different businesses like selling fruit, vegetables, quinoa juice, “llaucha” (empanadas with a lot of cheese), clothes, and a grocery store. They all need the loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 1 Group

texts.en:
Arturo is the group coordinator of the solidarity group Unidos Venceremos (together we succeed) based in the rural area surrounding La Romana, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here he makes his home with his wife and three teenage children in a modest home of wooden walls and a tin roof. 

He came to Esperanza a year and a half ago, because he felt that our interest rates and services were significantly lower than the moneylenders in his neighborhood. He has successfully completed two loan cycles with Esperanza and is now requesting his third loan. With this loan he intends to purchase more clothing in bulk, which will cost less and allow him to gain more profits. This will support his business of selling clothing for adults from his home, a trade which he has been successfully plying for over a year now. He will use the profits from his business, which is his family's primary source of income, to purchase better food and school supplies for the children, to paint his house (an important first line defense against termites and weather) and if there is some money left over he would like to purchase a television for his family to enjoy (when there is power of course). His long term goal is to continue growing his business and provide a stable income in the future. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: La Union Lo Vecino 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ramon C. R. is a borrower from the city of San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group of borrowers, and his story represents similar businesses run by others in his group. Ramon is 35 years old, and has an 8 year old son, a 3 year old daughter, and a brand new baby girl who is just one month old. Ramon lives with his children in a home he rents on the bottom floor of his building. He also rents space for his shop in the same building.

Ramon is an electrician who builds inverters for his community. He has run his own business for the last four years, and hopes to continue expanding in the future. Power outages, humidity, and older electronics mean that his skills as an electrician are needed frequently. With this loan, Ramon hopes to build 20 electronic inverters that he can sell to his customers. This will increase his profit margin and allow him to expand his business.

In the past, Ramon's only loan options charged him huge amounts, as much as 20% per week. These loans were not feasible for him, but now through Esperanza his loans have become extremely helpful. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by hiring an employee and expanding his business to the sales of batteries and other electronics. This is Ramon's second loan through Esperanza, and he hopes that it will not be his last.

loans.use: To construct 20 more inverters.

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es: Este grupo “Semilla” esta representado por la señora Reynalde y conformada por 13 miembros 12 mujeres y un solo varón son gente realmente joven y dinámica, sus edades comprenden entre los 20 y 30 años pero a pesar de ello son personas responsables y muy puntuales como lo demostraron en las reuniones. La Mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como cosméticos, ropa, comida, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio,  pan y el varón se dedica a la venta de perfumes. Ellas notan la competencia pero pese a eso saben como salir adelante, el crédito esta destinado a la adquisición de mas mercadería y a la apertura de nuevos negocios que ya tienen planeados y el crédito ayuda a impulsar sus negocios y a mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. A pesar de ser su primer ciclo las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios y saben que el apoyo brindado por Agrocapital es importante para sacar a flote sus negocios para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Semilla” (Seed) Group is led by Sra. Reinalda and is comprised of 13 members (12 women and 1 man) who are really young and dynamic individuals. Their ages range between 20 and 30, but they are very responsible and punctual as demonstrated at their group meetings. Most members engage in retail business selling products such as cosmetics, clothing, food, groceries, and bread. The lone male of the group sells perfumes.

They are aware of the competition and know what they need to do get ahead. Their loan will be used to acquire more merchandise and open new businesses they have planned. This will enable them to grow their enterprises and improve their incomes so that they can improve the quality of life for their families. Even though this is their first loan cycle as a group, they already have experience working with solidarity loans. They know that the support they receive from Fundación Agrocapital is important to keep their businesses afloat and will help them succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nueva Jerusalén” esta representado por la señora Elvira y conformada por 14 miembros las cuales van cursando juntas ya su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como ropa, hamburguesas, abarrotes, cosméticos y productos D. limpieza. La competencia dentro del rubro D. venta D. es alta pero las socias saben bien como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su mercadería y mullirse D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a realizar mejor su trabajo para generar mayores ingresos que servirán para brindar a sus hogares una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya llevan cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas D. salir y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Jerusalén” (New Jerusalem) group is led by Sra. Elvira and composed of 14 members who are starting their third loan cycle together. They have demonstrated responsibility and honesty with the payments on their previous loans. Most of the members are involved retail businesses selling products such as clothing, hamburgers, groceries, cosmetics, and cleaning supplies. Competition in the sales business is high, but the members know what they need to do to get ahead because their families’ livelihoods depend on their success.

Their loan will be used to increase their inventories, purchase supplies, and acquire tools that will help them do a better job of generating more revenue. As a result, they can achieve a better quality of life. Regarding their credit experience, it was mentioned previously that they are starting their third loan cycle and have been successful and responsible with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.es: Las Socias del grupo “Las Palmas” esta representado por la señora Julia y conformada por 13 miembros jóvenes que comprenden entre los  20 a 40 años de edad, A pesar de ellos son personas alegres, unidas, responsables y honestas como lo han demostrado en sus ciclos anteriores. Dentro de las actividades que realizan las socias esta la venta de de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de pan, venta de ropa interior de forma ambulante y en puestos fijos. La competencia dentro del rubro de venta de productos es elevada pero las socias saben como salir adelante ya sea diversificando su mercadería o trasladando su puesto de venta a diferentes ferias locales, no les importa trabajas mas horas de las necesarias ya que algunas de ellas son madres solteras y sus hijos valen cualquier sacrificio ya que ellos son su razón de vivir. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición de mercadería, e insumos para hacer crecer sus negocios y mejor sus ingresos que ayudara a brindas a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya llevan cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas de salir y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Group “Las Palmas” (The Palms) is led by Sra. Julia and composed of 13 young members between the ages of 20 and 40. Even though they are a cheerful group, they have demonstrated unity, responsibility, and honesty throughout their previous loan cycles. The members are involved in retail businesses selling products such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food, bread, and lingerie. They sell their goods door-to-door and from established locations. Competition in the retail marketplace is high, but the members know how to cope in this environment by diversifying their merchandise or moving their vending locations around the various local fairs. They do not mind working long hours since most of them are single mothers who would make any sacrifice in order to support their children.

Their loan will be used to purchase goods and supplies to grow their businesses and increase their incomes so that they can provide their families with a better quality of life. With regard to their credit experience, the members have started their third loan cycle and have successfully demonstrated responsibility with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Bondadosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Bondadosas” están representadas por la señora Doris  y conformadas por 13 miembros de los cuales solo uno es varón, las socias van cursando juntas ya su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado unión, responsabilidad y ganas de salir adelante en sus negocios. La socias se dedican a la venta de productos como pan, comida, empanadas canastas, cosméticos, perfumes y la atención en Kioscos el varón se dedica a al albañilería y la presidenta es niñera por lo que siempre demuestra un espíritu joven. La competencia en especial en el rubro de ventas de productos es alta por lo que las socias se ven en la obligación de diversificar su mercadería o mover sus negocios a lugares con menor competencia es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para poder adquirir mercadería más competitiva y para poder adquirir sus propios puestos de trabajo en lugares mas competitivos y así poder generar mayores ingreso para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Group “Las Bondadosas” (The Kind-Hearted Ones) is led by Sra. Doris and consists of 13 members (12 women and 1 man). They are starting their third loan cycle together and have demonstrated unity, responsibility, and the desire to succeed in their businesses. The members engage in retail businesses selling products from their kiosks such as bread, food, empanadas, baskets, cosmetics, and perfumes. The male member works as a bricklayer. The president of the group is a nanny and has demonstrated her youthful spirit. Competition is especially high in the retail market, so the members are obligated to diversify their merchandise or move their vending posts to areas where this less competition.

They have requested a loan so that they can purchase merchandise to make them more competitive. They will also be able to acquire their own vending posts in places that are more competitive so that they can generate better earnings. Therefore, they will be able to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nueva Luz” esta representado por el señor Francisco y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando juntos su tercer ciclo demostrando unidad, honestidad y ganas de sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios. Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de tarjetas Viva Entel por mayor y mayor,  alguna de ellas venden ropa americanas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, venta de juguetes, salteñas, elaboración de prendas de vestir y pintura de viviendas. La competencia dentro de su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando capacidad para administrar sus recursos y ganas de trabajar como el hecho de hacer macitas y venderlas para recaudar fondos para su caja chica, son muy organizadas y muy trabajadoras.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Luz” (“New Light”) group has 12 members and is represented by Francisco. The group is in its third loan cycle and its members have demonstrated unity, honesty, and the desire to advance their small businesses. The members of the group have various businesses, which include selling Viva and Entel cellular phone cards, clothing from the United States, and “salteñas” (a Bolivian savory pastry). Other members own neighborhood grocery stores, make clothing, and paint houses. Each of the members of the group is very competent in their field and because of this they know how to advance in their chosen businesses.

This loan will be used to develop their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to increase their earnings. This will enable them to provide a better quality of life for their families.

The group is in its third loan cycle with this lending institution and has proven its capacity to administer its resources and the desire to work hard. For example, they made and sold pastries to raise money for a petty cash fund. They are very organized and very hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arturo Javier

texts.es: Es un cliente nuevo, tiene dos hijos pequeños y la esposa que trabaja como empleada y a la vez teje chompas. El señor Javier por el momento esta trabajando en una construccion en la zona de Achumani donde percibe ingresos semanalmente por un jornal entre 80 a 100 bolivianos diarios.  El señor no tiene deudas por pagar, es una familia joven y con buenas referencias en la zona .
texts.en:
He is a new client with young children. His wife works as a housekeeper and knits sweaters. At the moment, Mr. C. is working on a construction site in Achumani, where he earns 80 to 100 BOB daily. He does not have any outstanding debts. He has a young family and good references in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and materials

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mariposas” esta representado por la señora Carmen y conformado por 12 miembros las cuales han demostrado honradez y ganas D. salir adelante. Las señoras se dedican a diferentes actividades como por ejemplo Cristina hace bordados en sandalias ella lo realiza a mano en diversos colores y modelos, Maria Luisa trabaja hace 25 años con repostería como cubanitos dejando a los colegios y M., El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como pan, comida, cosméticos y a la elaboración D. tejidos a mano, como la competencia es alta en el M. las socias realizan entregas a domicilio o en mercados alejados. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. capital para la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para realizar un trabajo D. calidad y en mayor cantidad.  En cuanto a los antecedente crediticios  las socias van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando  ganas D. trabaja y salir adelante para poder darles a su familia una mejor vida y a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The “Mariposas” (“Butterflies”) group is represented by Carmen. Its 12 members have shown integrity and the desire to get ahead. The women have a variety of businesses. For example, Cristina hand-embroiders sandals in an array of styles and colors. Maria Luisa has sold pastries at high schools and in the local market for 25 years. The rest of the members of the group sell products such as bread, food, cosmetics, and hand-woven fabrics. As the local market is very competitive, the members proviD. home delivery or work in markets that are far away.

This loan will be used as working capital to purchase merchandise, supplies, and tools to proviD. quality products in greater quantity. The group is in its third loan cycle and its members have demonstrated the desire to work hard and get ahead in order to proviD. their families a better life and their children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Puntuales" esta representados por la señora Celina y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se encuentran comprendidos entre los 20 a 55 años son personas dinámicas y activas como lo han ido demostrando en sus anteriores ciclos. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. distintos productos abarrotes, comida, cosméticos, pan y la presidenta se dedica a la costura D. prendas D. vestir. En cuanto a la competencia las socias saben como controlarla gracias a su experiencia y a su clientela Leal. El destino del crédito es para hacer crecer sus negocios, aumentar su capital, adquirir material para agrandar sus negocios y generar mas ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mayor oportunidad en al vida. Dentro D. la Institución van cursando su tercer ciclo sin ninguna dificultar demostrando tener ganas para sacar adelante sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familia que es su razón para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The “Las Puntuales” (“The Punctual Ones”) group is represented by Celina and is comprised of 12 members from 20 to 55 years of age. In their previous loan cycles they have proven themselves dynamic and active. The majority of the members are engaged in selling various products, including groceries, food, cosmetics, and bread. The president of the group sews clothing. The members' experience and loyal customers enable them to keep pace with their competition.

This loan will be used to develop their businesses, increase their capital, acquire materials to expand their businesses, and generate more income to give their families greater opportunities in life. This is their third loan with this lending institution and they have not had any difficulties with the previous two. They have proven their desire to get ahead in their businesses to better support their families, which is their reason to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
"Doña Silvia C. T. tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra casada con Victor C. Villca, los mismos viven en domicilio propio en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosi.Tanto esposo y esposa se dedican a la confección de chamarras, los mismos que los venden en la ciudad de Potosi y Tarija.

El crédito solicitado por doña Silvia esta orientado a la compra de tela de paño por rollos, esto se debe a que le permite disminuir su costo de producción y mejorar de está manera sus ingresos."
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia C. T. is 47-years-old. She is married to Victor C. Villca, and they live in their own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area. Both husband and wife make jackets, which they then sell in Potosi and Tarija.

The loan Silvia is requesting will be used to purchase wool in bulk, so that she can reduce production costs and boost profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Estrellas” están representados por el señor Gabriel Marcelo y conformado por 12 socias entre las cuales solo existen 2 varones, las edades D. los miembros oscila entre los 23 a 55 años D. edad pero todos tiene sus fuentes D. ingreso a través D. pequeños negocios como  a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta D. pan, venta D. dulces caseros, ropa, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida y la atención en lavaderos D. autos. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y una mejor educación para su hijos. En cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios se encuentran cursando su tercer ciclo con la Fundación Agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. crecer para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the “Estrellas (Stars)” group are represented by Mr. Gabriel Marcel and consists of 12 members, among which are only two men. The ages of the members varies between 23 and 55 years, but all of them have streams of income through their small businesses such as the sale of cosmetics by catalog, the sale of bread, the sale of homemaD. sweets, clothes, a grocery store, the sale of prepared meals, and car washing. The competition in their area is high, but in spite of that they know they know that they can get ahead in what they do.

The loan is destined for the growth of their business through the purchase of merchandise, consumables, and tools for increasing their income which will permit them to give their families a better standard of living and a better education for their children. In terms of their credit history, they are in their third cycle with la Fundacion Agrocapital and have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, and the desire to grow and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Las Cumplidas Group

texts.es: Las Socias del Banco Comunal LAS CUMPLIDAS  son del mismo barrio, todas tienen negocios propios y saben como salir adelante, la representante del grupo es la señora Nancy y al igual que sus compañeras es una persona dinámica y muy trabajadora , ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa  u otro tipo D. mercadería en la feria D. Barrio lindo y por las noches venD. comida al paso el resto D. sus compañeras también se dedican a la venta D. productos como abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, juguetes, pan, zapatos y otros productos D. acuerdo a la época o a la moda. La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando capacidad para administrar sus recursos y ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Las Cumplidas (The Dependables) come from the same neighbourhood; each one has their own business and they know how to get ahead. The representative of the group is Nancy; just like her colleagues she is a dynamic and very hard-working person. She sells clothes and other types of merchandise in the Barrio Lindo market and at night she sells fast food. The rest of her colleagues sell products such as groceries in the neighbourhood stores, toys, bread, shoes and other products according to the season or the fashion. Competition in their line of work is high, due to this they know how to keep their business going. This loan is intended to increase the growth of their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, raw materials and tools to improve their incomes which will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. In relation to their lending experience, the members are due to complete their third cycle with Kiva's field partner institution, demonstrating capacity to administer their resources and desire to work to keep their families going.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Salesiano Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal “SALESIANO” Es un  grupo D. 13  personas D. las cuales11 son mujeres y 2 son varones representados por L. señora Luisa que van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. L. institución, pese a ello han D. mostrado muchas ganas D. salir adelante en las reuniones del grupo. L. mayoría del grupo se dedican al comercio D. diferentes productos como L. venta D. zapatos, frutas, cosméticos, dulces; también se dedican a actividades como L. confección D. prendas D. vestir, elaboración D. pan y como empleados en las empresas. L. competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante L. actividad económica a L. que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con L. compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a L. experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pese a que es su primer ciclo gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a L. Fundación Agrocapital y están dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus pequeños negocios ya que D. ello dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank “Salesiano” is a group of 13 people, of which 11 are women and two are men, represented by Luisa who is in her first cycle with the institution. Still, they have demonstrated a strong will to succeed in the group meetings. The majority of the group works in businesses such as sales of shoes, fruit, make-up, and sweets. They also work in the manufacture of clothing, bread baking, and others are employed in businesses. Their skill in each area is at a high level, and this shows that they will succeed in whatever business they are in. The loan is designated for the growth of their businesses, the purchase of merchandise, incomes and supplies to improve their earnings, which will permit them to give their families a better quality of life. Though this is their first cycle, the members already have experience with credit in groups thanks to credits from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are ready to move forward in their small businesses since their families depend on it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es: El grupo “Santiago” están representados por la señora Victoria y conformado por 15 miembros D. los cuales 3 son varones y 12 mujeres, ellos  se dedican a la venta D. CDs, ropa nueva y usada,  venta D. comida, zapatos y accesorios para celulares; una gran parte D. los socios realiza la apertura D. su negocios a la 6:00 D. la mañana y cierran a las 8:00 D. la noche debido a la competencia que existe en el mercado, debiendo realizar el doble D. esfuerzo para conseguir mas ingreso ya que cada uno D. las socias representa el pilar del  sustento D. sus familias. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pese a que es su primer ciclo gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y están dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus pequeños negocios ya que D. ello dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Santiago” are represented by Victoria and is composed of 15 members of which 3 are men and 12 are women. They sell CDs, new and second hand clothing, food, shoes and mobile phone accessories. Most of the members open their stores at 6 in the morning and close at 8 at night. Due to the competition in the market, they have to double their efforts to obtain more income as each one of the members represents the breadwinner of their families. This loan will develop their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, raw materials and tools to increase their earnings, which will enable them to give their families a better quality of life. In regards to their loan experience, the members already have experience in solidarity groups, and though this is their first loan, thanks to loans maD. through similar institutions to Fundación Agrocapital they are ready and willing to keep their small businesses going as their families depend on them.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: La Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Santa Cruz” esta representado por la señora Olivia  y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales van cursando su primer, pero a pesar de ello han demostrado ser gente trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a actividades como la venta de pan, comida, cosméticos, refrescos con empanadas y al transporte publico de pasajeros. Pese la competencia del mercado los socios saben como salir adelante es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para poder realizar inversiones de nuevos negocios como la crianza de animales que es mucho mas rentable y para ello necesitan mucho material, insumos y herramientas para poder generar mejores ingresos para poderles brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pese a que es su primer ciclo gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y están dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus pequeños negocios ya que de ello dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “La Santa Cruz” is represented by Mrs. Olivia and it includes 14 members; they are participating in their first loan but have demonstrated to be hard-working people with a desire to get ahead in life. The majority of the members are involved in various businesses such as selling bread, food, cosmetics, refreshments with pastries, and public transportation. In spite of the market competition, the members know how to get ahead; for this reason, they are requesting a loan to invest in new businesses such as raising animals which is more profitable but requires raw material, supplies, and tools. The higher income would enable them to give their families a better quality of life. In regards to their credit history, considering this is their first loan, the members already have experience with solidarity groups and loans from other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital, and they are prepared to make their small business succeed since their families depend on it.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo San Martín” esta representado por la señora Marcelina y conformado por 16 miembros a pesar D. ser un grupo numeroso son muy unidos y dinámicos como la han demostrado en su anterior ciclo. Este grupo se dedica a la actividad comercial como a la venta D. abarrotes, comida, pan, salchichas, empanadas y cosméticos, los otros socios se dedican al transporte público, a la construcción D. viviendas, soldadura D. metales y a la prestación D. servicios.  La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia ya que van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. sacar adelante sus negocios, agradecen el apoyo económico que les brinda la institución porque gracias a su confianza su familia gozara D. una mejor calidad D. vida y D. una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The group "San Martín” is represented by the Señora Marcelina and consists of 16 members. Despite being a large group they are very united and dynamic, as they have demonstrated in their previous loan cycle. This group is involved in various commercial activities such as the sale of groceries, food, bread, sausages, empanadas (pastries with meat fillings), and cosmetics. The other members are involved in public transportation, housing construction, metal welding, and the furnishing of services. The competition within their areas is very strong, and they know that they must continue to move ahead in the economic activity in which they are engaged. This loan will be used to support the growth of their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, supplies and tools in order to improve their incomes which will permit them to give their families a better quality of life. As for credit experience, the members already have experience, given that they are pursuing their second loan cycle demonstrating responsibility, honesty and the desire to carry their businesses forward. They appreciate the economic support that the institution provides them because thanks to their trust, their families will enjoy a better quality of life and a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Rosa es casada, tiene 37 años y 7 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de rosa son educar a sus hijos y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank, Banco Comunal Paraíso.
