Rosa is married, 37 years old and has 7 children. Rosa has a store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits. She works everyday with the help of her husband.

Rosa needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Rosa’s dreams are to educate her children and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es:
Eustaquia es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Eustaquia es casada, tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, Eustaquia tiene una Bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Eustaquia necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Eustaquia sueña con educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eustaquia is a member of the community bank, Banco Comunal Paraíso.

Eustaquia is married, 54 years old and has 8 children. Eustaquia has a store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits. She works everyday with the help of her daughter.

Eustaquia needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Eustaquia’s dream is to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Dina Susana

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Dina es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, vive en el Distrito de Quinua, Dina tiene un puesto en el mercadillo del Distrito en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Dina tiene un carro con el cual realizan transporte de pasajeros.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para la mejora de la puerta de su casa.
Los sueños de Dina son comprar otro carro, construir un hostal y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the community bank, Banco Comunal Paraíso.

Dina is married, 40 years old and has 3 children. She lives in the Quinua district. Dina has a stand in the District market where she sells food. She works everyday with the help of her children. Dina has a car with which she offers tranportation to passengers.

Dina needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar and to fix the door of her house.

Dina dreams of buying another car, constructing a hostel, and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar and to fix the door of her house.

loans.name: Irma Maria

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Irma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hija, Irma vende leña en su casa, además Irma junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una puerta para su casa.
Los sueños de Irma son progresar mas y comprar otro carro moderno.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Communal Bank “Paraíso” (Paradise). She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter. She sells firewood from her home. In addition, Irma’s husband has a car that he drives as a taxi through the streets of Ayacucho.

Irma needs a loan of 900 soles so that she can purchase a door for her house. She hopes to keep improving and would like to buy another contemporary car.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a door for her house

loans.name: 22 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El grupo “22 de Agosto” esta representado por la señora Marioly y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución, la mayoría de los socios se dedica  a la venta de pan, empanadas y a la prestación de servicios. La competencia dentro de su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pese a que es su primer ciclo gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y están dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus pequeños negocios ya que de ello dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The “22 de Agosto” (August 22nd) Group is led by Sra. Marioly and consists of 12 members who are starting their first loan cycle with the Institution. Most of the members either sell products, such as bread or empanandas, or provide services. Competition is high in the marketplace, but they know how to get ahead in their respective businesses.

Their loan will be used to grow their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools needed to increase their earnings and improve the quality of life for their families. Regarding their credit experience, the members have worked with solidarity loans before at other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are prepared to succeed in their small businesses because their families depend on them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas.
Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Maria tiene un pequeño restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado cerca de un terminal terrestre, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
Maria sueña con tener otro negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a partner of the Banco Comunal Orquideas. She is married, 47 years old, and has 6 children. She has a small restaurant in a rented space, located near a bus station. With the help of her daughters, she works there every day. Maria needs a loan of 900 soles, which will be invested in purchasing soft drinks, rice, and sugar. She dreams of having another business and improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of soft drinks, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Paulina Aydde

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas.
Paulina es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Paulina junto a su esposo tienen una empresa de transporte de carga, además brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros al distrito de Socos.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Paulina son tener una ferretería.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Orquídeas” (Orchids). She is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children. She and her husband manage a freight company. They also provide transportation services for passengers in the Socos District.

Paulina needs a loan of 900 soles in order to buy tires. She dreams of opening a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas.
Eva es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Eva tiene 2 carros con los que realiza transporte de pasajeros a la selva ayacuchana, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo y un chofer.
Eva necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Eva son tener otro negocio y tener mas capital.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Communal Bank “Orquídeas” (Orchids). She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children. Eva has two cars that are used for transporting passengers through the Ayacuchan jungle. The vehicles are operated by her husband and another driver.

Eva needs a loan of 450 soles in order to buy tires. She dreams of having another business and acquiring more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Beatriz es soltera, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, Beatriz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, también Beatriz tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir.
Beatriz necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Beatriz son implementar su negocio con mas productos, mejorar su casa y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 47 years old, single, and has 4 children. Beatriz manages a store from her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit. She also has a small dressmaking shop.

Beatriz needs a loan of 1500 soles in order to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of stocking her business with more products, making improvements to her home, and adding a second floor to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Iris Mercedes

texts.es:
Iris es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Iris es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Iris junto a su esposo tienen un taller de reparaciones y venta de relojes en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad.
Iris necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de relojes y pilas.
Los sueños de Iris son mejorar su terreno y tener un recreo, comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Iris is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children. Iris and her husband have a store, located in the central part of the city, where they repair and sell watches.

Iris needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy watches and batteries. She dreams of making improvements to her land, taking a vacation, and buying a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase watches & batteries

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Sonia es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Sonia junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos de moto, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuesto de moto.
Los sueños de Sonia son terminar de construir su hostal.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. Sonia and her husband have a store in a rented location where they sell motorcycle parts. They acquire their inventory from the city of Lima.

Sonia needs a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy motorcycle parts. She dreams of finishing the construction of her hostel.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Julia es casada, tiene 62 años y 5 hijos, Julia junto a su familia tienen un Colegio llamado Raúl P., Julia es la Promotora D. la institución educativa.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 3500 soles dinero que será invertido como parte D. pago D. un local.
Los sueños D. Julia son implementar una clínica para su hija y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 62 years old, married, and has 5 children. Julia and her family operate the Raúl P. School. She serves as the Director of this educational institution.

Julia needs a loan of 3500 soles to be used as partial payment to establish a site for the school. She dreams of starting a clinic for her daughter and buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment to establish a site for a school

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Cirila es casada, tiene 55 años y 5 hijos, Cirila tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. repuestos D. carros actividad que realiza todos los días, mientras que su esposo tiene un taller mecánico. Además Cirila tiene un puesto en el mercado Jesús nazareno en donD. venD. jugos.
Cirila necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. repuestos.
Los sueños D. Cirila son construir el segundo piso D. su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Alianza Microfinance Institute.

Cirila is a 55-year-old married mother with 5 children. She has a shop in her home in which she sells auto parts every day, while her husband works at an auto repair shop. Additionally, Cirila has a stand at the Jesús Nazareno Market, where she sells fruit juices.

Cirila needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing spare parts.

She dreams of building a second floor in her house and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase auto parts

loans.name: Publia

texts.es:
Publia es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Publia es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Publia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos de carros, además tiene un taller mecánico que esta en administración de su hijo mayor.
Publia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Publia sueña con ampliar su negocio, terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Publia is a member of the Alianza Microfinance Institute.

Publia is a 42-year-old woman with 3 children and a common law spouse. She rents out a business space in which she sells car parts. Additionally, she has her own automotive repair shop, which is managed by her eldest son.

Publia needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing parts.

She dreams of expanding her business, of finishing her home construction, and of her children completing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car parts

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Gladys es soltera, tiene 44 años y 1 hijo, Gladys tiene un molino de grano en su casa ubicado en una avenida concurrida, en donde brinda los servicios de molienda y también procesa cereales que vende en los mercados.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada y quinua.
Los sueños de Gladys son ampliar sus negocios, su hijo culmine sus estudios y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Alianza Microfinance Institute.

Gladys is a 44-year-old single mother with 1 son. She has a mill in her house, which is located on a bustling street. She provides grinding services, as well as processes grains, which she then sells at several markets.

Gladys needs a 1,400.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing wheat, barley and quinoa.

She dreams of expanding her businesses and opening her own restaurant. She also hopes to see her son complete his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley and quinoa

loans.name: Flora Cirila

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Flora es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Flora viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas, abarrotes y D. las ferias compra cereales, animales, productos que comercializa en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Flora necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa.
Los sueños D. Flora son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, mejorar sus negocios y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Alianza Microfinance Institute.

Flora is a 48-year-old married mother with 5 children. She travels to several different markets throughout her region to sell fruits, vegetables, and provisions. At those markets, she purchases grains, animals, and other products, which she then sells at the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Flora needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing potatoes.

She hopes that her children will complete their studies, that her businesses will improve, and that she will be able to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de extinguidores, sus clientes son generalmente transportistas de su localidad, quienes deben tener uno en su vehículo como medida de seguridad. Elvira trabaja junto a su esposo ofreciendo durante todo el día estos artículos y como es una medida obligatoria para los choferes de los diferentes vehículos, logra varios pedidos que le dejan ganancias satisfactorias. 
Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete nuevamente a aunar esfuerzos por el bienestar común. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la compra de más extinguidores.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 35-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her husband and 3 children. For 11 years, she has been selling fire extinguishers. Her customers are primarily drivers in the area who must have a fire extinguisher in their vehicles as a safety precaution. Elvira works alongside her husband, selling products all day. Since it is mandatory for drivers of many types of vehicles to have extinguishers, she manages to get in many orders and satisfactory profits. This is the second time that she requests a loan from MFP. She feels very happy to be a part of her communal bank, which is why she is committed to once again combine efforts for the common good. The money that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing more fire extinguishers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Karol

texts.es:
Karol tiene 23 años y vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 3 años vende cosméticos y productos de belleza, su técnica de ventas consiste en  mostrar su catalogo de productos a las personas que ella conoce, es estudiante universitaria y sus compañeras son sus principales clientes. Vende todos los días y está constantemente recolectando las cuotas pactadas de los productos que ha logrado vender al crédito. Este negocio le ha permitido solventar sus estudios y aportar a la economía de su hogar, lo que la anima a seguir trabajando de esta manera.
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y se compromete a trabajar por el bienestar del grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de cosméticos para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Karol is 23-years-old and lives at home with her parents. She has been selling cosmetics and beauty products for the past 3 years. Her sales technique consists of showing a catalogue of her products to people she knows. She is a college student and her classmates are her main customers. She sells her products every day and she is constantly collecting payments for her products that have been sold on credit. This business has allowed her to pay for her studies and support her family, both which have inspired her to continue working. This is the second time Karol has received a loan from MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma). She is a member of a communal bank and she is committed to working for the well-being of the group. The money she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase stock of merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años, vive con sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Ella tiene 22 años de experiencia de dedicarse al comercio, actualmente vende ropa de manera ambulante en la feria comercial de su ciudad, todos los fines de semana. Las prendas que ofrece son de acuerdo a la temporada del año y a precios muy accesibles. En algunas ocasiones la acompañan sus hijos a su trabajo y la ayudan con la atención a los clientes. Para Maria, su negocio es gran disfrute, además, tiene habilidad para las ventas, por lo que mantiene su negocio con ganancias regulares. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y en su anterior su crédito demostró ser muy puntual en sus pagos, razón por la cual fue considerada para tener un nuevo. El dinero que solicita será destinado a la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her 6 children. She has 22 years of business experience selling clothing as a traveling merchant at the city’s trade fair every weekend. Maria offers her products based on the season and the prices are very affordable. Her children accompany her on occasion and help attend to the customers. For Maria, her business provides great enjoyment. She has excellent sales skills which has enabled her to maintain her business and generate a regular income.

This is Maria’s second loan with MFP. She demonstrated punctuality with the payments from her previous loan, so she was considered to receive another one. The money she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
Nadia tiene 29 años y hace 4 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de prendas de vestir, específicamente polos para niños y niñas, los cuales vende ofreciendo a sus amistades y vecinos, y en otras ocasiones de manera ambulante. Su habilidad para el comercio le permite obtener las ganancias que se pone como meta. Su deseo es incrementar la mercadería que tiene para incrementar sus ganancias.
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contenta de ser una de las integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de mayor cantidad de polos para niños y niñas.
texts.en:
Nadia is 29 years old. Four years ago, she decided to start a business selling clothing, specifically polo shirts for boys and girls. She offers her products to friends and neighbors, and sometimes she sells them on the street. Her business enables her to earn the income necessary for her to achieve her goals. She desires to increase her inventory of merchandise so that she can generate better earnings.

This is Nadia’s second loan with MFP. She is very happy to be a member of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a large quantity of polo shirts for boys and girls.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of children's polo shirts

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y su hijo de 4 años en la casa de sus padres. Ya son 7 años los que se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su propia camioneta, la cual es su herramienta de trabajo. Percy cubre la ruta dentro de su ciudad en la zona urbana, todos los días. Para este trabajo tiene la ayuda de su cobrador, que es quien controla el ingreso económico de los pasajes de sus clientes. Debido a sus años de experiencia ha visto la rentabilidad de su negocio a pesar de las dificultades que se pueden presentar, como cuando su movilidad necesita de reparación que requiera dejar de trabajar obligatoriamente un día. Percy desea tener una camioneta moderna para mejorar el servicio que brinda. 
Esta es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es uno integrante muy responsable y activo de su banco comunal, reafirmando su compromiso en este nuevo crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando será para utilizado en la compra de repuestos para su camioneta y el mantenimiento mecánico de la misma.
texts.en:
Percy is 31 years old. He lives with his partner and their 4 year old son in his parents’ house. He already has 7 years of experience providing transportation services to passengers in his own van. Percy’s route runs through the urban areas of the city, which he travels every day. For his work, he has the assistance of a dispatcher who controls the number of passengers he can take at one time. Due to his years of experience, Percy has been able to maintain a profitable business even when he encounters difficulties or experiences work stoppages in order have his vehicle repaired. Percy would like to have a later model van so that he can improve his service.

This will be Percy’s second loan with MFP. He is a very responsible and active member of his Communal Bank and reaffirms his commitment with this new loan. The money he requested will be used to purchase spare parts for his van and pay for maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs & maintenance to his van

loans.name: Yelka

texts.es:
Yelka tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres. Desde hace 2 años y medio decidió  tener su propia fuente de ingresos vendiendo productos de primera necesidad, los cuales comercializa en su misma casa, que es arrendada. Ella abre su tienda todos los días y los fines de semana, vende cervezas, pues es un producto muy rentable. Yelka está muy contenta con las ventajas de tener su propio negocio y desea para más adelante tener una tienda más grande donde ofrezca gran variedad de mercadería. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de continuar con la misma actitud de participación activa en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado en la compra de mercadería en productos comestibles de primera necesidad, como arroz, azúcar y leche.
texts.en:
Yelka is 23 years old and lives with her parents. She started her own business 2½ years ago selling basic necessities in order to earn her own income. Her business operates out of her family’s rented house. Yelka opens her shop every day, even on weekends when beer is her most profitable product. She is very happy with the advantages of having her own business. Sometime later, she would like to have a larger shop where she can offer a wider variety of merchandise.

This is Yelka’s second loan with MFP. She looks forward to continuing her active participation with her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, and milk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities such as rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer muy atenta, tiene 51 años, es separada, tiene 5 hijos y actualmente vive sola en su casa. Anteriormente se dedicaba a diversos oficios a fin de solventar sus necesidades, pero la mayoría de sus ganancias las gastaba en el pago del alquiler de su cuarto mensualmente. Después de mucho trabajo y esfuerzo logró comprar un terreno donde construyó su casa de madera y desde entonces ha dejado de hacer trabajos pesados. Con su casa propia, Gloria optó por dedicarse a la venta de bebidas y licor de “uña de gato”, el cual es usado como medicina natural y es muy demandado por sus clientes.
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrando ser una cliente responsable y muy interesada en el progreso de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de néctares y diversas bebidas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very considerate woman. She is 51 years old, separated, and has 5 children. Gloria currently lives by herself in her own home. She previously held a variety of jobs in order to meet her expenses, with most of her earnings going toward her monthly rent. After much work and effort, she managed to buy a piece of land where she built a wooden house and has since stopped working heavily. From her own home, Gloria decided to sell beverages and “cat’s claw” elixir, which is used as a natural medicine and in high demand by her customers.

This is Gloria’s second loan with MFP. She has demonstrated that she is a responsible client and very interested in the progress of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be used to buy nectars and various beverages to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nectars and various beverages to restock her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 44 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos viven en su casa. Desde hace 22 años se dedica al comercio de comestibles en su misma casa, la cual está ubicada frente al parque principal de su localidad, por ello, sus principales consumidores son los jóvenes, pues los productos que más vende son las golosinas y bebidas, en un segundo plano, los abarrotes y verduras. Julia atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche y cuando sale de compras su esposo se queda atendiendo su tienda, pues esta pareja no desea cerrar ni un solo día para no perder clientela, pues gracias a ellos logran reunir poco a poco sus ganancias, las cuales invierten en la educación superior de sus hijos.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy responsable y participativa en las reuniones y decisiones de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará gran variedad de golosinas para satisfacer a su principal clientela, los jóvenes.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old. She and her partner have 5 children, of whom 2 still live with her at home. For 22 years, she has been engaged in selling groceries out of her house, which is located in front of the main park in her area. As a result, most of her customers are young. Her best selling products are candy and soft drinks, followed by groceries and vegetables. Julia opens her store at 6am and closes at 11pm. When she is shopping for supplies, her husband tends to the store because she does not want to close and chance losing customers. Thanks to the earnings that she has accumulated over time, she has been able to provide her children with a higher education.

This is Julia’s second loan with MFP. She is a very responsible client who participates in the meetings and decisions of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of candy to satisfy her main customers – young people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy to add to her inventory

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos; vive junto a su esposa en Batangrande, distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Llevan 8 años viviendo en la zona y sus hijos viven en la ciudad de Chiclayo debido a que estudian allá, el se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, y en esta temporada ha sembrado maíz blanco y maíz amarillo duro en un terreno ubicado en la parte posterior de su hogar.

El también cría algunas vacas que le proveen de leche para venderla a una empresa acopiadora de la zona que a la vez distribuye el producto a una empresa procesadora de leche.

Adriano desea mantener su cultivo con riegos y fertilizantes, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles para seguir sacando adelante a su negocio.

El planea seguir sembrando y comercializar él mismo los productos que cosecha, para así sacar adelante a su  familia, sus vecinos lo estiman mucho ya que lo consideran un padre responsable y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Adriano is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives with his wife in Batangrande, Pitipo District, Ferreñafe Province, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has lived in this area for 8 years, while his children live in the city of Chiclayo where they study. Adriano is engaged in agriculture, and this season he has planted white corn and yellow corn in the field located behind his house.

He also breeds some cows that provide milk that he sells to a collection company in the area which in turn distributes the product to a milk processing company.

Adriano wants to maintain his crop with irrigation and fertilizers. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2500 soles so that he can move his business forward.

He plans to continue planting and selling his crops in order to support his family. His neighbors feel he is a responsible father and a very hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertlizers & pesticides to maintain his corn crop

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda es una mujer muy dinámica de 42 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, el último de ellos vive con ella y su esposo acompañándoles en una casa alquilada. Hace 26 años dejó su tierra natal para ocupar un puesto en la municipalidad de un centro poblado aledaño al suyo. Desde entonces, vive en dicho lugar, encariñándose mucho con toda la gente. Por tal motivo decidió emprender un negocio propio, el cual tiene productos muy variados, diferenciándose de los demás establecimientos. En su mini market, Magda ofrece útiles escolares, cosméticos, comestibles y hasta condimentos molidos, esta diversidad de productos le ha permitido ganar mucha clientela y a la vez hacerse muy conocida. Por ello, atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, brindándoles a sus clientes un buen trato y una sonrisa acogedora, de este modo Magda reúne las ganancias necesarias que le permiten solventar los estudios de sus hijos en la ciudad de Lima.
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, en su anterior préstamo demostró puntualidad en sus pagos y un buen desempeño como tesorera de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de accesorios de uso personal y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Magda is a very dynamic 42 year-old woman. She is married and she has 4 kids, with the youngest still living with her and her husband in a rented house. Twenty-six years ago she left her native land to run a stand in the municipality of Aledano Al Suyo. Since then, she has been living there and she has grown very fond of the people. For this reason she set up her own business through which she sells various products, making her business unique from all the others. In her mini-market, Magda sells school supplies, cosmetics, food and even ground spices. The great variety in the products she sells has won her a considerable clientele, making her very well known. She runs her business from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day, so that she might provide her clients with good service and a welcoming smile. Magda earns enough income this way to be able to pay for her childrens' schooling in the city of Lima.

This is the second loan she has received through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). Through her previous loan she was always on time with her payments and she was a wonderful treasurer for the community bank. The funds she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of person care items, as well as under garments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her supply of merchandise.

loans.name: Walter Agustín

texts.es:
Walter es casado, tiene 54 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y una de sus tres hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene 20 años trabajando como transportista, eventualmente alquilaba vehículos para ganarse el sustento familiar, luego pudo comprarse un auto en el año 2006, actualmente utiliza este vehículo como herramienta de trabajo, está asociado a una empresa de taxis que brinda sus servicios a los clientes del centro comercial más grande de la ciudad.

Este es su segundo préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa, el primero lo utilizó para cambiar el sistema de su auto y empezar a usar gas combustible, ahora se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, ya que, debido al continuo uso, está empezando a sufrir diversas fallas mecánicas en el motor.

El planea crear un pequeño negocio de alquiler y venta de prendas de vestir para seguir ayudando a la hija con la que viven a culminar sus estudios, además desean brindarle a su hijo mayor la oportunidad de culminar sus estudios superiores, los cuales interrumpió para irse a trabajar a Cuenca, Ecuador.

Walter es considerado como un cliente excelente por nuestra Institución ya que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Walter is married, he is 54 years old and he lives together with his wife and one of their three children in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, located 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been working as a taxi driver for the past 20 years. He started out renting cars in order to earn the family income, but later in 2006 he was able to buy his own car. Currently he still uses that car to work. He is a member of a taxi company and he provides his services to clients in the largest shopping center in the city.

This is his second loan with Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner). The first loan was used to change the fuel system in his car to use natural gas. The loan he is currently requesting is in the amount of 1600 nuevos soles which he will invest in maintenance repairs for his car. Given the continuous use of his car it is starting to show several mechanical problems.

He also plans to set up a shop where he will sell clothing so that he can continue to support his daughter with her studies. They also wish to provide their eldest son with the opportunity to finish his post-secondary education. He interrupted his schooling because he needed to work in the city of Cuenca, Ecuador.

Walter is considered to be an excellent client because he has demonstrated great responsibility and timeliness with hsi payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the maintenance and repair of his car.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y 6 de sus 7 hijos a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el sector La Balsa, Batangrande, ubicado en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe.

Ella es natural de Cutervo, Cajamarca, y llegó a vivir a Batangrande hace 6 años, hace 2 años se mudó al sector La Balsa y desde hace 5 años se dedica a la ganadería, ahora trabaja en esa actividad junto a su marido ya que es el único ingreso estable con el que sustentan su economía diaria.

Actualmente tiene cuatro vacas y cuatro toros, sus vacas producen en conjunto diariamente 15 litros, cada litro es comprado a 0,92 céntimos por la empresa acopiadora del lugar que, a su vez, los vende a una de las principales empresas productoras de lácteos del país.

Paralelamente siembra maíz chala en una pequeña parcela cercana para alimentar a su ganado pero lo que siembra regularmente no basta para alimentarlo, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para hacer crecer la producción lechera de sus animales.

Ella desea a largo plazo comprar una vaca de raza Holstein, ya que las que tiene son criollas y no tiene el índice de producción que ella desea obtener, por otro lado desea esperar a que sus toros se desarrollen completamente para empezar a utilizarlos en trabajo de campo.

Su esposo también trabaja eventualmente como peón agrícola, y entre ambos tratan de sacar adelante a sus hijos, 4 de ellos aún estudian. María es una persona muy conocida por los vecinos de la zona, es muy alegre, optimista y le gusta colaborar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and six of their seven children. They live 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in the sector of La Balsa, Batangrande, located in the district of Pítipo, in the province of Ferreñafe.

She is a native of Cutervo, Cajamarca, and she began living in Batangrande six years ago. Two years ago she moved to La Balsa sector and for 5 years she has worked in cattle farming. Now she does this work with her husband since it is the only stable income with which they can sustain their daily expenses.

Currently she has four cows and four bulls. Her cows together produce 15 liters daily, and each liter is bought for 92 cents by the stocking business, which in turn sells to one of the principle dairy producers of the country.

She also sows corn husks in a small nearby plot of land in order to feed her livestock but what she sows regularly is not enough to feed them. For this reason she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles for the first time. She wants to invest this money in providing a balanced diet for her livestock in order to increase their milk production.

In the long term she wants to buy a Holstein cow because the cows she has are Creole and they don’t have the level of production that she wishes to obtain. On the other side, she hopes that her bulls develop completely so she can begin to use them in farm work.

Her husband also works as an agricultural laboror, and between the two of them they try to support their children, four of which are in school. María is a very well-known person by her neighbors in the area. She is very happy and optimistic and she likes to work with others when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide a balanced diet for improvements in milk production

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 39 años de edad, tiene seis hijos y vive junto a su esposo a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo; en Batangrande, distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe.

Hace un año que se dedica a la ganadería junto a su esposo, ellos tienen 4 vacas que producen diariamente 15 litros diarios los que, al igual que todos los ganaderos de la zona, venden a la empresa acopiadora local a 0,92 céntimos el litro, esta empresa los vuelve a vender a una de las principales empresas procesadoras de lácteos del país.

Su esposo se dedica esporádicamente a trabajar como peón agrícola, aunque también siembra maíz chala para alimentar a su ganado, la cantidad de ingresos que perciben no les basta para mantener a su familia y a sus hijos, que aún estudian, por este motivo se encuentran solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensan invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de leche de sus animales así como en la construcción de Bebederos y Comederos que faciliten su alimentación.

María sueña con mejorar gradualmente su ganado, aumentando la producción con una adecuada alimentación y con el mejoramiento genético de la raza, ella también desea mejorar su casa con las ganancias que recaude a futuro y otorgarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera técnica de corta duración.

Ella es muy querida por sus vecinos quienes la consideran una mujer amable y servicial.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old, has six children and lives with them and with her husband. They live 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in Batangrande, in the district of Pítipo and the province of Ferreñafe.

For one year she has worked in cattle farming with her husband. They have four cows that produce 15 liters daily. Like all the other cattle farmers in the region, they sell their milk to the local stocking business for 92 cents a liter. This business in turn sells to one of the principle dairy producers in the country.

Her husband works sporadically as an agricultural laborer. Although she also sows corn husks to feed their livestock, the quantity of income that they receive is not enough to support their family and their children, who are in school. It is for this reason that they are asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that they want to invest in providing a balanced diet for their livestock to increase their production of milk, as well as in the construction of drinking and feeding troughs that facilitate feeding.

María dreams of gradually improving her livestock, increasing their production through an adequate diet and with genetic improvement of the breed. She also hopes to improve her house with the earnings that she collects in the future as well as grant to her children the possibility of studying for a technical degree for limited time. She is very well-liked by her neighbors who consider her a very loving and serving woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide a balanced diet to increase milk production and stable improvements

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es soltero, tiene 46 años de edad y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en Batangrande, distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde el año 2000 se dedica a la ganadería, actualmente tiene 10 vacas lecheras que producen diariamente de 28 a 30 litros que son comprados a 0,92 céntimos el litro por la empresa acopiadora de la zona, que a su vez vende la leche a una de las principales empresas procesadoras de producto lácteo del país.

El también se dedica a la agricultura y siembra maíz chala para alimentar a su ganado, su establo está ubicado a algunos minutos de distancia del pueblo pero el terreno en que se encuentra ubicado no es suyo, por lo que desea construir un establo de material noble en un terreno propio que se encuentra más cerca a la zona en donde vive.

Es por este motivo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de material noble (ladrillo) para construir su establo, además planea invertirlos en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales.

Julio es muy conocido por los pobladores de la zona que acuden a él ante cualquier necesidad de ayuda, su gran sueño es poder construir una casa al lado de su futuro establo, ya que también es muy comprometido con su trabajo y le gusta vigilar a su ganado todo el día.
texts.en:
Julio is single, 46 years old, and lives with his four children. They live in Batangrande, in the district of Pítipo, the province of Ferreñafe, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Since the year 2000 he has worked in cattle farming. He currently has 10 dairy cows that produce 28 to 30 liters daily which are bought for 92 cents a liter by the stocking business in the area, which in turns sells the milk to one of the principle dairy processors in the country.

He also works in agriculture and he sows corn husks to feed his livestock. His stable is located a few minutes away from the town but the land there is not his own. Because of this he wants to build a stable of fine material on his own land that is closer to where he lives.

It’s for this reason that he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles for the first time. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of fine material (brick) to build his stable. Additionally, he plans to invest the money in providing a balanced diet for his animals.

Julio is very well-known by the people of his region who come to him with whatever they need help with. His greatest dream is to be able to build a house next to his future stable, since he is also very committed to his job and likes to guard his livestock all day.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a stable and providing a balanced diet to improve milk production

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan B. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Joan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joan owns and operates a business of making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Joan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Joan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene R. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Arlene is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business of a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: 018 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hương N. Thị (65) is a 27 year old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Hương is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 018 Quảng Hưng (18.02.018).

Hương is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hương operates a family member's manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling aluminum products to local businesses and community members. Hương has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.442.600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  P. Thị Thu (81) is a 51 year old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2.  Lê Thị Lý (69) is a 25 year old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3.  N. Thị Liễu (78) is a 31 year old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the province of Thanh Hoa.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hương N. Thị (65) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Hương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 018 Quảng Hưng (18.02.018).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng nhôm cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hương kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2005, Hương đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  P. Thị Thu (81) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
2.  Lê Thị Lý (69) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
3.  N. Thị Liễu (78) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

If you would like to translate the Vietnamese text above, please visit the  free online translator  offered by Vdict.com.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish, locally known as "bulad", in the local community. Ronie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat R. is 65 years old and a resident of Kandal Province. She is married with eight children, six of whom are single and two of whom are married and live separately. To help meet the family's needs, two of her daughters are employed as garment workers, earning salaries of $160 per month. Her husband is a local teacher, as well as a fisherman.

Sat R. makes a living selling fresh fish and fish paste in the local market. She started the business over twenty years ago and currently earns an income of approximately of $7 per day.

Sat R. will be using her second loan on Kiva in order to purchase cows to raise their offspring. In addition, she will rent them out to farmers for fees.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise their offspring and to rent them to farmers

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita B. is from the village of Bay Bay Bonifacio. She is 39 years old. Jovita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a business of selling fish to local community members. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $62 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovita joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and save as a reserve for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
V. is an older widowed woman and is a mother blessed with six children who are teenagers. Four of them are employed: two daughters are garment workers and two sons are blacksmiths. V. currently retails various vegetables that she buys in bulk on credit from her wholesale supplier at the market.

V. is looking for a loan for her sons to use as capital to purchase additional ferrous metal for their blacksmith business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ferrous metal for her sons' blacksmith business

loans.name: 023 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Nhạ T. Thị (33) is a 58-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Nhạ is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 23 (023 Quảng Hưng).

Nhạ is married and has one adult child. Nhạ owns and operates a food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Nhạ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Nhạ is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 9th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. C. Thị Hoà (30) is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.

2. N. Thị Duyên (35) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business buying and reselling vegetables.

3. N. Thị Nhuần (31) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.

4. Đỗ Thị Thanh (34) is a 58-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business buying and reselling vegetables.

5. H. Thị Liễu (28) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business buying and reselling fruit.

6. N. Thị Ánh (32) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business buying and reselling fruit.

 * Mrs. Hoa is absent from the photo because her son has just died so she had to stay at home with him for some time.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Nhạ T. Thị (33) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Nhạ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 23 (023 Quảng Hưng).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nhạ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nhạ kiếm được khoảng 2004 VND. Vào 1200000, Nhạ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nhạ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. C. Thị Hoà (30) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. N. Thị Duyên (35) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3. N. Thị Nhuần (31) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Đỗ Thị Thanh (34) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

5. H. Thị Liễu (28) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

6. N. Thị Ánh (32) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok I., age 42, sells fresh fish in the busy market. As another source of income, she buys and sells used goods out of her home. In both businesses she can generate $4 per day to support her family's food requirements.

Sok I. has been married for years wI. four children who are single. One of her sons is a vehicle repairer. Her husband works as a supervisor of military policemen.

The fishing season is coming since the river is full of fish. Sok I. hopes to accumulate more profits for her family. That is why she requests a loan for her unemployed son's use, to buy equipment for fishing.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment for her unemployed son

loans.name: 021 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Hồng N. Thị is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Hồng is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 21 (021 Quảng Hưng).

Hồng is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Hồng owns and operates a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Hồng has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1400000 (~80$) VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hồng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2442600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her seventh loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hồng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha H. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 54 years old and married with four school-aged children. Editha owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling coconut wine in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to help her business succeed. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. is from the village of Cabaksahan, Iligan City. She is 32 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Analyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Loep

texts.en: Loep L. is a single mother caring for three children. All three of them attend the local school and are dependent on her income. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband. She is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to ensure her children attain the highest level of education. To earn a living, she sells fresh beef to people who are passers-by in the village. Loep L. will be using a loan as extra capital to sustain her business growth. This will allow her to gain more income and more valued customers. From this, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To sustain her business growth

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia C. is from the city of Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Lucia owns and operates a transportation business operating a pedicab. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en: Arcelie R. is from the village of Kabaksahan, Iligan City. She is 28 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Arcelie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Arcelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Eudisel

texts.en:
Eudisel E. is from Dapitan. She is 31 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based motor cab business transporting passengers services around her community. Eudisel is just starting this business.

Eudisel joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC and now requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair her vehicle. She plans to use the profit to pay tuition fees for her children.

---------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Repair vehicle used in business.

loans.name: 012 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Soi Lê Thị (31) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the leader of an eight member group offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The name of this group is 12 (12 Đông Sơn).

Soi is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling food products in her community. Soi has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Soi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Soi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 6000000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her eigth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Soi plans to use the profit from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

Here are the other borrowers in the Group: 1.

loans.use: Purchase business-related products to sell.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina G. is from the village of Kabaksahan. She is 59 years old, married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in her local community. Melodina has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Melodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Melodina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the profit to improve and expand her business.

------------------------ About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase new items to sell.

loans.name: Res

texts.en:
Res F. (husband shown in picture) is a 27 years old chicken trader. She retails chickens that she buys in bulk at low prices from people who live in her area. She has been in business since 2003.

Her husband drives a motorbike taxi to raise money. This couple has been married for a long time and has one young child who attends school.

Res F. is taking out a loan to buy extra chickens to meet her customer's needs.

loans.use: Buy more chicken to sell.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia believes that hard work and patience are necessary to attain success in life. She manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in her village. Expanding her business is one goal to meet the needs of her family to improve their living conditions. She is married to Rolly, a construction worker. She and her husband work hard to support their children and grand children. The couple is blessed with two children who are married. They happily live in the simple village of Rizal in Santiago City.

Arsenia is glad that she is able to generate a monthly income of PHP10,000 from her store and food vending business. This has been a great help in meeting their daily needs. Arsenia wanted to develop her business and is hoping for a loan from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP12,000. She aspires to earn more and save for her future and for emergencies.

loans.use: Increase business.

loans.name: Mrs. Ken Khuy Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of fifteen people who all live in Trapeang Ampil village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ken K. is the village bank president, and she was selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding, and she would use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to support her husband’s paddy field. Her husband, Mr. Peou Choeun, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local school. 

Nine members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. With an end-of-term loan, they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients stA. to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and also fertilizer for her husband’s field.

loans.name: Servillano

texts.en:
Servillano S. Jr. is 37 years old and married to Joy, who supports him in managing their general store and eatery business situated in the village of Raniag, Ramon, Isabela. Servillano would like to develop the business in order to provide for the needs of his family, especially his three children who are studying in high school and elementary school. His children are Adely Joy, 14, and in third year high school; Anthony James, 10, a grade VI student, and Arjay, 8, a grade III student.

Servillano has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. This will be of great help in improving and growing his small business. He is also thankful for the support of his wife and his children who serve as his inspiration to work hard.

loans.use: Aa additional capital

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
Narissa S. is from the village of Kabaksahan, Iligan City. She is 29 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Narissa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community.
