Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and sausages to stock her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith O. is a 37-year-old farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. She has six children, the eldest, to whom she gave too much attention, is 17 years old. When she got married in 1991, she started to learn farming. This is her family’s only source of income which provides them food, clothes and other basic needs.

Judith needs a loan for additional capital. She would like to take this chance of investing more in her farm to be able to have a good harvest. Receiving the loan will help her also to pay the laborers who helped shape and prepare the field ready for planting.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital and to pay laborers

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a member of the Ngome borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 13, 8, 7,  and 4 years old.

Helena has owned a food business selling Vegetable for 1 year, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 110,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Helena`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to cultivate more vegetable for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from using this loan, Helena hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  cultivate more vegetable

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn, 19 years old, is married to Jaime and they now have a one-year-old child named James Bond. The young couple is living in Labni Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished high school but was not able to pursue college education due to poverty.

While her husband works on their small farm, Ronalyn buys fruits and vegetables from Bambang public market and sells them in their village. To develop her business into a better livelihood for her family, Ronalyn is seeking the support of KIVA lenders for a loan of PHP5,000 as additional business capital. She hopes that she will thereby be able to improve her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza R. is a 42-year-old rice farmer. She has three children, the eldest of whom has just turned 15 and wants to study at college. Currently, Liza has a one-and-a-quarter-hectare rice field that she toils and maintains everyday. Taking care of the farm will give her a truly abundant harvest.

Liza would like a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her farm. She needs to pay the laborers who help her prepare the farm ready for planting. She hopes to be successful in her business in order to send her eldest child to college.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. pay laborers

loans.name: Mrs. Chres At Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chres A. is a group leader of five members who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field of land used to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation she is a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Nhoei Vanny, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chres A. is 32 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

Three members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets and fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.ru: Абдумавлону 28 лет. Женат и отец 1-го ребенка. Занимается продажей мяса на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Он откармливает скот сам, и закалывает его для продажи мяса. Жена домохозяйка. Нянчит свою маленькую дочку. Кормит скот. Абдумавлон просит займ для закупки скота, так как наступил священный месяц Рамазан, люди покупают много мяса.
texts.en:
Abdumavlon is 28 years old. He is married with one child. Abdumavlon raises and slaughters livestock and sells the meat at Hojand's Panchshanbe market. His wife is a stay-at-home mom; she takes care of their little daughter and helps her husband raise livestock. Abdumavlon will use the loan for the purchase of livestock. It is the sacred month of Ramadan, and meat is in demand.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Arvelen

texts.en:
Arvelen is married to Erwin and they live in Labni Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Neither of them pursued their college education because they decided to get married. Their parents helped them after their marriage – Erwin’s parents bought a tricycle for him to use in a transport business, while Arvelen's parents gave her a small amount of capital to start her own business.

Arvelen runs a sari-sari store business (community-based store). She buys her merchandise at the public market in Bambang and sells it at retail price. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She aims to improve her store so that she can earn more income to build their house. She hopes that through her business and the support of Kiva lenders, she can achieve her goals some day.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Roth Kong Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eleven people all living in Smaong village in Takeo province, is requesting a loan. Mrs. Srey Roth K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which badly affects her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Ev Mei, is a driver who gets little salary. Mrs. Srey Roth K. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom stays at home while another attends the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. B. is a rice grower. She currently manages a two-hectare farm that she hopes will support the needs of her three children. She started helping her husband grow rice in 2002. Now she is focusing her attention on how to grow their business, especially as her eldest child is now a teenager and has many needs.

Jocelyn would like a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her farm so that she will be able to obtain a better harvest. She has always been earning from her rice farm but her wish is to have a better harvest so that she can buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: To finance her farm

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina E. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 51 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marcelina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana Isabel M. H. D. O. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Ana vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ana posee su propio negocio donD. cuenta con el apoyo y colaboración D. sus hijos; en el negocio D. Ana, se confecciona ropa y también posee una venta en su casa, donD. ofrece variedad D. productos, como: listones, botones, zapatos, ropa, entre otros. El crédito que solicita Ana es para la compra D. tela que le permita confeccionar mayor cantidad D. ropa y para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel M. H. D. O. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Ciudad Arce, in the department of La Libertad. Ana lives with her husband and their three children. Ana has her own business, in which she is supported and helped by her children. Her business consists of making clothes and also selling them from her home, where she offers a variety of products, such as ribbons, buttons, shoes, and clothes, among other things. The loan that Ana is asking for would be used for the purchase of fabric that will allow her to make even more clothes and stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of materials for the manufacture of clothes and other items to stock her business.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador G. reside en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento de Cuscatlán. Con 43 años de edad Salvador es un hombre de familia, vive junto a su esposa y su única hija Fátima de 18 años de edad. La familia G. posee una panadería hace diecinueve años donde el mando y coordinación está a cargo de Salvador, pero su esposa y su hija también ayudan  en el negocio. La panadería abastece a muchas tiendas de Cojutepeque e Ilobasco. El crédito que solita Salvador es para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos, que le permitan aumentar su productos de pan.
texts.en:
Salvador G. lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the Cuscatlán department. Salvador, 43, is a family man. He lives with his wife and their only daughter, 18 year old Fatima. The G. family has had a bakery for 19 year. Salvadar is in charge of running and coordinating the business, but his wife and daughter also help with the business. The bakery supplies many stores in Cojutepeque and Ilobasco. The loan that Salvador is asking for is to buy a larger quantity of supplies, which will allow him to increase his bread production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for his bakery

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a member of the Ngome borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 39 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 17, 19, 12 years old.

Rukia has owned a food business selling onions, tomatoes and charcoal for 3 years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rukia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in  order to buy more onions, tomatoes and charcoal.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rukia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more onions, tomatoes  and  charcoal for  sale

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badeya de l’association Assurance ( 2 femmes mariées, 2 veuves et une célibataire), avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent  majoritairement  dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani 1,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.   
Elles font du vrai commerce d’articles divers comme activités, avec la vente de poissons (sous diverses formes), d’atiécké, de fruits, d’encens, des prestations de teinture etc.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Tous les six précédents  prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 paniers de poissons fumés et séchés, 10 sacs d’atiécké, 4 régimes de bananes,  2 sacs d’ananas, 10 paniers d’oranges, 5 sachets de 5kg de colorants différents, 1 barrique de  soude caustique, 15 kg de graines de magnon et de guenni, 6 types différents de parfums et des bouteilles vides servant d’emballages pour l’encenses. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les  différents marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée comme  épargne et pour subvenir aux  besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres ouvrir un magasin de vente ou aménager leur lieu de prestation de teinture.
texts.en:
The members of this Badeya group, belonging to the ‘Assurance’ Association (2 married women, 2 widows, and one single woman) have an average age of 39 and on average, 4 children, and live primarily in polygamous families in Mancourani 1, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They have real businesses, selling various items such as fish (in various forms), ‘atiéké’ (cassava grits), fruit, incense, and dyeing cloth. They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 7th solidarity loan. The preceding 6 loans were correctly reimbursed.

With their new loan they intend to buy 4 baskets of smoked and dried fish, 10 sacks of ‘atiéké’, 4 stalks of bananas, 2 sacks of pineapple, 10 baskets of oranges, 5 bags of 5 kg each of various dyes, 1 barrel of caustic soda, 15 kg of ‘magnon’ and ‘guenni’ seeds, 6 various sorts of perfume, and empty bottles that they will use for their incense. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town in the various markets and on foot in the neighborhoods, for cash and occasionally for credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make a monthly profit of 55,000 F CFA of which part will be put into savings or used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. Some of the women hope to buy a plot of land to build a home on in Sikasso town; others hope to open up a store or upgrade the place where they do their cloth dyeing.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items

loans.name: Monserat

texts.en:
Monserat E. is a rice grower in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao. The income she makes from rice farming has sustained her family for many years now. She hopes that someday she will be able to buy more farmland and grow more rice. In that way, it will be easier to send her children to college and provide for all their needs.

Currently Monserat only has a one-hectare rice field. This gives her sufficient income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. Now, she is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP for use as additional capital for her business. Receiving this loan will assist her in paying the laborers who help transplant the rice seedlings.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. pay laborers

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita enjoys her duck-raising business. She is 43 years old and lives with her family in the village of Raniag, Ramon, Isabela. She patiently manages her livestock business for it is a good source of income for her family.

Carmelita is hoping that her duck raising will grow in order to generate a bigger income to meet the growing needs of their family, especially since her children are now at college level. She also wants to build a house for her ducks. Thus, she wants to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Badeya est un regroupement de l’association Balimaya composé de 2 femmes mariées et  2 célibataires qui ont en  moyenne  34 ans et 1 enfant.  Elles vivent dans des familles monogames à Fama,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariages, de  voisinage et font  de l’achat et la vente de   tissus, draps, pagnes brodés –uni wax, atiécké et charbon de bois etc.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt de groupe tous les deux précédents  ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. 
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 balles de tissus, 1 pièce et ½  d’uni wax, 1 pièce de brodés, 25 sacs de charbon de bois, 3 sacs d’atiécké et 5 balles de tissus pour draps. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants et effectuent leurs ventes à Sikasso ville dans les différents marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant, quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
Badeya is a group of the Balimaya association, composed of 2 married and 2 single women, who are on average 34 years old with 1 child. They live in monogamous households in Fama, one of the districts in the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through familial and community ties, and are engaged in the buying and selling of fabric, sheets, uni-wax and embroidered pagnes (a type of West African cloth), atiécké (a starchy food made from cassava), charcoal, etc. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) in order to meet the needs of their clientele, and are seeking their third group loan, with the two previous loans having been repaid without any difficulties. With this new loan, they intend to buy 3 bales of fabric, 1 and a half sets of uni-wax pagnes, 1 set of embroidered pagnes, 25 bags of charcoal, 3 bags of atiécké, and 5 bales of fabric for sheets. They supply themselves at the grand market in Sikasso town and in the neighbouring villages, and make their sales in Sikasso town at various markets and door-to-door in the districts, in cash, sometimes on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 27,500 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used for savings and family needs, and the remainder invested in their businesses. They intend to have more capital to better satisfy their customers and to set up a little shop.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various items

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio L. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 47 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Rogelio owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Rogelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Mrs. Torch Iv Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Torch I. is a group leader of six members who all live in Smaong village in Kandal province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. She is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Morm Nhou, is a farmer who owns 1.80-hectar field of land used to cultivate rice. Mrs. Torch I. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pig food. She is 67 years old and the mother of a child who is a Korean translator.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pig food.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Forty-two years old and married with thee children, Helen operates a baking and catering service. She bakes various types of cakes for a variety of ceremonies including birthdays and marriages and hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase a refrigerator and additional baking materials for the business.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator and additional baking materials

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants, vivant dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt de groupe, après avoir bien remboursés les quatre précédents.
Elles font de la vente de condiments alimentaires, de chaussures, de la pâte d’arachide, de parfums, de l’ encens, du bois de chauffe, la fabrication de boissons locales  non alcoolisées, etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 6 emballages de condiments alimentaires, 1 chargement de camion 10 tonnes en bois de chauffe, 1 douzaine de parfums,  2 douzaines de chaussures, 10 kg de gingembre, 1sac de sucre,  8 kg de graine guenni et magnon pour préparer de l’encens et 150kg de graine d’arachide pour en faire la pâte d’arachide. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville sur place à la maison, soit dans les marchés et aux abords des artères principales soit de façon ambulante dans les quartiers. Elles vendent au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 45.500 FCFA dont une partie servira d’épargne et à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women who are on average 38 years old with an average of 2 children, living in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, in the the third administrative area of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to meet the needs of their customers and this is their fifth loan, after correctly repaying the four preceding loans. They sell seasoning, shoes, peanut butter, perfume, incense, firewood and make local non-alcoholic beverages, etc. With their new loan, they plan to purchase 6 packages of seasoning, 1 truckload of 10 tons of firewood, 1 dozen perfumes, 2 dozen shoes, 10 kg of ginger, 1 sack of sugar, 8 kg of gueni seeds and magnon to make incense, and 150 kg of peanuts to make peanut butter. They get their supplies in the Sikasso marketplace and in the neighboring villages. They sell in Sikasso out of their homes, either in the markets and near the main roads, or in the neighborhoods in a traveling manner. They sell for cash, retail and on credit to a clientele made up of men and women. They each envision a monthly profit of 45,500 CFA francs, of which a portion will be used for savings and to meet the needs of the family, and the other portion will be reinvested in their activities. They plan to have more capital to better satisfy their customers and to build a sales area.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items.

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en:
Rustica is a member of the Ngome borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 50 year old woman, she is married and  she cares for 6 dependents.

Rustica has owned a Grocery business for 4 years, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rustica`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more Drinks like beer, soda for her grocery.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan, Rustica hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her Grocery

loans.name: Mrs. Ry Mom Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry M. is the group leader of five who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. She owns a pig-raising business. Now she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. 

Mrs. Ry M. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school and youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Prum Phalla, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda T. owns and manages a small rice field which she hopes can earn sufficient profit to meet her family's food, clothing and other basic needs.  A mother of eight children, she started helping out her husband in 1995.

Currently tilling a 3-hectare farm, she is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to finance the operation of her farm, including the payment of farmer workers and purchase of farm necessities. Eda hopes to make her business flourish in order to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo C. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 46 years old and married. To make a living, Gerardo owns and operates a business making and selling food. His main source of income comes from selling snacks and delicacies in the local community. Gerardo has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gerardo joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. Gerardo requests a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand his business.

-------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 33 years old and married with two children.  She sells yams to make a living.  Roseline lives in Delta State, Nigeria.  She has been in business for a long time.  Roseline hopes for the loan of N100, 000 to purchase more yams to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1 un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles font de la vente de condiments alimentaires, de bazins, de chaussures, du bois de chauffe, des pagnes wax et divers autres articles d’alimentation et sont à leur premier prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 paquets d’articles divers pour l’alimentation, 6 emballages de condiments alimentaires,  10 pièces de pagnes wax, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 5 complets de bazins teintés et 1 douzaine de chaussures. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 37.500 FCFA qui servira d’épargne, de besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women who are on average 38 years old, have 3 children, and live in monogomous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali. They sell seasoning, damask, shoes, firewood, Wax brand pagnes (brightly colored fabric used for wraps), and various other food items. This is their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution. With their loan, they plan to purchase 5 packets of various food items, 6 packages of seasoning, 10 lengths of Wax pagnes, 1 truckload of firewood, 5 dyed damask suits, and 1 dozen shoes. They get their supplies in the Sikasso market and in the neighboring villages. They sell in the city of Sikasso in the markets and in a traveling manner in the neighborhoods. They sell for cash, retail, or on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. They each plan to make a monthly profit of 37,500 CFA francs for savings and family needs, and the other portion will be reinvested in the group's activities. They plan to have more capital to better satisfy their customers and to be able to build a sales area.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items.

loans.name: Chanreth

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanreth C. is a villager in Preak Roeusey village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kheang Kheing, are shell sellers. Since their business is doing well, they want to expand it by purchasing more shells for their business. Thus, Mrs. Chanreth C. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Chanreth C. is a 40-year-old mother of five children, one of whom is a laborer while another two are workers in the poultry business and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more shells for their business

loans.name: Abies

texts.en: Abies sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 60 years old, married with three children and a retired civil servant.  She hopes for the loan of N70000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Like any mother, Merasol E. wants to provide the best things for her children; sending them to college, buying new and nice looking school clothes, classroom supplies, giving them a bigger allowance and more. But because she doesn't have all the riches, she tells her children to be contented with what they have.

Merasol is a rice grower in Veruela Agusan del Sur, in Mindanao. She has tilled a field since 1980. Merasol hopes the farm will give her enough income to support the needs of her three children.

She would like a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to meet her farming needs and pay for equipment she uses during land preparation. Receiving this loan will help her business.

loans.use: Farm equipment financing.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 49 years old and married with three school-aged children.

To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business making and selling food. Her main source of income comes from selling specialty foods in the local community. Myrna has been in business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Myrna is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients to make more products for sale. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. Myrna plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

--------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make products to sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with two children. She sells roasted beef popularly known in Nigeria as bush meat. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more roasted beef to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more roasted beef to sell

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: Keng V. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocer. She is 50 years old and a widow. She has one daughter who is married and assists her in the business. She currently sells foods and some cooking supplies to her neighbors who live near her house. Keng V. requested a loan of $300 in order to make her business more successful.

loans.use: To make her business more successful

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells sarongs, shoes and bags. She has been in this business for the past five years. She is requesting the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor L. has a 1-hectare rice field. She has only one child who is now 11 years old. Flor has spent all her life on the farm. Her parents are farmers and growing rice is an easy subject for her. Aside from the rice farm, she hopes to provide her family an income to buy food, clothing and other needs, so she also invested in a fish-selling business. What she does is buy fish and resell it for profit. 

She would like to ask a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to finance her farm and fish business. Receiving this loan will help sustain their livelihood by meeting their needs.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.es: Rosemarie M. C. reside en Ataco municipio del departamento de Ahuachapán. Rosemarie vive en casa de sus padres,  tiene 29 años de edad  y es maestra de profesión,  por las mañanas imparte clases en un colegio de la zona. Rosemarie también posee un negocio ubicado en su domicilio, es una pequeña venta de ropa, la cual quiere mejorar con la ayuda de este crédito, invirtiendo en su negocio con nueva y más variedad de mercadería, para poder lograr mayores ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosemarie M. C. lives in the Ataco municipality in the Ahuachapán department. She lives in her parents’ house. She is 29, and she is a teacher by profession. She teaches classes in the mornings at a school in the region. Rosemarie also has a small business selling clothes, which is located in her home. She wants to improve it with the help of this loan. She wants to invest in her business with new merchandise and a greater variety of merchandise. She wants to do this to be able to achieve greater sales and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory of clothes

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Duch R. is 24 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than four years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier or from other fishermen. She is married to Horm Ty, 34, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. Because of this, Duch R. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing tools

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 46 years old and married with one child. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. This is her main source of income. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is from the town of Polanco. She is 57 years old and married with four grown children. To make a living, Luzviminda raises crops, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-two years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 51 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business for the past six years. She hopes for a loan of N100000 to purchase more drinks and provisions. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Deisy Arely

texts.es: Deisy Arely G. D. R.  resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Daisy  vive solamente con su hija Cecelia D. 18 años D. edad. Daisy es una persona muy trabajadora y constante en su negocio, ella posee un cafetería dentro D. un centro escolar público, donD. ofrece productos básicos D. consumo para estudiantes y profesores. Daisy solita un crédito que le permita surtir su negocio D. bebidas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Deisy Arely G. D. R. lives in the Ahuachapán department. Deisly lives alone with her 18 year old daughter, Cecelia. Deisy is very hard-working and persevering in her business. She has a cafeteria in a central public school. She sells basic food products to children and teachers. Deisy is asking for a loan that will allow her to stock her business with drinks and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Ejerose

texts.en:
Ejerose L. is a 22-year-old rice grower in Veruela Agusan del Sur, in Mindanao. She has two children. Her eldest is three and ready to go to preschool next year. Currently, her family tills a 1-hectare farm which she expects to help support their needs like food, clothing and medicines. Aside from her income from growing rice, she also tried selling food items in school as a way to augment their family income. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay for the equipment that she rented and the laborers that helped on her farm during land preparation. 

She said that she likes the program of CEVI a lot because it really helps many farmers like herself have access to funds to sustain their livelihood.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions like toothpaste, bathing soap, body cream, milk, etc.

Rose hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is married and is 32 years-old with three children. He began his business eight years ago with a small store, which adapted according to market demands. Initially Shuhrat offered a small number of construction materials in his store but expanded due to his location and client needs. His wife works with him and helps in the business. Shuhrat is asking for a loan of $3000 USD to purchase additional merchandise in order to offer a more diverse range of products to his clients. In this type of business, novelties always appear. He wants to be able to keep an up-to-date inventory and meet the preferences of his clients. Shuhrat thanks you for your support to continue to improve both his business and the quality of life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es: Blanca Marina O. D. M. resiD. en Atiquizaya municipio del departamento D. Ahuachapán. Blanca D. 55 años D. edad, vive con su esposos y sus tres hijos. Blanca posee su propio negocio ubicado en su casa, donD. ofrece variedad D. servicios, como impresiones, fotocopiados, anillados, alquiler D. computadoras por hora. Blanca solicita un crédito para comprar papelería que utiliza en su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Marina O. D. M. lives in the Atiquizaya municipality in the Ahuachapán department. Blanca, 55, lives with her husband and their three children. Blanca has her own business, which is located in her house. She offers a variety of services like printing, photocopies, binding services, and computer rental by the hour. Blanca is asking for a loan to buy stationery to use in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stationery for her busines

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: P. Antoinette est née le 27 octobre 1956. Antoinette est allée à l’école mais elle a fini par abandonner les études au profit du commerce. Antoinette vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Aujourd’hui, Antoinette vend ses articles dans une boutique qui lui appartient. Antoinette veut mieux développer son activité ; c’est pourquoi Antoinette sollicite de crédit de la part d’ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Antoinette P. was born on October 27, 1956. Antoinette went to school but ended up abandoning her studies to start a business. Antoinette sells a variety of items such as candies, cookies, canned food (milk, sardines and tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry and dishwashing detergent, soap, batteries and candles. Today Antoinette sells her merchandise in her own small shop. Antoinette wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candies, cookie, canned goods, sugar, pasta, detergent, soap, batteries and candles, and staples such as rice, eggs beans and corn.

loans.name: Lesvia Eloida

texts.es: Lesvia Eloida V. D. P. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en Atiquizaya municipio del departamento D. Ahuachapán. Lesvia vive con su esposo y su hijo Alonso D. 11 años D. edad, estudiante D. básica. Lesvia tiene mucho ingenio para su negocio, el cual tiene ubicado en casa, ofreciendo variedad D. frutas y verduras que sus clientes pueden elegir si llevarlas en porciones o enteras. Lesvia solicita este crédito para comprar mayor cantidad D. sus productos al por mayor, D. esa manera Lesvia lograra obtener mayores ganancias D. sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lesvia Eloida V. D. P., 48, lives in the Atiquizaya municipality in the Achuachapán department. She lives with her husband and their son, 11 year old Alonso. He is in graD. school. Lesvia has a lot of talent for her business, which is located in her house. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. Her customers can choose to take them in pieces or whole. Lesvia is asking for a loan to buy a greater quantity of her products wholesale. This way Lesvia will get greater earnings from her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza S. de 51 años de edad reside en Colon municipio del departamento de La Libertad. María vive con su esposo y su hija Adriana de 19 años. María posee su negocio donde vende  tortillas, pupusas y pasteles; todo esto fabricado desde su casa, la cual se encuentra ubicada en calle principal, permitiéndole a María ser  fácilmente vista por muchas personas, aunque por los años en el negocio, ya posee una clientela estable. El crédito que solicita María, es para compra de insumos, que le permitan aumentar su producción de alimentos .
texts.en:
María Esperanza S. is 51 years old and resides in the municipal of Colon in the department of La Libertad. María lives with her husband and her daughter Adriana who is 19 years old. María has a business where she sells tortillas, pupusas (corn biscuits), and cakes. Everything is made from her house, which is located on the main street, allowing María to be easily seen by many people. Although she has only been in the business for some years, she already has a stable clientele. The loan that María is asking for is to buy consumables that will allow her to increase her food production.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumables

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people.

Mrs. Sok S., 47, is the leader and operates a handicraft trade out of her home. Sok S. sells items of furniture that are made from water hyacinth. She is married to Om Navy, 50, who is a district consultant adviser. The couple has five teenage children; one of whom is working as internal staff for an organization. Sok S. would like to decorate her house in order to use her attractive house to begin selling desserts but she lacks the capital to do so. Therefore, Sok S. would like to ask for a loan in order to decorate her existing house.

The other borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are fishers. P. would like to buy more fishing tools. P. will purchase a net and trap for fishing. R. will buy more tools to fish.

loans.use: To decorate her house

loans.name: Esao Andiva

texts.en:
Esao M. is 32 years-old and married to Judith. They have been blessed with seven children. Esao cooks cakes and sells them to customers along Seregeya market centre in Eldoret Town.

Esao was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by an existing member. He has applied for a loan which he intends to use to add more stock, such as unga (flour) and cooking oil, to his business. He wants to maximise his profits by cooking more cakes instead of buying them from wholesalers.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more cooking supplies

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: H. Antoinette est née en 1950. Antoinette n’est  jamais allée à l’école ni appris un métier. C’est au commerce que Antoinette fut initiée par sa mère qu'elle accompagnait au marché. Après son mariage, Antoinette s'est mise à son propre compte. Antoinette a en effet commencé par vendre la pâte de maïs appelée localement akassa et l’huile rouge de noix de palme. Antoinette a environ dix d’expérience avec ces deux activités. Antoinette veut s’approvisionner en maïs et en huile rouge pendant que le prix de ces produits est bas et ceci en grande quantité.  C’est pourquoi, Antoinette sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Antoinette H. was born in 1950. She has never been to school nor learnt a craft. Antoinette was introduced to commerce by her mother, whom she would accompany to the market. After her marriage, Antoinette started her own business. She began by selling corn paste, known locally as “akassa,” and red palm nut oil. Antoinette has about 10 years’ experience in these two activities. Antoinette wants to stock up on corn and red oil while the price of these products is low and buy them in bulk. This is why she is requesting financial support from Alidé.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and drums of red palm nut oil

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
D. Rahmatullo lives with his wife and two children. He has been a farmer since he was young because his parents also grew large amounts of crops. He is happy being a farmer and enjoys it very much and, following the example of his father, he plants and then his wife or son take the products to the market to sell. Rahmatullo also raises and sells cattle. Farming gives Rahmatullo good earnings. He tells us that you only need to know how to take care of what you plant and to pay attention to what the crops need. As such, he fertilizes so that he has a good harvest. This is his second loan with Kiva partner IMON International and he is responsible with his payments. He plans to purchase high-quality seeds, mineral fertilizer and also young cattle. Rahmatullo is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his goals with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jane Muthoni

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother of two. She operates a retail shop at Rironi shopping centre serving clients who are within the center. She has been in the business for about four years and has been making a profit which has been able to cater for all her needs.

She has never borrowed from any other microfinance institution and this will be her second loan from Kiva partner KADET. She intends to use the loan to add more stock to her shop.

In the future she hopes to own a supermarket enabling her to have a stable income.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add stock to a retail shop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells provisions in her community in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria.  She is 31 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence W. is a 50-year-old widow with five children. She has been selling clothes through hawking for the last ten years in Naivasha town.

She was introduced to KADET by friends who are already clients. This is her first loan with KADET and she intends to boost her business by opening a boutique to offer better services to her potential customers. She hopes to start importing clothes in the near future.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Opening a boutique

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: K. Véronique est née vers 1954. Véronique n’est  jamais allée à l’école ni appris un métier. Véronique vendait avec sa mère la pâte de maïs appelée localement akassa. Après son mariage, Véronique s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité. Mais en plus de la pâte de maïs, Véronique vend également le pétrole lampant. Véronique veut mieux développer son activité et la diversifier à la vente des articles chinois.  C’est pourquoi Véronique demande un crédit à ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Véronique K. was born around 1954. She has never been to school nor learnt a craft. Véronique and her mother sold corn paste, known locally as “akassa.” After her marriage, Véronique started her own business in the same line. However, in addition to corn paste, Véronique also sells kerosene. Véronique wants to expand and diversify her business by selling items from China. This is why she is asking for a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn, drums of kerosene and a few items from China

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.en:
M. Zulaikho comes from a humble family but her desire to succeed in life superseded her economic conditions. At an early age, she learned to make new and different articles of women's national dresses. Thanks to her excellent work, she won the admiration and loyalty of her clients.

In order to realize her plans for which she works hard, Zulaikho appeals to your caring heart and requests a loan to buy a sewing machine to continue making her fine articles of dress. Let’s support this excellent seamstress so she can continue sewing her elegant and distinguished articles of national dress.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: C. Sylvie est née le 03 Novembre 1975. Sylvie a fait les études primaires. Sylvie a abandonné les études très tôt par manque de moyens financiers. Après son mariage, Sylvie s’est mise à vendre la bouillie de maïs avec le soutien  financier de son mari. Puis Sylvie a  élargi son commerce à la vente de condiments de sauces (tomate fraîche et en boîte, oignon, poivre, ail, gingembre, gombo, crincrin, légumes, piment, sel, œufs, huiles végétales, etc.). Quand Sylvie a eu son premier crédit à ALIDé, elle a associé à ses activité la vente de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Aujourd'hui encore, Sylvie compte à nouveau sur l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour associer à son activité la vente des produits vivriers.
texts.en:
Sylvie C. was born on November 3, 1975 and attended primary school. She abandoned her studies at a very young age due to lack of financial means. After her marriage, Sylvie began selling corn mash with the help of her husband. Sylvie then expanded her business into selling condiments for sauce (fresh and canned tomatoes, onions, pepper, garlic, ginger, okra, crincrin (mallow leaves), vegetables, chili peppers, salt, eggs, vegetable oils, etc.). When Sylvie received her first loan from Alidé, she added to her line-up items such as candies, cookies, canned food (milk, sardines and tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry and dishwashing detergent, soap, batteries and candles. Today Sylvie is once again relying on financial support from Alidé to add food staples to her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy misc items (pasta, canned tomatoes, sardines, milk, butter, detergent, etc) and food staples (beans, rice, cassava flour, etc)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells loaves of bread in her community. She is 54 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes to own a bakery in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000, to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr:
T. Suzanne est âgée de 43 ans. Suzanne est mariée et  est mère de trois enfants.
Suzanne n’est  jamais allée à l’école ni appris un métier. Dès son enfance, Suzanne fut placée chez une parente qui l'a initiée au commerce. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Suzanne s’est installée à son propre compte et vend divers articles: chaussures, sacs, verres à boire, etc. Suzanne a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part d’ALIDé et a bien remboursé ces crédits. Suzanne sollicite un cinquième crédit d’ALIDé pour augmenter le volume de ses chaussures afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Suzanne T. is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. Suzanne has never been to school nor learnt a craft. As a child, Suzanne went to live with a female relative who introduced her to commerce. For about a decade, Suzanne has had her own business selling a variety of items: shoes, handbags, drinking glasses, etc. She has already had four loans from Alidé, which she repaid successfully. Suzanne is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé to increase her stock of shoes in order to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells foodstuffs such as melons, pepper, etc. She is 51 year old and married with one child. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells cooked food by carrying it from place to place in a wheelbarrow. She is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.en:
Muhtaram is an enterprising woman with a great desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Muhtaram has been a seamstress since she was very young, having learnt this in her mother's shop. With a lot of effort she has been able to open her own shop at her home and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products.

In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni for purchasing a new sewing machine. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Muhtaram is grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells loaves of bread retail to her customers in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old and married with 7 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: A. Edith est née vers 1961à Gbecon à Porto- Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Edith est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants.  Edith et sa famille vivent à  yèvié un quartier de Porto-Novo. Edith est une vendeuse de bois de chauffage  et de charbon de bois. Son activité qui lui est génératrice de revenus  est en pleine croissance à cause de l’augmentation de sa clientèle. Mais faute de moyens financiers pour plus s’approvisionner à temps et pour répondre efficacement à  cette forte demande, Edith fait donc  recours à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d’augmenter le volume de ses produits.
texts.en:
Edith A. was born around 1961 in Gbecon, Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of six children. Edith and her family live in Yèvié, a neighbourhood of Porto-Novo. She works selling firewood and coal. This revenue-generating activity is going through a period of growth as her clientele has increased. However, as she lacks the financial means to re-stock quickly and supply this heavy demand efficiently, Edith has turned to Kiva Partner Alidé in order to strengthen her working capital so she can increase her sales volume.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing firewood and sacks of coal for re-sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells sarongs and baby things like flasks, diapers, powder, etc. She is 49 years old and married with 7 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs and baby things to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and baby things to sell

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet M. has two school-aged children and lives in Ijevan with his family. His wife works at the Ijevan Electric Power Station. For the past 22 years, Hamlet has dealt with watch repairs and sales. He sustains his family thanks to the income from his business, which he hopes to expand in the future. He pays 12.000 AMD per month for renting his business place. Hamlet needs a 300.000 AMD loan to add his assortment of watches. Hamlet has previously taken eight loans from “Nor Horizon” and has never made delinquent repayments.

loans.use: To add to his assortment of watches

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
A. Tursunoy is 46 years old. She is married with two children. Since 1999, Tursunoy has been engaged in bicycle spare parts sales. She has a shop in the local market. She sells spare parts of different types and for different bicycles.

As a result of the success of her business, Tursunoy has improved the living conditions of her family and is doing her best to meet all the needs of her dearest children. But she is not satisfied with the volume of sales and wants to increase her inventory, thus increasing the volume of sales. With this purpose in mind, today Tursunoy requests 4500 Somoni that will be spent for purchasing spare parts for bicycles to increase her range of goods. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Tursunoy’s business.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Aigbe

texts.en: Aigbe is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Benin City. She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. She thanks all Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Amadali

texts.en:
K. Amadali is 55 years old, married, and together with his wife, he has 4 children. Amadali runs the family business, which is a convenience store that sells all kinds of much-needed items like oil, sugar, tea, coffee, macaroni, and many others. He's been in this business for more than 14 years.

Amadali says that the business is going very well and is generating good earnings, and now he's planning to increase the range goods. The loan he's requesting will help Amadali meet his goals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Khusen

texts.en:
D. Khusen is 42 years old and married. Thanks to his efforts to get ahead and his positive attitude in the community, he is now a well-known and respected merchant in his area. Previously Khusen had been a farm hand, working in the fields for various people. With his hard work he was able to purchase land and cultivate vegetables such as potato, onion, carrot and etc. His wife sells his harvest at the market and during their activity in this kind of business, his products have become very popular among buyers.

At the same time Khusen raises cattle and sells them. Now Khusen requests a loan so he will be better able to serve his customers and differentiate himself from the competition. He only wants to continue growing his business and to be able to improve the quality of life for his family. With your help, Khusen can get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing bags for saving his crops and the cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the size of her business

loans.name: Tinik

texts.en:
Tinik is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her potato and wheat farm to later sell her agricultural products in the markets of the closest towns or to merchants from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area.

Tinik is also engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. Her children and husband actively help her with operations. She wants to increase her investment in agriculture and expand her farmland to improve the living standards of her beloved family. Let’s help this mother to keep working for the well-being of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizer, and young cattle

loans.name: Berée Plus Group

texts.fr:
Guislain B. est président de la Banque Communautaire dénommée « Berée Plus »,  composée de 27 micro-entrepreneurs qui ont solidairement décidé de contracter des crédits auprès des préteurs du monde à travers Kiva.
Guislain gère sa propre maison de Pompe funèbre et possède aussi une petite usine de production d’eau pure dans la partie nordique de Kinshasa. Il est client fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC depuis 2008. Il a reçu 5 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a tous remboursés correctement. Le prochain prêt lui permettra d’acheter 2 tentes à faire louer pour augmenter le bénéfice. Son activité lui procure hebdomadairement un bénéfice de $100. Son ambition est d’acheter un bus de transport. Guislain est célibataire âgé de 29 ans.
texts.en:
Guislain B. is president of the Village Bank " Berée Plus " made up of 27 micro-entrepreneurs who have together decided to request a loan from the lenders of the world via Kiva. Guislain runs his own funeral home and also has a small water treatment plant in the northern part of Kinshasa. He has been a faithful client of MFI HOPE DRC since 2008. He has received 5 loans through MFI HOPE DRC and has repaid them all in full. This next loan will allow him to purchase two tents to rent out in order to increase his profits. This activity will earn him $100 a week. He hopes in the future to buy a transportation bus. Guislain is single and 29 years old.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing two tents to rent out to increase revenue

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Askar

texts.en:
I. Askar is 26 years old. He is married with two small children. Askar has been a farmer since he was young. He plants potatoes and other vegetables. Askar alternates the crops so that while one is growing, the other is ready to be cleaned and prepared until he finally begins to plant potatoes again.

Growing potatoes is very profitable because there are certain seasons when prices are higher and farmers have the opportunity to increase their capital. Currently Askar needs funds for growing his crop, and for that reason he applied to IMON International with the request for a 900 USD loan. He will spend this loan for buying potato seeds and fertilizer. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Charlotte
