texts.fr: A. Charlotte est née vers 1981. Charlotte est mariée et mère de Cinq (05) enfants dont quatre (04) sont  scolarisés. Charlotte et sa famille vivent à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Charlotte est vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, etc.) ; des condiments de sauces (tomate fraîche et en boîte, oignon, poivre, ail, gingembre, gombo, piment, sel, œufs, huiles végétales, etc.) et des poissons fumés. Charlotte est dans cette activité depuis fort longtemps mais, elle n'a pas pu constituer son propre capital. C’est la raison pour laquelle  Charlotte sollicite un prêt d’ALIDé.  Charlotte veut mieux développer  son activité génératrice de revenu dans le but de  constituer son propre capital ; ce qui lui permettra d'être indépendante financièrement.
texts.en:
A. Charlotte was born around 1981.  She is married and the mother of five children, of whom four are in school.  Charlotte and her family live in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  She sells various items:  candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, etc.;  sauce condiments, including fresh tomatoes, onions, black pepper, garlic, ginger, okra, chili peppers, salt, eggs, vegetable oil, etc.;  and smoked fish.  Charlotte has been in this business for quite a long time, but she has not been able to build up her own capital.  For this reason, she’s requesting a loan from ALIDé.  She wants to develop further her income-generating business with the goal of building capital.  This will enable her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (tomatoes, cassava flour, lamp fuel, red palm oil, sugar) and boxes of fish

loans.name: Sulaiman's Group

texts.en:
N. Sulaiman is the leader of his all-youth group in Mukono. He is a determined and hard-working man with a fishing job of 25 years plus owning a retail shop in Bunankenda.

At first he was only fishing the waters of Lake Victoria until he saved some little capital that enabled him to open up a retail shop for increased income. From the shop alone, he is able to make weekly profits amounting to 50,000/=, though he still has a challenge with some of his customers taking goods on credit and taking too long to pay their bills.

At the time when he is busy in his shop, he is helped by his wife although she also has a farming business. Sulaiman says that the secret to his success is the self-administration that he has managed to pass on to his children, wife and group members. He needs a loan to help buy more stock for his retail shop: sugar, beans, maize seeds, groundnuts and many other things, since this the season for cultivation and farmers need seeds.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a 34-year-old single mother, with one school-going child. She has been in the cereals business for the last six years within Gilgil town.

Mary has never borrowed from any micro-finance institution before, but a need arose and after research, she was introduced to KADET by a friend who was also a KADET client.

This will be Mary’s first time borrowing from KADET, and she will use this loan to stock all types of cereals in her shop. Her future aspiration is to be a wholesale distributor of cereals in Naivasha town.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Restocking all types of cereals

loans.name: Lovinsa's Group

texts.en:
N. Lovinsa is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and strong business lady with a tailoring business in Wantoni that she has owned for 4 years, being able to make 40,000/= as weekly profits. However, she is mostly faced with a challenge of lack of enough capital since she needs to expand the business further by turning it into a tailoring school that will teach young girls the same trade at a fee.

Lovinsa also has goals to achieve and these involve building her own house and educating her children to University level. She is a responsible, married lady with 4 children, the eldest being 13 years old.

Lovinsa needs a loan to help her buy more tailoring materials like thread, needles, cloth, etc., and also partly to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buying materials to help Lovinsa in her tailoring business

loans.name: Gnonlonfoun Eric

texts.fr: B. Gnonlonfoun Eric, est né en 1976 dans la commune de DANGBO. Eric marié et père de deux enfants. Eric exerce comme métier la couture. Mais, les machines à coudre d’Eric sont devenues vétustes. Eric sollicite donc l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour acquérir une nouvelle machine à coudre. Ainsi, Eric pourra améliorer ses prestations pour répondre qualitativement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
B. Gnonlonfoun Eric was born in 1976 in the community of DANGBO. He is married and the father of two children. His works as a tailor by trade. But his sewing machines have gotten old and worn. He’s therefore requesting financial support from ALIDé to acquire a new sewing machine. He will thus be able to improve the services he offers to respond to customer demands in terms of quality.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en:
B. Teo is a hard-working and self-motivated lady with a retail shop business that she has owned for 5 years, in Kazinga. She is a married lady who was a housewife before getting into business and now does not regret the move taken.

At the moment, Teo is able to contribute to the development of her home by buying household items as well as paying her children’s school fees. In the shop, Teo mostly sells general merchandise that is used by home owners: sugar, soap, salt, maize flour, cooking oil and so on, and she is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week. She needs a loan to help restock her retail shop which will enable her to make more profits.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more products

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.fr: D. Mathieu est né en 1983 à Akpro Missérété. Mathieu est marié et père de deux enfants tous deux non scolarisés. Mathieu est couturier. Mathieu exerce la couture depuis plus de 10 ans. Depuis quelques temps, Mathieu enregistre de plus en plus une demande croissante de chemises et pantalons de la part de sa clientèle. Pour faire face à cette demande, Mathieu sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Mathieu was born in 1983 in Akpro Missérété. He is married and the father of two children who are not in school. He is a tailor and has been working at it for over ten years. For some time now, Mathieu has noted more and more demand from his customers for shirts and pants. To address this demand, he’s requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Saidat's Group

texts.en:
M. Saidat is a friendly and hardworking lady with a strong determination to grow more in business. She manages two businesses: for five years she has been involved in the sale of charcoal and in brick-making in Kavule and Bukasa respectively. This enables her to get some profits for catering for her family’s daily needs.

However, for the charcoal business, Saidat is mainly faced with the challenge of transporting the sacks of charcoal from the villages to her stall, which is usually expensive. For the bricks, she employs men to do the brick-making and burning. She makes sure that she does not charge her customers exorbitantly, and hence makes more sales.

Saidat needs a loan to be able to buy more bags of charcoal and the balance will help to pay part of her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and to pay school fees

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate sells fish like crayfish and smoked fish. She also sells vegetables. She is 40 years old and married with two children. She is from Edo State.

Kate hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary N. is the chairperson of her group in Katosi. She is a business lady with a tailoring business she transacts from her home. She makes and mends people's clothes and sells a few new clothing materials from a stall. Also in the photo is Christine B., the secretary of the group, and Madinah N., the treasurer. Each one of them needs a loan to boost their businesses.

loans.use: Buy more clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth sells yams and she hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 48 years old and is married with four children.

Loveth hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
N. Irene is a 49-year-old lady and married with four children. All are grownups and married with their own children. However, Irene helps to take care of four orphaned grand children.

For nine years, Irene has run a business in Bugembe, Budumbuli East selling charcoal, pancakes, cassava and Irish potato chips and, because of this, she is well known by almost everyone there. Out of her business, she makes 45,000/= as weekly profits and this is mostly attributed to her good customer care and the availability of loans to enable her to increase her capital. She hopes to start up another business selling maize flour and this will enable her buy her own lot and build a house.

Irene needs a loan to be able to buy more charcoal to increase her stock. She is such a friendly and determined person with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for increased sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 60 years old and is married with six children. She sells sachet water (water in plastic bags) and also yams and has been in the business for the past ten years.

Rose is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more yams and sachet water to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is married with two children and she is 30 years old. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.

Tina has a beauty salon where she makes lovely hairstyles. She also sells drinks and hair extensions in her salon. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Fausta's Group

texts.en:
N. Fausta is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 47 years old and married with four children aged 24 to 18 years. She cares for her parents in Bajjo.

Fausta has been a businesswoman involved in the sale of charcoal for four years now and she is able to make 20,000/= a week as profits. This has enabled her to look after her family. She also sells green bananas from the same stall and the strategic positioning of her business is key to its success. She strives to ensure that her businesses grow more to enable her to pay her children’s school fees until they are done with studies.

Fausta needs a loan as increased capital so as to be able to boost her business, especially to buy more bags of charcoal and green bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and green bananas to sell

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift is 45 years old, married and has five children. She makes a living selling yams in the New Benin Market, and has applied for a loan to buy more yams to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and extends her thanks to everyone at Kiva whose participation makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 56 years old, married and has five children. She makes a living selling many different kinds of drinks, and has been in this business for a long time. She has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell, and extends her thanks to everyone at Kiva whose participation makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ganiyat

texts.en: For the last five years, Ganiyat has made a living selling food items and drinks. She is married, has two children and is 30 years old. Ganiyat and her family live in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and exends her thanks to Kiva lenders for their participation and support.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks to sell

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty K. chairs a loan group located in Mukono. She is a married and has three children, all of whom are in secondary school, and is also raising her late sister’s child. For the last four years, she has made a living selling spare car parts from a garage in Seeta. She buys these parts in Kampala, and works with her husband to resell them to local customers. Betty is happy to chair her lending group and own a business that is doing well, thanks to the help of previous loans. She needs a new loan to expand her business by buying more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet A. is 34 years old, married and has three children. She makes a living selling drinks, and has been in this business for many years. She lives with her family in Edo State, Nigeria, and has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks  to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with three children and she is 34 years old. She owns a boutique where she sells clothes, shoes, etc. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.

Cecilia hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate sells charcoal to people for cooking, baking and other purposes and has been in the business for the past six years. She is 51 years old and married with four children.

Kate hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell to people.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en:
Anthonia is a hairstylist and also sells hair extensions. She is 32 years old and married with four children.

Anthonia is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella sells crates of drinks and kerosene and has been in this business for a long time. She is married with four children and she is 36 years old.

Stella hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma S. G. tiene 45 años y está casada con el señor Maximiliano Wilson Ancieta Navia por mas de 25 años, ambos trabajan en la compra y venta de Turriles, Bidones y Baldes de plástico y metal en un mercado de Cochabamba conocido como el mercado “La Pampa”

La señora Irma vive en la zona de Villa Bush en Cochabamba, junto a sus dos hijos los cuales estudian Administración en la universidad pública “Universidad Mayor de San Simón”. Sus hijos estudian en la mañana y por las tardes ayudan en el puesto de venta que su mama tiene en el mercado.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de más Turriles, Bidones Y Baldes, puesto que la demanda subió en los últimos meses y lo que tiene no le es suficiente. La señora Irma tuvo un crédito anterior con nuestra institución para el mismo destino (compra de Turriles, Bidones y Baldes), y pago con responsabilidad y puntualidad por eso la consideramos para un segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Miss Irma S. G. is 45 years old and has been married to Mr. Maximiliano Wilson Ancieta Navia for more than 25 years. They both work in buying and selling barrels, cans, and buckets of plastic and metal in a market in Cochabamba known as “La Pampa” market.

Miss Irma lives in the Villa Bush area in Cochabamba, together with her two children who study Administration at the public university “Universidad Mayor de San Simón.” Her children study in the morning and in the afternoons they help at the sales stand that their mom has in the market.

The loan will be used for the purchase of more barrels, cans, and buckets since the demand increased in recent months and what she has is not enough. Miss Irma had a previous loan with our institution for the same purpose (purchase of barrels, cans, and buckets) and she paid responsibly and punctually and for this reason we are considering her for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital for business (purchase of barrels, cans, and buckets)

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has a boutique where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with a child and she is 27 years old.

Mercy hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
M. James is 47 years old and the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is married with ten children aged between 24 and 2 years and all are in school.

James is a hardworking and determined man with a dairy farming business that he has been running for over fifteen years. He has cows that give him milk for sale and at times he buys from other farmers who do not have the means to transport their own milk. He also has a banana plantations that provides matooke (plantain) both for sale and for home consumption and this helps him pay school fees for his children.

James needs a loan to help him buy drugs and farm inputs which will enable him get enough quantity and quality of milk production.

loans.use: To buy drugs and farm inputs to improve his milk production

loans.name: Lyanda Kilwake

texts.en:
Lyanda is 47 years old, married and blessed with five children who are all studying. He has been in agriculture for the past ten years now, and his farm is located in Regeya in Eldoret.

Lyanda A. was introduced to KADET by a member after wanting to expand his business but lacking the resources. He intends to buy feed for his livestock with his loan. His future looks bright as he seems to be making profits, not losses.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET at: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 35 year old and married with four children. She sells food like peppers, melon, oil, etc. and has been in the business for a long time.

Christy hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more food to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and married with a child. She is a hair dresser, and she also sells kitchen utensils. Her salon is open daily from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She hopes for a loan of 140,000 NGN to buy more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to LAPO and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils to sell in her salon

loans.name: Stella Osbohen

texts.en:
Stella Osbohen is 37 years old and married with three children. She is in the catering business. She also sells clothes and jewelry.

Stella Osbohen is requesting a loan of 60,000 NGN to buy more clothes and jewelry to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Darius' Group

texts.en:
Darius is 47 years old and the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is married with six children who are all in school. He also cares for other dependents, including orphans.

With a retail and tailoring shop, Darius is a hard-working and determined man. He also owns cows that give him milk for use at home as well as to sell and to make ghee for sale.

Darius needs a loan to help him restock his retail shop with more goods, since the savings and profits from this venture help to boost his other businesses and pay for his children’s education. He is such a hard-working and friendly man with a dream of expanding all of his businesses for more profitability.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more products.

loans.name: David 5,6 Group

texts.en:
Arsina shares a home with at least five other family members. They live in a wooden house with a tin roof and no electricity, running water or telephone service, but all of his children currently attend the local public school. The family lives in La Romana, an area on the southeast coast of the Dominican Republic.

Despite his lack of formal education, Arsina recently began using his skills and resources to start earning a regular income through his "motoconcho" service. A motoconcho is a small motorcycle used to give people rides around town.

Arsina became an associate of Esperanza International, has successfully completed two loan cycles and is looking to start his third. With this loan he is planning on buying a new motor for his motoconcho so that he can make enough money to give his family three meals a day and ensure that his children can finish their education. Arsina would like to thank all donors for their support.

loans.use: To buy a new motor for his motoconcho

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian sells sarongs and baking materials such as baking powder, flour, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with nine children and she is 45 years old. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She requests the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and baking materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and baking materials to sell

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a 31-year-old woman who is married to Alphonse Odero. They have five school-age children. 

Priscah has been supplying motor vehicle paints for auto garages in the busy Naivasha town for five years. She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and with the loan for which she has applied, she plans to add inventory in her shop by buying more auto paints. In the future, Priscah is planning to expand her business, and instead of just retail,  she will also supply paints in wholesale around Naivasha town.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more paints for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a widow with seven children. She is 45 years old. She sells garri, which is made from cassava. She has been in the business for a long time. Comfort lives in Edo State and hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for the loan

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Rafina

texts.en: Rafina sells drinks to make a living. She is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for over three years. She requests a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William N. is a 36-year-old single man. He has been making and repairing shoes for the last five years along one of the streets in Naivasha town.

William was introduced to KADET by one of his customers who is already a KADET client. This is William's first loan since he was not able to access help from any other financial institution before. He intends to buy a motorbike and venture into the taxi industry, for this will improve his living standard and add to the income he gets from his cobbler business.

He dreams of owning a public service van someday.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells secondhand clothes, bags and jewelry. She has been in business for past 20 years. She requests a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry and clothes to sell. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelries and clothes to sell

loans.name: Las Bendecidas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Bendecidas” esta representado por la señora Mónica y  integrado por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta de verduras, refrescos, comida, cosméticos entre los varones se dedican a la elaboración de pan y a la construcción de viviendas. La competencia dentro de su rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero estan contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Las Bendecidas” Microfinance Institute, represented by Monica, is comprised of 15 members who sell vegetables, beverages, food, and cosmetics. The men in the group are in the bread making or home construction business. Despite the fact that competition is high, they know how to get head with their businesses. The loan will be used to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies and tools so that they can increase profits, allowing them to offer their families a better quality of life. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are currently in their first loan cycle in our institute, but they are happy that they have been given the financial support that will help them generate better profits and improve their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Caracol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Caracol” esta representado por la señora Gladis y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales can cursando su primer ciclo, en general los socios del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales entre las que se pueden mencionar a la venta D. pan, gelatina, ropa, comida, empanadas y a actividades como la costura, albañilería, enfermería y al servicio D. transporte público. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
The “Caracol” group is represented by Gladis and consists of fourteen members, who are in their first loan cycle. Most of the members have businesses, including, to name a few, sales of bread, gelatin, clothing, food, and empanadas; and activities, including sewing, bricklaying, nursing, and public transportation. Even though competition in their fields is high, they know how to move their businesses ahead. They’ll use the loan to grow their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools, so they can increase their incomes and proviD. their families a better standard of living. With respect to their experience with loans, the members are in their first loan cycle with the organization, but they are satisfied that it will proviD. economic support to help them generate more income and improve their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Orquidia 1 Group

texts.en:
Patria C. ia an associate with Esperanza International who has successfully completed three loan cycles and is currently starting her fourth as the group coordinator of her Bank of Hope. Patria lives in Los Alcarrizos, an area north of Santo Domingo, where running water and electricty are unreliable. She lives in a wooden house with a tin roof, with her husband and two young children. 

Patria sells clothing in the street and also owns a small restaurant where she sells food to the community. She is planning to use this loan to buy more sweaters, pants, shirts, sheets, and other clothing merchandise. With her increased income, she is hoping to be able to buy her own house to have more space and security for her family. Her dream for the future is to expand her restaurant and have her kids grow up well educated and with a promising future. She would like to thank all of the donors for helping her to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina sells shoes and bags to make a living in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and single with no children. She requests a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Josephat Musyoki

texts.en:
Josephat is 35 years old and is married to Priscah Kaluki. They have one child who is six years old. Josephat has been operating a grocery store in a densely populated area within Nairobi, but without any competition for his type of business. He relies on customers who are residents from within the area.

The client has never serviced a loan from any other Microfinance Institution before and he was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a KADET client. He wants to use the loan to open another green grocery store in another strategic location which will supplement his daily earnings. With the extra profit, he plans to stop paying rent for the current kiosk and build his own kiosk.

His future hopes are to become a reliable vegetable and fruits supplier.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used in starting another green grocery kiosk in an indentified strategic location

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 45 years old and married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She requests a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Villa Cochabamba Group

texts.es: El grupo “Villa Cochabamba” esta representado por la señora Marlene y conformada 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta de frutas, empanadas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, y entre los varones a la elaboración de pan, y a la albañilería.  La competencia dentro de sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero están contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Marlene represents the Villa Cochabamba Group, which is comprised of 12 members. They work at different activities like selling fruit, empanadas, and groceries in neighborhood stores. The men in the group make bread and are bricklayers. The competition in their fields is high. Because of this, they know how to get ahead in their work. The loan is for the growth of their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to improve their incomes and allow them to give their families a better quality of life. As far as the members’ loan experience goes, this is their first loan cycle with the Institution. They are happy to be offered economic support that helps them generate greater income and improve their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Nneka is 33 years old and married with one child. She is a hair stylist and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase a refrigerator for selling drinks and sachet water. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator for selling drinks and cold sachet

loans.name: Los Amistosos Ii Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “los Amistosos II” esta representado por la señora María Victoria y conformado por 14 miembros donD. la gran mayoría del grupo ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad D. crédito siendo socias antiguas que se dedican a venta D. comida, refrescos y pastillas, ropa y D. cosméticos tiendas D. abarrotes, el varón es albañil el cual necesita capital para adquirir nuevas herramientas que facilite su trabajo y el resto D. las socias requiere D. mercadería e insumos para agrandar sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico para ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
The community bank "los Amistosos II" is represented by doña María Victoria and has 14 members. The majority of the group has already worked through loans as they are old members who sell food, pops and tablets, clothes, cosmetics and groceries. The gentleman is a building worker who needs capital to buy new tools to make his work easier, and the rest of the members need merchandise and supplies to increase their businesses and improve their income which is the means of support of their families. Competition is high but they know how to make their economical activity profitable. As to the experience with loans, it is the their first cycle within the institution but they are happy to receive economical support to help them generate higher income and improve the life quality of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with eight children and she is 50 years old. She sells kerosene in retail to her customers in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. This is her main source of income. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She also sells firewood in wholesale to her customers. She loves selling firewood because she has a lot of customers who patronize her firewood business. She is married with five children and she is 43 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for sale

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: El grupo “virgen D. Fátima” esta representado por la señora Maria y conformado por 16 miembros donD. los varones trabajan en el ingenio azucarero Guabira y aparte tienen pequeños negocios D. venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio los cuales serán atendidos durante el día por sus esposas, los otros varones son albañiles y taxistas los cuales requisen D. herramientas D. trabajo para realizar un trabajo mas eficiente, entre  las mujeres se dedican a la venta D. diferentes productos como comida, abarrotes, frutas, cosméticos, la presidenta se dedica a la venta D. cerveza y sodas en su domicilio. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
María represents the Virgen D. Fátima Group, which is comprised of 16 members. The men in the group work in Guabira Sugar Production, and have small businesses selling groceries in neighborhood stores. Their wives take care of the stores during the day. Other men are bricklayers and taxi drivers, and they need work tools to do their work more efficiently. The women in the group sell different products like food, groceries, fruit, and cosmetics. The president sells beer and soda in her home. The competition in their fields is high. Because of this they know how to get ahead in their work. The loan is for the growth of their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to increase their income. This will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. In respect to their loan experience, this is their first loan cycle with the Institution. They are happy to be offered an economic support that helps to generate better income and improves their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 36 years old and married with two children. She is a tailor and has been in the business for some years. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase tailoring materials to sell. It will also help her to deliver prompt service. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Niriam

texts.es:
La señora Niriam G. Q. tiene 27 años. Tiene 1 hija de un año de edad, y su marido no vive con ellas por que por cuestiones económicas tuvo que ir a trabajar a Argentina ya que no lograba conseguir trabajo en Bolivia.

La señora Niriam vive en la casa de su madre ubicada en la zona de Maica Central en Cochabamba, en su domicilio es donde tiene su ganado lechero con el cual produce leche. Toda la producción de leche entrega diariamente a una señora que elabora yogurt y otros productos lácteos. Su mama es quien la ayuda con el cuidado de las vacas ya que su marido no está para ayudarle como siempre, y con un bebe de 1 año es complicado hacerlo sola.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de ganado lechero para poder incrementar la producción actual de leche que tienen, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su nivel de vida. La señora Niriam espera poder incrementar su ganado de tal forma que gane lo suficiente para contratar a alguien que la ayude con el cuidado de las vacas y así no tener que depender de su mama la cual ya es una persona mayor y también poder darle más atención y cuidado a su bebe.
texts.en:
Señora Niriam G. Q. is 27 years old and she has a daughter who is a year old. Her husband does not live with them for economic reasons; he had to go to work in Argentina because he could not find work in Bolivia. Señora Niriam lives in her mother's house which is located in the Maica Centra area of Cochabamba. She has dairy cows on the property which produce milk. All of her milk production is delivered daily to a woman who makes yogurt and other dairy products. Since her husband is away her mother helps her care for the cows which, with a 1-year old baby, is difficult for her to manage on her own. The loan will be used for the purchase of dairy cows in order to increase her production of milk, and this way she can improve her income and as a consequence her standard of living. Señora Niriam hopes to be able to increase her earnings such that she is able to earn enough to hire someone who can help her with the care of the cows, and this way she would not have to depend on her mother, who is an older person. Also, this way she could have more time to give attention and care to her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Prica

texts.en: Prica is married with three children and she is 35 years old. She sells beef at the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beef to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Delia Rosa

texts.en:
Delia is a member of The Wheatfield village bank. She is 72 years old and six months ago, she became a widow. She has two grown children who are single and live with her. 

Delia worked for 28 years in as a candy saleswoman until she retired. However, she reentered the job market as a freelance saleswoman ten years ago. She earns commissions, but also buys sweet bread and empanadas in bulk and sells them to stores in her neighborhood. She says that with the loans from FINCA, she is able to invest in the sweets merchandise she sells. 

Delia needs a loan for 1,000 soles to buy cupcakes, sweet bread, and empanadas in bulk. She reached her dream of having a house, but she still has a lot of confidence to continue to work and says she will continue until her strength goes.

loans.use: To buy cupcakes, sweet bread, and empanadas in bulk

loans.name: La Pampa Group

texts.es: El grupo “La pampa” es un grupo nuevo que esta representado por la señora Basilia e integrado de 16 miembros,  de las cuales algunas ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad en grupos anteriores. La mayoría se dedican a diferentes actividades, los hombres algunos son transportista, y otros empleados, entre la s mujeres se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en tiendas propias, otras a la venta de empanadas, comida, refrescos, a la elaboración de pan, cometidos, perfumes y pescado. La competencia dentro de sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero están contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
"La Pampa" Group is a new 16-member group that is led by Basilia; some of the members have been a part of other past group loans. The majority of the group works in different activities. Some of the men are taxi or bus drivers, among other jobs. Some of the women work in small shops selling groceries, while others sell empanadas (meat or vegetable filled pastries), food, refreshments, bread, perfume, and fish. The competition among these lines of work is high, so it is very important to excel at their trade. The loan is to be used for the growth of their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, supplies, and tools to better their incomes, which allows them to give their families a better quality of life. As soon as this credit experience runs its first cycle through the institution, they look forward to being content that it has brought them economic assistance through improving their income and the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funding for operations

loans.name: 3 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “3 de Septiembre” esta representado por la señora Kattia y conformado por 12 miembros de los cuales 3 son hombres y 9 mujeres. Este grupo esta integrado por una mayoría de personas que se dedican a la prestación de servicios en empresas privadas, el resto se dedican a la venta de pan, comida y los varones son operadores de maquinaria pesada La competencia dentro de sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero están contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
The communal bank “3 de Septiembre” is represented by Señora Kattia and consists of 12 members, 3 of whom are men and 9 of whom are women. The majority of people in this group provide services in private businesses, others sell bread and food, and the men are heavy machine operators. The competition in these areas is strong, and they know that they must continue to move forward in their respective businesses. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise, supplies and tools to assist in the growth of these businesses so that the borrowers can increase their incomes and give their families a better quality of life. As far as credit experience, these members are in their first cycle with the institution, but they are happy that it is providing them economic support that will help them to generate better incomes and a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Frédéric

texts.fr: D. Frédéric est né en 1973 dans la commune d’Avrankou. Frédéric est marié et père de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Frédéric  et sa famille vivent dans la commune de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Frédéric est couturier. Frédéric exerce la couture depuis environs  10 ans. Mais Frédéric ne dispose pas d'assez de machines à coudre pour honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de sa clientèle. Ceci fait que  Frédéric  met assez de retard dans la livraison des tenues à sa clientèle. Alors, pour mieux satisfaire cette clientèle, Frédéric sollicite un crédit d’ALIDé pour acheter de nouvelles machines.
texts.en:
D. Frédéric was born in 1973 in the town of Avrankou. He is married and the father of two children who are both in school. He and his family live in the town of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Frédéric is a tailor. He has been working as a tailor for about ten years. But he doesn't have enough sewing machines for honoring his commitments relative to his customers. This means that he is pretty late in delivering outfits to his customers. So, to satisfy his customers better, Frédéric is requesting a loan from ALIDé for buying new machines.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and sewing supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Etuwere

texts.en: Etuwere is married with five children and she is 35 years old. She has a grocery store where she sells soap, drinks, etc. she has been in this business for a long time. She requests a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yvette Delia

texts.en:
Yvette is a member of The Wheatfield village bank. She is 26 years old, single, and has no children. 

Two years ago, Yvette studied a course in handicrafts and now has her own business of making handmade toys for children with imitation pearl and jewelry materials. She also sells chocolates and bonsai trees. She sells her handicrafts to shops and stands in the market. With her loans from FINCA she is able to invest in her business and buy more merchandise. 

Yvette needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy thread and imitation pearls and material to make imitation jewelry. Her dream is to have a shop where she sells all her handicrafts.

loans.use: To buy materials for making imitation jewelry

loans.name: Virgen Del Socavon Group

texts.es: El grupo “Virgen del Socavón”  esta representado por la señora Maria Elena y conformada por 12 miembros que van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando ganas D. trabajar y responsabilidad en sus pagos. La mayoría D. las socias se dedica a  la venta D. comida, refrescos, elaboración D. helados y a la venta D. lácteos, en cuanto a la competencia que tienen en el mercado una mayoría tiene años trabajando en el mismo rubro por lo que ya cunetas con experiencia y clientes fijos. El destino del financiamiento servirá para la adquisición D. maquinA. nuevas como freidoras D. pollo, cortadora automática D. papas para el mejoramiento D. sus habientes D. trabajo y para compra D. mercadería e insumos que les ayudara a mejores ingresos puesto que una gran parte D. los miembros del grupo son el jefe D. sus familias y por enD. el sustento D. su hogar. En general los socios ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a su crédito anterior con la Fundación Agrocapital que esta dispuesto a apoyar a sus grupos siempre y cuando estos tengan deseos D. salir adelante
texts.en:
Maria Elena represents the Virgen del Socavón group, which is comprised of 12 members who are in their second loan cycle with the Institution. They demonstrate the desire to work, and they are responsible in their payments. Most of the members sell food, soft drinks, make ice cream, and sell dairy products. Regarding the competition that they have in the market, most of them have years of working in this field, experience, and regular customers. The loan is to acquire new machines like chicken fryers and automatic potato cutters to improve their work environment. They will also buy merchandise and supplies that will help them get greater earnings. Many of their members are the head of their families, and they support their households. In general, the members have experience in solidarity groups, thanks to a previous loan with the Agrocapital Foundation. The Foundation is always willing to support groups when they have the desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 44 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and groceries. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She requests a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Atchadé Gabriel

texts.fr: D. Atchadé Gabriel est né en 1966 à Akpro missérété dans la commune  de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Gabriel est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants dont deux (02) scolarisés. Gabriel est un soudeur. Pour accroitre son revenu pour le mieux être de sa famille, Gabriel veut commencer par fabriquer et commercialiser les instruments en fer utilisés dans la vie courante (puisettes, foyers, râteaux, portes, fenêtres, etc.).  C’est pour cette raison que Gabriel sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Atchadé Gabriel was born in 1966 in Akpro Missérété in the town of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. He is married and the father of five children, of whom two are in school. Gabriel is a welder. To grow his revenues for his family's well-being, he wants to begin by making and selling items made of iron for use in everyday life (ladles, stoves, rakes, gates, windows, etc.) For this reason, Gabriel is requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy welding supplies and equipment for making ladles, stoves, rakes, gates, and windows

loans.name: Las Hijas De Jesús Group

texts.es: Las Socias del Banco Comunal LAS HIJAS DE JESUS  están representadas por la señora Viviana y conformadas por 14 miembros los cuales residen en el mismo barrio, todas tienen negocios propios como venta de frutas en el mercadito y teje carteras de macramé, la señora Teresa  tiene tienda de  abarrotes, las demás socias se dedican a la venta de comida, ropa, juguetes, pan, empanadas y cosméticos. La competencia dentro de sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero están contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Las Hijas de Jesús" ("The Daughters of Jesus") are represented by Mrs. Viviana and composed of fourteen members who live in the same neighborhood. All the women have their own businesses such as selling fruits in the market, crocheting macramé purses, and Mrs. Teresa's grocery store. The other members sell food, clothes, toys, bread, empanadas, and cosmetics. The competition within their areas of commerce is high, but in spite of this they know how to keep their businesses going. The loan will be used for growing their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, raw materials, and tools to increase their incomes further, which would allow them to give their families a better quality of life. As for the women's credit experience, they are beginning their first loan cycle with the institution, but they are glad that it offers them the economic support to help them generate greater incomes and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise, raw materials, and tools

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier d’Ahadjikpoto à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un douanier et cette activité lui permet entre autre d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle a débuté cette activité en 1982 ; c’est donc un secteur qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement à cause de la longue expérience déjà à son actif. Avec le temps, elle a pu détecter auprès de sa clientèle qu’elle pourra aussi se lancer dans la vente de tissus de différentes catégories, de bijoux et de perles. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un bal de tissus ; le prêt servira également à acheter des perles et bijoux de qualités diverses. Par rapport au remboursement du prêt elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour cela. Elle est mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is a retailer of general food products in the Ahadjikpoto area of Lomé. She is married to a customs officer, and her business allows her, among other things, to contribute financially to the care of her family. She began this business in 1982; it is thus a field which she has mastered perfectly thanks to the length of experience already in her favour. With time, she was able to find out from her customers that she could also successfully sell different types of fabric, jewelry, and pearls. It is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy a bale of fabric; at the same time, this loan will serve to buy pearls and jewelry of varying quality. Regarding the repayment of the loan, she has no worries. She is the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and jewelry

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: G. Marie est née en 1986 à Avrankou dans la commune  de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Marie est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Marie est coiffeuse de profession. Mais, Marie vend aussi des cartes de recharge téléphonique. Marie veut mieux équiper son salon de coiffure pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C’est pour cette raison que Marie sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Marie was born in 1986 in Avrankou in the town of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  Marie is married and the mother of two children.  She is a hairdresser by profession.  But she also sells mobile phone recharge cards.  She wants to equip her hair salon further in order to respond to the requirements of her customers.  For this reason, Marie is requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a steaming hood for drying hair

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Mama est une vendeuse ambulante des vêtements de friperie dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé ; c’est en 2001 qu’elle a débuté ce commerce parce que le revenu financier de son mari, conducteur de taxi, n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers de leurs 03 enfants. C’est pour cette raison que cette dame a pris la décision de se lancer dans le commerce de friperie. Elle se promène de maison en maison et dispose désormais d’une clientèle qui lui reste fidèle. Ainsi, dès l’ouverture de nouveaux bals de vêtements, elle donne l’exclusivité des meilleurs jupes et habits à ses plus fidèles clients, ce qui la rapproche à chaque fois de sa clientèle. Actuellement elle a un besoin urgent de lancer une nouvelle  commande ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 bals de vêtements de friperie.
texts.en:
Mama is a traveling retailer who sells second-hand clothing in the Adakpamé area of Lomé; she started this business in 2001 because her husband's income as a taxi driver was no longer able to cover all the financial needs of their three children. It is for this reason that this lady decided to begin selling second-hand clothing. She walks from house to house and has built up a faithful clientele. Thus, every time a new bale of clothing is opened, she reserves the best skirts and outfits for her most faithful clients, which increases her bonds with her customers each time. Currently, she urgently needs to send out a new order; this is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 5 bales of second-hand clothing.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Simon

texts.fr: G. Simon est né en 1973 dans la commune d'Akpro Missérété et y vit avec sa famille. Simon est en effet marié et père de 03 enfants. Simon est couturier. Mais Simon ne dispose pas d'assez de machines à coudre pour honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de sa clientèle. Ceci fait que  Simon  met assez de retard dans la livraison des tenues à sa clientèle. Alors, pour mieux satisfaire cette clientèle, Simon sollicite un crédit d’ALIDé pour acheter une nouvelle machine.
texts.en:
G. Simon was born in 1973 in the town of Akpro Missérété.  He lives there with his family.  In fact, he is married and the father of three children.  Simon is a tailor, but he doesn't have enough sewing machines for honoring his commitments relative to his customers, resulting in him being pretty late when delivering some outfits to his customers.  So, to satisfy his customers better, he's requesting a loan from ALIDé for buying a new machine. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: G. Rachelle est née vers 1969 à Adjarra. Rachelle est mariée et mère de deux  enfants tous scolarisés. Rachelle vend des chaussures, sacs, bols, vêtements, etc. Rachelle mène cette activité pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, Rachelle mène comme activité secondaire la vente de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Malgré la passion que Rachelle a pour son activité elle ne dispose pas d’assez de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges. C’est pour ce fait que Rachelle sollicite un crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son activité afin de faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges et d’autre part de se constituer une épargne.
texts.en:
G. Rachelle was born around 1969 in Adjarra.  She is married and the mother of two children who are both in school.  She sells shoes, bags, basins, clothing, etc.  Rachelle has been running this business to help her husband to cope with family expenses.  To diversify her revenue sources, she runs a second business, selling various items: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc. Despite the passion she has for her business, Rachelle lacks the funds for carrying out her work and to earn more to meet her responsibilities.  Given this fact, she's requesting a loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business, so as to deal with her different responsibilities on the one hand and with establishing some savings on the other hand. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, tubs, clothing, and more

loans.name: Alatin

texts.fr: H. Alatin est née en 1972 à Adjarra. Alatin est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. C’est de l’huile rouge de palme que Alatin vend. Grâce à cette activité, Alatin aide son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Alatin vend aussi de la bouillie de maïs pour diversifier ses sources de revenus. Malgré la passion que  Alatin a pour son activité elle ne dispose pas assez de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges. Pour ce fait, Alatin sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges et d’autre part de se constituer une épargne.
texts.en:
H. Alatin was born in 1972 in Adjarra. She is married and the mother of three children who are all in school. Red palm oil is what Alatin sells. Thanks to this business, she is helping her husband to cope with family expenses. She also sells cornmeal porridge to diversify her revenue sources. Despite her passion for her business, Alatin doesn't have enough funds for carrying out her work and for earning more income to meet her responsibilities. Given this fact, she's requesting a loan for bolstering her working capital to deal with her various expenses on the one hand and with establishing some savings on the other hand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Freedom Ladies Group

texts.en:
Mavis is 47 years old. She is married with two kids, both boys. One is at the university and the youngest is at the primary five in school. She is a vendor of hardware goods, like assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammer, PVC pipes, brushes, trap nets etc., in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region. She buys from importers at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. She requests a loan to enable her to increase her stock of paints, nails, hammers, etc., to accelerate her business' progress. With the loan, she hopes to increase savings to expand her shop to include the sale of cement. She desires to provide a better education for her children and would be grateful for the assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Freedom Ladies’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and use peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory and expand the business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 24 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y persistente en sus metas, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares (alquilada) y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de golosinas, actualmente es la responsable de un kiosco escolar, en el cual ha puesto mucho empeño para que esté bien surtido de productos. Su kiosco es muy concurrido por los niños en los recreos, a quienes atiende con mucha paciencia y cariño. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y lo hace muy bien ya que tiene bastante tacto para tratar a los niños, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su kiosco, ya que la escuela funciona en los turnos de mañana y tarde. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes con la cual pueda tener mejores ingresos.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Betty con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, puesto que quiere acceder a otros préstamos en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una persona muy alegre. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para que su kiosco luzca más atractivo.
texts.en:
Betty is 24 years old and is a very hard-working woman who is persisent in meeting her goals. She lives in the house of one of her family members, and what she desires more than anything is to excel in life. She makes a living by selling candy. Currently she is in charge of a school kiosk, in which she has put a lot of effort so that it is well-stocked with products. Her kiosk is very popular among the children during recess, and she attends to them with a lot of patience and care. The thing that she likes the most about her job is selling, and she does it very well since she has enough tact to deal with the children. She has been performing this activity for four years, and she considers the most difficult part staying inside her kiosk all day, since the school operates during the morning and afternoon shift. In the future she hopes to have a grocery store with which she can earn a better income. This is Betty's fifth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time and is disposed to do so, since she wants to have access to other loans in the future. She is very happy in her communal bank. With the 2,500 nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more merchandise so that her kiosk appears more attractive.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the increase of merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Quingeo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quingeo esta formado por un grupo de 6 socias y un socio que buscan la superación personal  y su bienestar familiar.  Quingeo es un parroquia que se encuentra a una  hora y media a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  es un lugar con un paisaje muy hermoso, su vegetación es exuberante, tiene una flora y fauna envidiable, las fiestas más conocidas son las de carnaval por la variedad de actos que realizan como por ejemplo la reina del capulí y muchos más, es uno de los hermosos lugares que tiene la Ciudad de Cuenca.

 De los integrantes  del banco comunal Quingeo todos han migrado de su terruño hacia la ciudad en busca de mejores días para su familia y nos brindan sus historias.

La señora  Manuela  Q. V. es oriunda de la parroquia Quingeo, es socia del banco comunal del  mismo nombre,  migro hace dos años a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de  un mejor futuro para su familia, vive en el sector de la feria libre,  Manuela tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene 8 hijos,  de los hijos  mayores no recuerda sus edades pero nos indica que  se encuentran casados y cada uno vive con su familia, aún tiene dos hijos pequeños de 9 y 6 años de edad, ellos viven en la casa que tienen en Quingeo al  cuidado de una hermana mayor, mientras que en la ciudad viven  arrendando con su esposo, él trabaja en un pequeño kiosco que es de su propiedad y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

 Manuela vende verduras en el mercado de la feria libre hace dos años, le va muy bien, y mucho más en los días de feria miércoles, sábados y domingos, le entregan la verdura y la revende recorriendo  todo el mercado, está feliz  porque el municipio de Cuenca esta por entregarles un puesto para que trabajen dentro del mercado y no deambulando por ahí.

Este  es su primer crédito y una amiga le integro al grupo para que también se supere económicamente, el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entrega lo va ha invertir en la compra del puesto ya que le hace falta y también en comprar más verduras para su negocio

Su meta es de llegar a cultivar todas sus tierras por que por el momento están  abandonadas para abastecer en algo su puesto de verduras en el mercado.

La señora Rosario Del Cisne B.  es otra  socia del banco comunal Quingeo, migro hace 18 años de su pueblo natal Quingeo a la ciudad de Cuenca radicándose en ella, Rosario tiene 31 años de edad, hace poco tiempo contrajo nupcias pero viven juntos ya doce años, fruto de su amor procreo 3 hijos de 9, 7, 2 años de edad, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando, su esposo es albañil, se apoyan mutuamente, cuando su esposo no encuentra trabajo le ayuda en el negocio.

Rosario se dedica a la venta de verduras, granos, cebolla, etc.  en el mercado de la feria libre. Es comerciante desde que tiene uso de razón, nos cuenta que le va bien gracias a Dios y los días que más vende son los sábados y domingos, pero todos los días sale a vender recorriendo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y los días feriados sale a vender desde las 4 de la mañana para poder ocupar un puesto en el mercado.

Es su primer crédito, una compañera la invito a ser parte del Bankito y el dinero que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entrega es para invertir en la compra de su puesto propio en el mercado y también para comprar más granos y ampliar su negocio.

Su sueño es  ahorrar para comprar un carro o un terreno. 

La señora Carmen Rosa D. M. es socia del banco comunal Quingeo, vive por el camino viejo a Baños en la zona urbana de Cuenca. Carmen tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre tiene una niña de 3 años  y se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses y aun no sabe el sexo del hijo que espera,  no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando, tienen una buena relación con su cónyuge, su esposo trabaja en la colocación de estructuras metálicas y se ayudan económicamente para solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Carmen trabaja como camarera en un restaurante por el sector de la feria libre, ya lleva 4 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien por que sus jefes son muy buenos y le tienen un cariño especial acota.

Es su primer préstamo en la fundación, una amiga la invito para que se parte del banco y acceda a los beneficios que la institución  entrega a sus socias.

El préstamo que la fundación le entrega es para cubrir los gastos de su alumbramiento, y su sueño es de llegar a tener su propio  restaurante.
texts.en:
Quingeo Communal Bank is comprised of 6 members as well as member who is using the loan for for personal growth and family health. Quingeo is a parish located an hour and a half outside the Cuenca city, a location with beautiful landscape, lush vegetation, and enviable flora and fauna. Quingeo's most well-known festivals include Carnaval, because of its various events including the Capulí Queen's event and many more. It is one of the most beautiful areas outside of Cuenca city. All of the members of Quingeo Communal Bank migrated to their current location from the city, in search of better days for their families. Manuela Q. V. is a Quingeo parish native, and she is a member of the Communal Bank of the same name. She migrated to the area from Cuenca city two years ago to find a better future for her family. She lives in the open market sector. Manuela is 49 years old, she is married, and has 8 children. She does not remember the ages of her two oldest children, but they are both married and live with their respective families. She also has two young children, 9 and 6 years old, who live with her at home in Quingeo and their older sister takes care of them. The children also live in a rented home with Manuela's husband in the city, because he works in a small kiosk that he owns and with which he helps pay for the expenses they have at home. Manuela has been selling vegetables in the open market for two years now and it has gone very well, especially on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays when she gets her vegetable deliveries and resells them all around the market. She is happy because Cuenca municipality has helped her obtain a post inside the market so she can work from one place and she no longer has to walk around anymore. This is her first loan and one of her friends introduced her to the group because she too had improved her economic situation through a loan. This loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR is giving Manuela will be invested in the purchase of her market stall and everything else her new stall needs, as well as toward the purchasing of more vegetables for her business. Her goal is to eventually cultivate all of land, because at the moment it has been neglected while she builds up her vegetable stall in the market. Rosario Del Cisne B. is another member of Quingeo Communal Bank, and she migrated from her native Quingeo parish to settle in Cuenca city 18 years ago. Rosario is 31 years old and recently married, but she has been living with her partner for over 12 years now and they have three children who are 9, 7, and 2 years old. They do not have their own home yet so they rent, and her husband is a bricklayer. They each help their family, and when her husband cannot find work, he helps her with her business. Rosario sells vegetables, grains, onions, and more in the open market. She has been selling goods since she was young, and she thanks God that her business has done well. She sells the most on Saturdays and Sundays, but regardless, every day she sells from 6am to 6pm, and days when she does traveling sales to markets farther away, she leaves at 4am so that she can claim a stall in those markets. This is Rosario's first loan, and a friend invited her to be part of the group. With the money FUNDACION ESPOIR is giving her, she will invest in the purchase of her own permanent stall in the market as well as buying more grain and growing her business. Her dream is to save enough money to buy her own car or plot of land. Carmen Rosa D. M. is also a member of Quingeo Communal Bank, and she lives on an old street called Baños in the urban area of Cuenca. Carmen is 22 years old, she lives with her partner, and they have one daughter who is 3 years old. She is currently 8 months pregnant with their second child, but they do not yet know the sex yet. She does not have her own home, so she rents. She has a great relationship with her spouse, who works with scrap metal and helps her pay for all of their household expenses. Carmen works as a server in a restaurant inside the open market; she has been doing this for four years, and it has gone very well for her because she has great bosses who have special affection for her. This is her first loan with FUNDACION ESPOIR; a friend recently invited her to become part of the group and enjoy the benefits that the institution gives their members. The loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR is giving Carmen is going to be used to cover her birth-related expenses, and her dream is to eventually own her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stall in the market and acquire products needed to grow their businesses

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 40 años, es una madre muy preocupada por su familia, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 3 hijos; Johan de 19, Lisbeth de 17 y Cristian de 8 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana Carmen abre su bodega para atender a sus clientes, quienes saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse en su barrio y corren a comprar las cosas que necesitan, ella los atiende muy bien y siempre es muy cortés con las personas, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el progreso de su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 12 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para el futuro anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Carmen con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados implementará mejor su tienda de abarrotes para brindar una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and a mother who is very concerned about her family. She lives in her own house along with her 3 children, Johan who is 19, Lisbeth of is 17, and Cristian who is 8 years old, who are the motivation for her efforts. At approximately 6 in the morning Carmen opens her store to attend to her clients, who know that this is the first store to open in her neighborhood and run to buy to things they need.
