She attends to their needs very well and is always very courteous with the people because she knows that the success of her business depends on them. What she likes the most about her work is talking with her clients and learning about things that are happening in her neighborhood. She has worked for 12 years in the business and considers the most difficult part to be having to stay inside her store all day without being able to leave. For the future she longs to be able to grow her business and be able to give her clients better service. This is Carmen's second loan with MFP and hopes to pay it back on schedule, because she does not want to cause problems with other members of her community bank where she is very respected due to the order that she imposes on the group. With the $700 that she is requesting, she could stock her grocery store better to provide more of a variety of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase commodities

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: K. Odile Réside dans la commune d'Adjarra. Odile  n’a pas encore d’enfant. Odile est coiffeuse de formation. Pour équiper son salon de matériels nécessaire pour la coiffure, Odile a besoin de moyens financiers. Alors pour satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, Odile sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Odile K. lives in the village of Adjarra. Odile has no children yet. Odile is a trained hair stylist. In order to send better equip her salon with the necessary hair styling tools, Odile requires financial support. Odile requests financial support from Alide (Kiva Field Partner) so that she will be able to meet her clients' demands.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and hair styling products.

loans.name: Francisca Jerónima

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras es la actividad a la que se dedica la señora Francisca Jerónima L. en su establecimiento ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad de León.

Desde hace 21 años ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad logrando así mejorar sus ingresos y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Es por esta razón que no duda en acudir a Ceprodel por lo que esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas y verduras y de esta manera continuar en su venta de frutas y de verduras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Jerónima L. sells fruits and vegetables from her stall in Leon’s central market. Because she has been doing this for 21 years, she has been able to increase her earings and maintain her home. She has come to Ceprodel for a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables so she can continue her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: José Laureano

texts.es:
El señor José Laureano V. es propietario de una panadería el cual posee desde hace 30 largos años habiendo dedicado parte de su vida a esta actividad y habiendo adquirido mucha experiencia en el negocio.

Es importante destacar que el señor V. ha sobresalido en su negocio y sus clientes le visitan para comprarle el pan que el prepara tal como pan simple y pan dulce siendo vendido a diario en su establecimiento. Espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito y así continuar elaborando el delicioso pan para su venta.
texts.en:
Mr. José Laureano V. is the owner of a bakery which he has had for 30 long years, having dedicated part of his life to this activity and having acquired significant experience in the business. It is important to note that Mr. V. has had great success in his business and his clients visit him to buy all the bread that he prepares, from plain bread to sweet bread, which he sells daily in his establishment. He hopes to receive the loan so that he can continue to create delicious bread to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old, is married, and is the mother of seven children. She lives with her children and her husband in the outskirts of their town. Currently, five of her children are in school at the primary level. Cecilia works very hard as a mother to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Cecilia has been a local manufacturer of soap for two years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to improve her income to support her children’s education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and she believes that the loan will make her dream come true.

Cecilia is the leader of a trust bank group called “Nyame Naye” which literally means “It is the doing of the Lord”. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers, etc.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and processing equipment

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos: Jhon de 18 y Jenny de 11 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su carretilla de golosinas está ubicada en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su día de trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana y junto al más pequeño de sus hijos, sale a realizar sus ventas diarias, negocio principal de los ingresos de su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, porque así se hacen más amenas sus jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 8 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo las inclemencias del clima, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que afrontarlo para el progreso de su familia. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Celestina con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera poder serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas y solidarias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su triciclo.
texts.en:
Celestina is 39 years old and a very happy woman. She lives in her own house with her 2 children, 18-year-old Jhon and 11-year-old Jenny, who she wants to give a good life. Her candy cart is in the Cerro Colorado market, which is an important market in the city of Juliaca. Her day starts very early in the morning and along with the youngest of her children, leaves to make her daily sales, which is the major source of income for her family. What she likes the most about her work is talking with her business neighbors, which provides her entertainment during her work day. She has been working in this job for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of the job is staying all day outside in the inclement weather, but knows that is part of the job and she has to confront it to help her family. In the future she hopes to have a grocery store, which would help bring in more income. This is the fourth loan from MFP, and she has always been very punctual in her payments and hopes to do the same now as well. In her community bank she is one of the most solid and active members With the money she is requesting she will buy more candy to stock her cart better.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of commodities

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Juana T. se dedica a la actividad de venta de cosméticos y de ropa en un establecimiento del mercado central de la ciudad de León donde atiende a sus clientes ofreciendo los productos de cosméticos y también la ropa.

El crédito lo solicita porque tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de los cosméticos y de la ropa para comercializarla y de esta manera hacer el esfuerzo por llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir las necesidades de sus dos pequeños hijos que requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Juana T. sells cosmetics and clothes in a store in the central market of the city of León where she assists her clients offering them the aforementioned products. She is applying for a loan because of the need to invest in her business and commercialise it through the purchase of cosmetics and clothes. In doing so she can make the effort to sustain her family and provide the necessities for her two young children who need her support.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Alodokpo Elise

texts.fr: M. Alodokpo Elise est née en 1971 dans la commune d’Avrankou. Elise est mariée et est mère de trois (3) enfants. Elise est coiffeuse de profession. Pour une meilleure prestation de son service, Elise a besoin de séchoir, un outil de travail très important pour la coiffure. Mais, Elise ne dispose pas d’assez de moyens financiers pour acquérir son appareil. C’est la raison pour laquelle Elise sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Alodokpo Elise M. was born in 1971 in the village of Avrankou. Elise is married and she is the mother of three children. Elise is a hair stylist by training. So that she might be able to provide greater quality in service, Elise needs a hair dryer, a tool very important for hair styling. But Elise does not have enough financial resources to purchase the dryer. That is the reason why Elise is requesting financial support from Alide (Kiva Field Partner.).


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer.

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia Miriam P. se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos tales como planchas, televisores, abanicos, arroceras, radios, entro otros. Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos con el propósito de ofertarlos en su localidad.

Actualmente espera en que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorará sus ingresos y llevará el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucrecia Miriam P. sells electrical appliances such as irons, televisions, fans, rice cookers, radios, and other items. She has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy more appliances to offer from her store.

She hopes that her loan will be approved so that she can improve her earnings and sustain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase home appliances

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 48 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She operates a drinking stall where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft drinks, canned malts, canned and bottled drinks etc. She has been in this business for eight years.

Agatha is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and to give the children a quality education. But she knows that without adequate funds it is not possible to realize that dream.

Recently she added sachet mineral water to her inventory. She wants a loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke and Pepsi products and other canned drinks to further upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 20 años, es una joven muy tranquila y alegre, vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Su trabajo es el tejido artesanal, labor que viene realizando desde que tenía 10 años cuando ayudaba a sus padres a terminar los pedidos que tenían. Ahora tiene su propio puesto de artesanías, el cual está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende con mucha alegría a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre las prendas que mejor les quedarán, lleva 5 años con este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que tiene que cuidarlo, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Para el futuro, espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener una tienda más gran de ropa artesanal.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprara más lana para mejorar los tejidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Mabel is 20 years old. She is a very calm and cheerful young woman who lives at home with her family. What she wants most is to excel in life. Her work involves making hand woven articles, a skill she has been utilizing since she was 10 years old in order to help her parents complete their orders. She now has her own handicraft business, which is located in the Laguna Esplanade (a temporary site in the city of Juliaca where fairs are held).

What she enjoys most about her job is talking with her customers and advising them on what clothes best suit them. She has been in business for 5 years and the most difficult part is having to manage her vending post all day. Yet she knows that she must work very hard in order to achieve her goals. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open a large store that sells handmade clothing.

This is Mabel’s first loan with MFP. She hopes to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank, whom she admires and respects greatly. With her loan of 700 soles, she will buy more wool to improve her output of hand woven fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una madre muy responsable, a sus 64 años ha sabido sacar a su familia adelante. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos: Jenry D. 45 y Sandra D. 41 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. La labor que realiza es la preparación D. comida para eventos grandes, como matrimonios, cumpleaños, bautizos o fiestas religiosas tradicionales. Ella trabaja junto a un socio D. su entera confianza, el cual consigue los contratos para la comida, pues Sabina prefiere sólo cocinar y no participar mucho en los negocios. Por ello es que lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cocinar y lo hace muy bien, es por eso que tiene muchos pedidos y es muy solicitada en las fiestas D. su ciudad. Lleva 25 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan, ya que suelen ser muchos y no se da abasto para realizarlos, pero igual sabe que tiene que hacerlo, porque se juega la reputación D. su negocio. Para el futuro anhela abrir un restaurante muy granD., donD. pueda vender sus deliciosos platillos ella misma.
Este es el segundo préstamo D. Sabina con MFP, ella se siente muy feliz D. la oportunidad D. crédito, por lo que espera poder pagarlo a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una D. las socias más participativas y responsables. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas ollas para renovar las que usa actualmente, ya que con el paso D. los años se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Sabina is a very responsible mother. She is 64 years old and knows how to move her family forward. She lives in her own home with her two children, Jenry (age 45) and Sandra (age 41). What she wants most is to have a peaceful retirement. Sabina makes her living preparing food for large events, such as weddings, birthdays, baptisms, and traditional religious holidays. She works with a business partner who she trusts completely and is responsible for obtaining contracts to proviD. food. Sabina prefers to focus only on cooking and not participate in any other part of the business. She cooks very well and receives many orders. Her services are in high demand for parties throughout the city.

Sabina has been in business for 25 years and the most difficult part of her job is completing the orders she receives despite a lack of supplies. She manages to carry them out because she knows that her reputation and business are at stake. In the future, she hopes to open a large restaurant where she can sell her delicious dishes herself.

This is Sabina’s second loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity to receive a loan, and she hopes to make her payments on time. Sabina is one of the most active and responsible participants in her Communal Bank. With the loan of 1000 soles she requested, she will buy new cookware because the equipment she currently uses has deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new cookware

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a married woman with five strong and lovely children. All her children are in school in the community where they live. She is an achiever and works hard and earnestly to contribute to the family. She is a food vendor, selling rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She has been in this business for the last four years.

It is important to Rebeca to help her husband provide for the family. With her help they are able to support the children in school, maintain their good health and pay the bills. Rebeca says the demand for her food is high, but she does not have enough money to increase her inventory in order to meet the demand.

She requests a loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables and other supplies. She takes delivery of goods from Dwinase, which is a nearby market where she can buy what she needs for her business. She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her stew

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 21 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y a su corta edad ya es madre del pequeño Jhon de 6 meses, a quien desea dar una buena calidad de vida. El tejido artesanal es la actividad que aprendió de su madre, la cual realiza con mucha habilidad y destreza desde que tenía 9 años. Actualmente tiene su propio taller de tejidos artesanales y le va muy bien, ya que recibe muchos pedidos y también distribuye a otros puestos del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, más aun si son artesanías, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar el acabado a las prendas, ya que le toma mucho tiempo. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número de máquinas de tejer que tiene para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Sonia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y se siente en la responsabilidad de hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy solidaria y preocupada por sus demás compañeros. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que produce.
texts.en:
Sonia is 21 years old and a cheerful young woman. She lives at home with her parents and her six month old son Jhon, whom she desires to give a good quality of life. She learned to make handmade fabrics from her mother when she was 9 years old. Sonia now has her own crafts store and is doing very well. She receives many requests and also distributes her merchandise to other vending stalls in the San José Market (the largest market in the city of Juliaca). She enjoys weaving more than any of the other crafts. Her business has been operation for 3 years and the most difficult part is finishing an individual garment because it takes a long time. In the future, she would like acquire more looms so that she can improve her income.

This is Sonya’s second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time and feels she has the responsibility to do so. Her Communal Bank is very supportive and concerned about its members. With her loan of 1000 soles, she will purchase more wool so that she can increase her production of woven pieces.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alfonso G. posee su negocio de venta de granos básicos en el mercado central de la ciudad de León donde vende arroz, azúcar, maíz y aceite en su establecimiento.

Actualmente, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos ya que le es de necesidad comprarlos tales como el arroz, azúcar, frijoles y maíz con la finalidad de ofertarlos a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Alfonso G. has a business selling basic grains from the central market of the city of León. He sells rice, sugar, corn and oil from his vending post.

He has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase basic grains, including necessities such as rice, sugar, beans, and corn, so that he can continue to offer products to his customers who visit him daily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Ventura tiene 38 años, es una amorosa madre de familia, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 hijos: Jessica de 16, Verónica de 10, Zeus de 6 y Carlos de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), se dedica a la venta de zapatillas, las cuales trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero (distrito del departamento de Puno, frontera con el país de Bolivia). Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que los modelos que trae son novedosos y económicos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y es muy feliz cuando vende toda su mercadería, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las zapatillas, ya que las cajas que trae son muy pesadas y la cansan mucho. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de calzados donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Ventura con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo  al igual como hizo con sus primeros pagos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre está preocupada por el bienestar del resto de sus compañeras. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más zapatillas en Desaguadero para incrementar el stock de su puesto.
texts.en:
Ventura is 38 years old and a loving mother. She lives in a rented house with her four children: Jessica (16), Verónica (10), Zeus (6) and Carlos (5), who are the motivation behind all her endeavours. Her stall is located in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca), where she sells runners which she brings from the city of Desaguadero (a district of the Puno department, on the border with the country of Bolivia). Her stall is very popular as the models she brings are new, original and inexpensive. What she likes most about her work is to sell, and she is very happy when she sells all her merchandise. She has spent five years in this line of work and she considers the most difficult aspect to be transporting the runners, as the boxes she has to carry are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In the future she hopes to have a shoe store from where she can sell in greater comfort. This is Ventura´s fourth loan with MFP and she expects to be able to pay all her installments on time just as she did with her earlier payments. She is a very loved member in her community bank as she is always concerned about the well-being of the rest of her colleagues. With the 700 nuevos soles that she is applying for she will buy more runners in Desaguadero to increase her stall's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: M. Patrice est né en 1980 dans la commune d’Akpro Missérété et y vit. Patrice n’a pas encore d’enfant. Patrice  est coiffeur de formation. Pour équiper son salon de matériels nécessaire pour la coiffure, Patrice  a besoin de moyens financiers. Alors pour satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, Patrice  sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Patrice M. was born in 1980 in the village of Akpro Misserete, where he is still a resident. Patrice has no children yet. Patrice is a hair stylist by training. In order to supply his salon with the necessary tools, Patrice is in need of financial support. Patrice requests the financial support of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) so that he will be able to meet the demands of his clientele.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a clipper and a chair with casters.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Damián de 38 y sus 2 hijas; Liliana de 14 y Mildred de 10 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su librería está ubicada en uno de los barrios principales de la ciudad de Juliaca, la cual es muy concurrida por sus vecinos, ya que en ella pueden encontrar todo lo que necesitan. La atención que brinda Vilma es muy cordial y siempre está muy atenta a satisfacer todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede distribuir su tiempo entre la librería y sus labores del hogar, ya que su negocio funciona en su casa. Lleva 2 años con esta librería y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer muchas horas en ella, ya que abre desde muy temprano y cierra tarde. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Vilma con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, por la alegría que les da a sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su librería.
texts.en:
Vilma , age 38, is a mother in a very loving family. She lives in her own house with her husband Damián, 38, and her two daughters, Lilana, age 14, and Mildred, age 10. She wants to give her family a good life.

Her bookstore is located in one of the principal neighborhoods of the city of Juliaca and is very popular with her neighbors since she is able to meet all their needs. Vilma offers service that is very cordial and always aimed at satisfying all the requests of her customers. What she likes most about her work is that, since her business operates in her house, she is able to split her time between the bookstore and her household duties. She has had this bookstore for 2 years and believes that the most difficult thing is having to spend many hours in it since it is open from very early and closes late. For the future, she hopes to increase her business and have better income.

This is Vilma’s second loan with MFP, and she hopes to be able to pay all her payments on time, for she doesn’t want to harm the members of her community bank, where she is highly appreciated because of the happiness that she gives her colleagues. With the 500 new soles applied for she will buy more merchandise in order to better establish her bookshop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Danton Nicolas

texts.fr: N. Danton Nicolas est né vers 1966 dans la commune d’Avrankou. Nicolas est marié et est père de cinq (05) enfants dont trois scolarisés. Nicolas est un soudeur. Mais comme activité secondaire Nicolas de la transformation d'huile rouge de palme afin de se faire plus de revenus. Nicolas veut mieux développer son atelier de soudure en l’équipant de matériels nécessaire pour l’amélioration de sa prestation ainsi que pour l’accroissement de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Nicolas Danton N. was born around 1966 in the village of Avrankou. Nicolas is married and he is the father of 5 children, three of whom are attending school. Nicolas is a welder. But as a second job Nicolas processes red palm oil to supplement his income. Nicolas wants to develop his welding shop by equipping it with the tools to provide better service, and to expand the business and increase his revenues.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a grinder and materials to make metal doors.

loans.name: Ndoumé Kara

texts.fr: Ndoumbé Kara D. est une femme de 54 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOBOR KAGNAROU depuis 6 ans et y a bénéficié de 12 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Avec son crédit elle veut faire la promotion de son commerce de produits halieutiques; huitres, crevettes etc. Elle appuie son époux par rapport à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndoumbe Kara D. is a 54 year-old woman, she is married, and she is mother of 5 children who are still in her care. She has been a member of the Community Bank "Tobor Kagnarou" (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 6 years and she has received 12 past loans, all of which she has repaid successfully. With her loan she wants to expand her seafood business, selling: oysters, shrimp etc. She helps her husband to provide for the needs of the family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her small business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 34 años, es una madre muy empeñada en sacar adelante a sus hijos, vive en su propia casa y tiene 3 niños: Huber de 14, Vanesa de 8 y Ali de 1 año, a los que desea dar unos buenos estudios. Su trabajo es muy poco común y tiene un cierto toque tenebroso, ella construye ataúdes en su propia casa y los tiene guardados para cuando se los soliciten. Doris no tiene miedo de realizar este trabajo y tampoco le importa mucho que su negocio esté frente a la morgue de la ciudad. Pues lo que más le gusta es que su negocio está en su casa y puede atender a sus hijos en el momento que más la necesiten. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es acomodar los ataúdes de tal forma que no se raspen ni se malogren. Para el futuro espera tener una funeraria para poder vender con más comodidad y brindar otros servicios.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, espera poder pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que se lleguen en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará mayor cantidad de madera de buena calidad para realizar nuevos ataúdes.
texts.en:
Doris is 34 years old and a very determined mother when it comes to raising her kids. She lives in her own home with her 3 children: Huber (age 14), Vanesa (age 8), and Ali (age 1). She hopes to provide them with a good education.

Doris is in a line of business that is not very common and can be a bit gloomy. She manufactures coffins in her home and stores them until they are needed. Doris is not afraid of this type of work and doesn’t mind that her business is in front of the city morgue. She has been engaged in this activity for 2 years and believes the most difficult part of her job is making sure the coffins don’t get scraped or fall apart. In the future, she hopes to have her own funeral parlor where she can sell coffins more easily and provide other services.

Doris is requesting her fourth loan with MFP and expects to make her payments on time just like her previous loans. Her Communal Bank is a cheerful group and the members are always agreeable during their meetings. With her loan of 1000 soles, Doris will buy a large quantity of high-quality wood so that she can make new coffins.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for making coffins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 23 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar, puesto que no desea ser una carga en la familia. Tiene una fábrica de helados, la cual funciona en su casa, sus helados los distribuidos ella misma a todas las tiendas de su barrio, donde son vendidos rápidamente debido al sabor tan agradable que tienen, la mayoría de clientes ya saben que es Edith la que hace los helados y muchas veces le compran directamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede comerse los helados que desee mientras los prepara, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el frió que le hace mientras prepara los helados. Para el futuro anhela tener una heladería grande donde pueda vender sus propios helados.
Este es el sexto préstamo de Edith con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. Ella se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal y siempre recibe consejos de sus compañeras mayores. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos helados y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edith is 23 years old. She is a cheerful young woman who lives at home with her parents. Edith wants to help with the household expenses because she does not want to be a burden to her family. She makes ice cream out of her house and distributes her product to all the stores in the neighborhood, where it sells quickly because of its delicious flavor. Most of her customers know that she make ice cream and many times will buy directly from her. What she likes most about her job is that she can eat ice cream anytime while she is preparing it. She has been in business for 4 years and the most difficult part is having to endure the cold when making the ice cream. In the future, she hopes to open a large ice cream shop where she can sell her products.

This is Edith’s sixth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments and hopes to continue in the same manner. Edith feels very comfortable with her Communal Bank and always receives advice from the older members. With the loan of 2500 soles that she requested, she plans to buy more ingredients for making her delicious ice cream so that she can improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making ice cream

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 44 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia. Lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida y tener una vejez tranquila. Se dedica es la elaboración de helados, ella misma los prepara y distribuye entre las tiendas donde tiene contrato, donde sus helados son rápidamente consumidos, debido al sabor tan agradable que tienen, es por eso que su negocio marcha muy bien. Lo que más le gusta a Gregoria de su trabajo es que puede distribuir su tiempo entre la elaboración de helados y el arreglo de su hogar. Lleva 9 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el frió que le hace cuando prepara sus helados. Para el futuro espera tener una heladería grande donde pueda vender sus helados cómodamente.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Gregoria con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos siempre ha sido muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar una nueva máquina de helados, ya que una de las que usa actualmente ya no funciona bien.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 44 years old, single, and lives in her own home. What she wants most is to get ahead in life and have a peaceful retirement. She makes ice cream and distributes it to stores where she has a contract, mainly places where ice cream is rapidly consumed. Business has been doing very well because her product tastes so good. What Gregoria likes most about her work is that she can divide her time between making ice cream and taking care of her home. She has been in business for 9 years and says the most difficult part of her job is enduring the cold while she is preparing the ice cream. In the future, she hopes to open a large ice cream shop where she can sell her product more easily.

This is Gregoria’s fifth loan with MFP. Her previous loans were always repaid on time and she expects the same with this loan. With the 3000 soles that she requested, she plans to buy a new ice cream machine since the one she currently has is not functioning well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new ice cream machine

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza T. T. tiene 48 años. Es una Señora que ha tenido muchas necesidades por lo que ha recurrido a realizar préstamos a Fundación León 2000. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado luchar y sacar adelante a sus hijos. El mayor desafío que enfrento fue la salud por lo que no tenía el suficiente capital para empezar este medio de vida. Ella solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de pan, galletas, detergentes, jabón y refrescos naturales. Su mayor deseo es seguir proporcionándole a su familia el alimento de cada dia.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza T. T. is 48 years old and a woman who has many needs. As a result, she has applied for several loans from Fundación León 2000. She has a grocery store and has managed her business for more than 20 years. Maria has always enjoyed the challenge of trying to succeed for her children.

Her greatest difficulty has been with her health because she does not have enough income to maintain her way of life. The loan she requested will be used as operating capital to buy bread, cookies, detergents, soaps, and natural beverages. Her greatest desire is to continue providing for her family’s daily needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread, cookies, detergents, soaps, and natural beverages

loans.name: Las Lucecitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Lucecitas esta formado por un grupo de siete socias que desean superarse y llegar a tener mejores oportunidades en la vida, en su mayoría las socias pertenecen al barrio de Narancay  de la parroquia Baños en la ciudad de Cuenca, Baños es reconocida por sus aguas termales que son emanadas del volcán, siendo sus fiestas todo el mes de Enero con varias actividades como danzas, presentación de artistas y festivales del timbulo(dulce embuelto en hoja de maiz) y gastronómicos etc., pocos de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura , por que en su mayor parte se dedican al comercio por la gran cantidad de turistas que van a conocer ese bello lugar. Sus socias con la amabilidad que les caracterizan nos cuentan sus testimonios.

La señora María Natividad P. T. es socia del bankito Las Lucecitas, vive en Narancay  a unos 15 minutos a las fueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada concibiendo en su unión matrimonial 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 12, 1 año de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en el Colegio Técnico Manuel Córdova Galarza de su parroquia, viven en casa propia fruto del esfuerzo conyugal, su esposo es carpintero, siendo el mejor ejemplo para sus hijos y el mejor compañero en la vida.

María trabaja en la agricultura y crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos,  hace ya diez  años, lo de la agricultura en su mayor parte es solo para el consumo en su hogar y un poco vende en la feria libre de Cuenca, los pollos vende en pie o pelados por a sus conocidas que  le compran en su casa,  también vende en las tiendas de su sector.

 Es su tercer ciclo junto a la fundación y, se encuentra agradecida por que le han ayudado a estabilizarse económicamente, nos cuenta que antes pedía plata a los chulqueros y tenía que pagar intereses muy altos.

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le otorga va a  comprar más pollos, cuyes, chanchos, alimento y vitaminas para su crianza y seguir incrementando en el negocio.

Su meta es  llegar a comprarse un carro para incrementar  sus ventas y llegar  a más clientes.

La señora María Cristina Mejía P. es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal Las Estrellitas su  suegra es socia del banco comunal y la invito para que forme parte del mismo. Vive en la comunidad  Guzho a unos 15 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 23 años de edad se encuentra casada hace 5 años concibió dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, su esposo es chofer de transporte público.

María esta iniciando con el negocio de criadero de pollos nos cuenta que no es muy complicado por que solo hay que estar pendiente que el alimento y el agua no les falten y que se encuentren en un lugar abrigado para que no se mueran para obtener las ganancias deseadas.

Es su primer crédito en la FUNDACION ESPOIR y espera seguir realizando más créditos para mejorar su calidad vida y de su familia, con el préstamo que obtenido va a comprar más pollos, alimento y vitaminas, así  también una parte lo va a utilizar para la terminación de su casa.

La meta de María es  terminar su casa con los préstamos que la Fundación le otorgue.

La señora Sindy Gissela Morán C. es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal las Lucecitas, ella vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 18 años de edad es casada y aun no tiene hijos, tiene una  sólida  relación matrimonial,  nos cuenta que para tener una relación consistente se debe ser amigos ante todo y tener un excelente dialogo y después esposos; su esposo es electricista y  viven arrendando y desean mejorar su situación económica.

Sindy es comerciante de calzado,  hace un año se inició en esta actividad y le va muy bien por que tiene calzado de calidad y un buen surtido;  es comerciante informal por lo que recorre a diario la feria libre en Cuenca  su horario de trabajo  es de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. y los fines va a las ferias de el Sigsig, Azogues, Paute siendo su horario de 5 a.m. a 6 p.m.

Es su primer crédito, una amiga le incentivó con los beneficios que la Fundación ofrece para que sea parte del banco comunal.

Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar más mercadería y así tener un stock  surtido de calzado para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su sueño es tener un puesto propio y no tener que salir a recorrer la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Lucecitas is made up of 7 members, who want to better themselves and have better opportunities in life. The majority of the members are from the neighborhood of Narancay from the Baños parish in the City of Cuenca. Baños is known for its hot springs that emanate from a volcano. There are festivals throughout the month of January with several activities such as dances and artist showcases and festivals featuring timbulo (a sweet tamale wrapped in corn leaf) and other foods. Few of the inhabitants work in agriculture because, for the most part, they work serving the large quantity of tourists who come to get to know this beautiful place. The members tell their stories with characteristic friendliness. Señora María Natividad P. T. is a member of the Las Lucecitas bank. She lives in Narancay, some 15 minutes outside the City of Cuenca. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children, aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 1. Her older children study in the Manuel Córdova Galarza Technical College located in her parish. She and her family live in their own home, the fruits of the efforts of Señora María and her spouse. Her husband is a carpenter, and he is the best life partner, as well as the best example for their children. For 10 years María has worked in agriculture, raising chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. The family consumes the majority of her output, and she sells a small amount in the free market in Cuenca, also selling chickens on foot, or plucked to acquaintances who buy in the house; she also sells them in the stores in her area. This is her third loan cycle with the foundation and she is grateful because they have helped stabilize her economically because before she had to borrow from informal lenders at very high rates of interest. With the loan that the ESPOIR foundation is granting her, she will buy more chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, animal food and vitamins to continue to grow her business. Her goal is to eventually buy a car in order to increase her sales and collect more customers. Señora María Cristina Mejía P. is a new member of the communal bank. Her mother-in-law is a member of the bank and invited her to become a member. She lives in the community of Guzho, some 15 minutes outside the City of Cuenca. She is 23 years old, has been married for 5 years, and has two children: a 4-year old and a 2-year old. Her husband is a driver in public transportation. Maria is starting with the business of raising chickens. She tells us that it is not too complicated, to obtain the desired earnings you just have to be attentive so that the animals do not lack food or water and have adequate shelter so that they do not die. This is her first credit with the ESPOIR foundation and she hopes to continue to take out loans so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family. With this loan she will purchase more chickens, animal food and vitamins, and also she will use a part of the loan to finish her house. The goal of Maria is to finish her house with the loans that the foundation grants. Señora Sindy Gissela Morán C. is another active member of the communal bank Las Lucecitas. She lives in the City of Cuenca, is eighteen years old, and is married. Although she has no children, she has a solid matrimonial relationship, telling us that in order to have a consistent relationship one must be friends above all and have excellent communication. Her husband is an electrician and they live in a rented home and would like to improve their economic situation. Sindy sells shoes, she has been involved in this activity for a year and it's going very well because she has a good supply of good quality shoes. She is an informal trader in the Cuenca free market, which runs daily. She works from 8am to 6pm and on weekends goes to the markets in Sigsig, Azogues, and Paute where she works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. This is her first loan, a friend convinced her to become part of the bank by telling her about the advantages that the foundation offers. With the loan she is requesting she will buy more merchandise and this way will have an increased inventory of shoes for women, men and children. Her dream is to have her own stall, so that she would not have to travel around the city to sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, animal feed and vitamins, as well as merchandise in order to increase their businesses

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two adult children. She sells clothing at the central market in the town of Nova Kahovka. Valentina started this business eighteen years ago. At that time she did not have any other opportunities for making a living. She was courageous enough to start this business with very little money and almost no experience. Little by little she began to gain clients as well as experience in sales.

Today Valentina enjoys her business, and it has become a stable source of income. Valentina would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase the assortment of clothing in her shop. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase working tools and to supply his shop.

loans.name: Melania Aurora

texts.es: La señora Melania Méndez de 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, se dedica  ala venta de ropa  y variedades como, aretes, pulseras, prensapelos entre otros, los cuales vende a costos accesibles, lleva tres años administrando sus ventas, vende por encargo, da al crédito de la quincena, este negocio lo inicio con el deseo de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos y para poder tener mejores posibilidades económica para apoyar  a su hijo, que junto a su esposo han logrado a que sea una persona de buenas relaciones sociales como educativas. Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un muro al frente de su casa para reguardar la seguridad de su familia. Sus planes es poder agrandar su negocio, tener una tienda de variedades que espera a corto plazo alcanzar. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del financiamiento para lograr hacer mejoras a su vivienda y lograr tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
La señora Melania Méndez is 37 years old and resides in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city Managua. She sells clothes and an assortment of goods including earrings, bracelets, and hairclips, which she sells at reasonable prices. She has run this business for 3 years, selling on order, and giving her customers credit up to 15 days. She started this business with the desire to support her husband with the expenses, and because she and her husband wish to give better economic opportunities to their son, so that he can become an educated person of good social standing. This is her second lending cycle with AFODENIC. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to make a wall around her house order to increase the security of her family. Her plan is to enlarge her business and to soon have a store. She is grateful for the opportunity to obtain financing to improve her house so that she can have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the size of her business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis is a member of The Wheatfield village bank. He is 27 years old and lives with his partner. For some time, he studied at an institute of administration, but he stopped because he decided to go to work.

Jose Luis has a business selling replacement auto parts. His grandfather began the business some years ago and his father continued it. When Jose Luis was a child he used to help out and he grew up wanting to go into the family business. Now, after many years, Jose Luis has invested jointly in the business with his father.

Jose Luis needs a loan of 800 soles to buy headlights, light bulbs, transmitters, and speakers. His dream is to have a well-stocked shop. During his time with FINCA Peru, he has realized the effectiveness of the loans and is very happy because they have helped him through tough times.

loans.use: To buy headlights, light bulbs, transmitters, and speakers

loans.name: Julia Violeta

texts.en:
Julia is a member of The Wheatfield village bank. She is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 15 and 6. Both of her children are studying in public schools.

Julia has been practicing her profession as a primary school teacher for three years as well as working in the evenings selling food with the help of her sister. She sells chicken soup and fried liver out of her home. Her husband is a taxi driver and works during the day.

Julia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy supplies such as rice and noodles in order to make the food she sells. Her dream is to have a restaurant of her own.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make the food she sells

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Las Abejitas” están representadas por la señora Nely y conformada por 13 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como costurera D. prendas D. vestir, servicio D. peluquería, abarrotes en tienda D. barrio, transporte público D. pasajeros y a la venta D. productos como verduras, carne, detergentes, comida, Api, refrescos y diferentes materiales D. limpieza. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
The members of the group “Las Abejitas” (The Little Bees) are represented by Mrs. Nely and consist of 13 member which are dedicated to various business activities such as seamstress, hair care service, groceries in a neighborhood store, public transport of passengers and sale of items such as vegetables, meats, detergents, food, Api, beverages and various cleaning products. The competition in their areas is high, but in spite of that they know how to grow their businesses. This loan is for the growth of their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, supplies and tools to improve their incomes and give their families a better quality of life. As far as their credit worthiness, the associates are in the process of their first cycle with the institution, they are happy to get financial support that will help them generate more income and make them able to proviD. a better life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase working tools.

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es: La joven Arlen Patricia R. de 28 años de edad, es esforzada, en su trabajo que inicio con ahorros que su esposo dio y actualmente con prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado lo cual aumentado su capital como su clientela pues es afiliada ala institución la Avon, para comprar barato, en la compra de cosmético, ropa, estos productos los vende al contado y al crédito pues son de accesibles y bonitos para las familias Nicaragüense. Su esposo trabaja como albañil y es muy responsable, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, y reside en el barrio Isaías Gómez en la capital de Managua. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y ropa lo cual tiene mucho encargo. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios de hacer posible el invertir en su capital lo cual le generara mayores ventas, como la obtención la captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Arlen Patricia is 28 years old, she is an enterprising young woman in the job that she started with her husbands’ savings and recently with the loans that Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner) has granted her. This has increased her capital as well as her customer base. She is part of Avon and she buys cheap cosmetics and clothing which she sells and accepts cash and credit as they are accessible and good for Nicaraguan families. Her husband works as a mason and is very responsible. They have a son who is 3 years old and they live in the Isaías Gómez neighborhood in the capital, Managua. With this loan she will invest in buying cosmetics and clothing of which she has many orders. She gives thanks to Kiva’s field partner for making it possible for her to invest and attain greater sales and new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various clothing for men and women as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Las socias del grupo “Reynas” están representadas por la señora Maria Ana Jesús y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como costurera D. prendas D. vestir, servicio D. peluquería, abarrotes en tienda D. barrio, transporte público D. pasajeros y a la venta D. productos como verduras, carne, detergentes, chicharrón D. pollo, pacumutus, maní y diferentes hiervas medicinales. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
.
texts.en:
Maria Ana Jesús represents the Reynas Group, which is comprised of 12 members. The members work at different activities like making clothes, hairdressing, having a neighborhood grocery store, and public passenger transportation. Some members sell things like vegetables, meat, detergents “chicharrón D. pollo” (fried chicken rinds), “pacamutus” (large kebobs), peanuts, and different herbal medicines. The competition in their fields is high. In spite of this, they know how to get ahead in their businesses. The loan is to grow their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to improve their incomes and allow them to give their families a better quality of life. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are in their first loan cycle with the Institution. They are happy to be offered an economic support that helps generate greater income and improves their their families quality of life. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa V. de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, negocio que inicio hace catorce años con dinero propio y luego con prestamos que Afodenic presto lo cual ha incrementado su inventario como las ventas lo cual es de mucha ganancia para sus gastos cotidiano y para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, su esposo es músico andino, tiene dos hijos uno de 3 y 17 años de edad, el mayor estudia la secundaria, y con esta crédito es su sexto ciclo que invertirá en comprar ropa variada, zapatos y cosmético, vende al contado y al crédito de quincena y espera elevar las ventas con este financiamiento, agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad de los préstamo para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Teresa V. is 39 years old and is in the business of selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She started this business 14 years ago with her own money and later took advantage of loans from AFODENIC to increase her inventory and therefore also her sales. This business contributes a lot to help pay for daily expenses and the needs of her family. Maria's husband is a musician who plays traditional Andean music, and they have two children, a 3-year-old and a 17-year-old who attends secondary school. This loan would be the sixth that she has invested in the purchase of various articles of clothing, shoes and cosmetics. Maria sells her items for cash, and also offers a 2-week long financing option. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales. Maria is very grateful for the opportunity this institution as given her to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Ojos Del Cielo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Ojos D. Cielo” esta conformado por 15 socios y representado por  la señora Ruth, todas las socias van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como la señora Ruth que se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su tienda y también algunos productos mas, el resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. ropa, cosméticos, chamarras D. cuero, café, camas, mochilas medias y a la confección D. prendas D. vestir. La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia ya que van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. sacar adelante sus negocios, agradecen el apoyo económico que les brinda la institución porque gracias a su confianza su familia gozara D. una mejor calidad D. vida y D. una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The “Ojos D. Cielo” Community Bank, represented by Ruth, has 15 members, all in their fourth cycle having proved themselves to be responsible and punctual re-payers. Most of the members are in the retail traD., including Ruth herself, who has a grocery store also selling some other items. The remaining members sell clothing, cosmetics, leather jackets, coffee, beds, rucksacks and socks, or make clothing. Despite the high level of competition in their respective fields, they have each successfully developed their enterprises. The loan will be used to expand their businesses, buying goods, supplies and equipment to increase their revenue, allowing them to offer their families a higher standard of living. In terms of the members' credit history, they enjoy the experience of fourth-cycle borrowers, having demonstrated their responsibility, honesty and desire to develop their businesses. They are thankful for the financial support provided by the institution, which offers them the trust they need to proviD. their families with a more comfortable life and a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Blanca Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada para su familia  procreo 7 hijos cinco mayores de edad, que trabajan y dos están estudiando, su esposo trabaja como contador y da gracias a Dios por el apoyo que su esposo ha dado a su familia, ya que muchas familias Nicaragüenses son madre soltera. Reside en el barrio Anexo Villa Fraternidad en la capital de Managua y se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, tiene ocho años administrando este negocio que inicio con fondos propios y luego otorgo con financiamiento para obtener más inventario y captar clientes nuevos. Este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara ropa, perfumé y zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos, con esto espera obtener ganancias y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios. Da las gracias a la institución por los prestamos ya que con los prestamos anteriores ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda y a si como aumentado el inventario de sus ventas. A futuro espera tener un modulo de variedad.
texts.en:
Blanca, 46, is a hard working woman who puts forth much effort for her family. She has seven children. Five of them are working adults, and two are in school. Her husband works as an accountant. She thanks God for the support her husband has given her family because many Nicaraguan families have single mothers. She lives in the Anexo Villa Fraternidad neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She sells clothes and shoes. She has been running this business, which she started with her own funds, for eight years. Later, she got financing to get more inventory and obtain new customers. This is her fifth cycle with Afodenic. She will use it to buy clothes, perfume, and shoes to offer her customers a variety of products. She expects to get income from this and help her children with their education. She is grateful to the Institution for the loans. With previous loan she has made improvements to her house and increased her sales inventory. In the future she hopes to have a stand selling a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, perfume, and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Amanecer Vino Tinto Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Amanecer D. Vino Tinto” estan representados por la señora Eugenia y conformada por 12 socios D. los cuales tres son varones y el resto mujeres. La presidenta al igual que sus compañeras se dedica a la atención D. una tienda D. abarrotes, los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta D. víveres, venta D. cosméticos, venta y elaboración D. masitas y repostería, atención tienda D. barrio, venta D. libros, D. comidas, confección D. mochilas y prendas D. vestir, elaboración D. muebles D. madera. El grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo juntos y expresan su voluntad D. trabajar con el crédito otorgado por la institución la misma que les será D. gran ayuda para el fortalecimiento y expansión D. sus diferentes negocios y actividades, algunos D. ellos ya ha trabajado con grupos solidarios por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y desean seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus familias un mejor futuro. El refinanciamiento esta dirigido a la compra D. herramientas, materia prima, expansión D. sus talleres y otros que se traducirán en la capitalización D. sus actividades para poder obtener mejores ingresos que ayudaran a mantener a su familia con una calidad D. vida mas razonable.
texts.en:
The 12 members of the “Amanecer D. Vino Tinto”, three men and the remainder women, group are represented by Eugenia. The group's president and some of her co-members run grocery stores, while other members are engaged in such businesses as the sale of foodstuffs, cosmetics, selling and making cakes and pastries, running a local store, selling books, meals, making rucksacks and clothing and producing wooden furniture. The group is now in its second cycle, and will find the credit provided by the institution of great help in their enthusiastic efforts to strengthen and expand their various businesses. Some have previously worked with other community-based groups, giving them experience of such organizations and the desire to continue their efforts to proviD. their families with a better future. The new loan will be used to purchase tools and raw materials, to expand workshops and other forms of capital investment in their businesses, with the aim of increasing their revenue to maintain a more decent standard of living for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène A. est une femme de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Hélène exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, le deuxième à FECECAV, augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbons. Cette aubaine lui permettra d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants
texts.en:
Hélène A. est une femme de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Hélène exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle suhaite avec ce crédit, le deuxième à FECECAV, augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbons. Cette aubaine lui permettra d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbons de bois

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Agueda es una alegre mujer de 49 años, vive con su hija, Mirtha de 12 años, en su casa propia. Desde muy joven fue independiente, siempre le gustó valerse por sí misma, es por ello que incursionó en diferentes oficios. Pero desde hace 15 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, siendo muy buena en ello. Hasta el momento le va muy bien y le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite movilizarse por la ciudad sin ningún inconveniente, aunque a veces el tráfico y el caos vehicular sean muy estresantes. Pero Agueda no sólo se dedica a su auto, ya que además en su casa realiza la costura de diversas prendas de vestir. Ella es muy feliz con su labor y en el futuro quiere tener una farmacia o librería, negocio que pueda instalar en su hogar.
Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy antigua de la institución, además de ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará una máquina de coser nueva para lograr mejores ingresos a su economía.
texts.en:
Agueda is a cheerful, 49-year-old woman who lives with her 12-year-old daughter, Mirtha, in her own house. From a very young age, Agueda has been very independent; she always wanted to be self-sufficient, and for this reason she has explored many different trades and occupations. For 15 years she has been in the taxi business, as she is very good at it. Business is going very well and Agueda likes her job, as it allows her to get around the city without any problems, but sometimes the traffic and the chaos in the streets can be very stressful. But Agueda is not only in the taxi business: she also sews various garments in her house. Agueda is very happy with her work and in the future would like to open a pharmacy or a book store, businesses that she could run from her home.

This is Agueda's tenth loan with MFP. She has worked with the institution for a long time and she has always been very punctual with her payments. With the money from this loan, she would buy a new sewing machine to earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Amistad Rsr. Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  AMISTAD RSR  Esta representado por la señora Ángela Elvira y por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la zona D. Villa victoria y van cursando juntas ya su 5to ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la administración D. sus vehículos y/o al manejo D. los mismos, pertenecen a la línea D. radio taxi "Punto Car", que esta en funcionamiento alrededor D. 10 años con el servicio,  otras socias se dedican al tejidos D. redes D. arco D. fútbol, una D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. víveres y otra a la venta D. ropa en la feria. El mercado que atacan es muy competitivo, pero según al producto y la oferta que se tenga obtienen ventas favorables para poder cancelar sus obligaciones y mantener a sus familias. El destino del crédito es para compra D. repuestos y mantenimiento D. sus movilidades, compra D. víveres, y materia prima para el tejido y mercadería en general D. ropa. Los antecedentes D. las socias con otras instituciones son positivos por lo cual se vio por conveniente darle un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo juntas.
texts.en:
The AMISTAD RSR Community Bank is represented by Ángela Elvira and has twelve members, most based in the Villa Victoria area. They are now on their fifth loan cycle together, having demonstrated their responsibility, honesty and desire to work. The members are in the main engaged in managing and/or driving their vehicles, as members of the "Punto Car" radio taxi service, which has been in operation for some 10 years now. Other members make football goal netting, one sells groceries while another sells clothing at market. Although they operate within a highly competitive sector, they achieve good levels of sales depending on the product and offer, allowing them to meet their payments and maintain their families. The loan will be used for spare parts and maintenance for their vehicles, the purchase of foodstuffs and raw materials for weaving, and general items of clothing. The members have positive experiences of other institutions, serving as the basis for this renewed economic support allowing them to continue growing in partnership.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida es una emprendedora mujer de 49 años, vive en su casa propia con su hija de 17 años llamada Saly. Desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la venta de artículos de librería en un puesto que tiene en un mercado cercano a su casa. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, ya que gracias a su trato amable y carismático ha logrado obtener muy buena cantidad de clientes, los cuales son muy fieles a su negocio. Ida siempre trata de tener su puesto bien abastecido, ya que no le gusta que un cliente consulte sobre algún producto y que ella no lo tenga a la mano, es por ello que su puesto tiene de todo. A Ida le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que gracias a él se siente independiente y puede brindarle a su hija una buena calidad de vida, quien en algunas oportunidades, también acude al puesto para ayudarla con las ventas. Para el futuro, Ida quiere agrandar su bazar para lograr más ingresos económicos a favor de su familia. 
Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy puntual en la cancelación de todos sus pagos y se compromete a seguir siéndolo. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para mejorar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ida is an enterprising woman of 49 years old. She lives in her own house with her 17 year old daughter named Saly. For the last 10 years, she has devoted herself to selling office and paper supplies in a stall at a market near her house. This business has proved to be quite profitable. Thanks to her friendly and charismatic manner with customers, she has been able to obtain a good number of loyal customers. Ida always tries to have her stand well supplied. She doesn't like not having an item that a customer specifically requests in stock, so she tries to have some of everything on hand. Ida enjoys her work very much because it makes her feel independent and she can provide her daughter with a high quality of life. Her daughter comes to the stand to help Ida with sales. In the future, Ida would like to expand her business in order to increase her income for her family. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She always has been very punctual with her payments and commits to continue being so. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her business' sales.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy planks to carry out his carpenter work

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo, Salvador de 50 años, y sus 2 hijos: Juan de 18 y Frank de 14 años de edad. Hace 5 años decidió emprender un negocio que pudiera realizar en su hogar y que le permitiera cuidar de sus hijos, los cuales estaban en edad escolar y necesitaban de su ayuda. Es por ello que aprovechando el gran espacio que tenía en su casa puso una cochera, la cual hoy en día alberga de 6 a 7 autos. Su negocio es rentable y no necesita de mucho tiempo, es por ello que le resulta muy cómodo, aunque últimamente María está pensado realizar otro tipo de negocio paralelo, como es la venta de productos de medicina natural a domicilio, lo que realizará en sus ratos libres. Su objetivo es reunir dinero para implementar una librería en el espacio que ahora usa como cochera, ella sabe que aún falta mucho para ello, pero no pierde las esperanzas de hacerlo pronto una realidad. 
Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, ella y su grupo siempre se han caracterizado por ser muy responsables y puntuales en sus pagos y eso es algo que a María le agrada mucho. Con el dinero que solicita comprará productos de medicina natural para empezar a distribuir y vender a domicilio.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old. She lives with her husband, Salvador, who is 50, and their two sons, Juan, 18, and Frank, 14. Five years ago, she decided to start a business which she would be able to operate at home, allowing her to take care of her children, who were school aged and needed her help. As a result, she took advantage of the large space available in her home and established a car parking facility, which currently has room for 6 or 7 cars. Her business is profitable and does not take much time, which is very convenient for her. However, María has recently been thinking about starting another type of business parallel to her current one, such as the sale of natural health products to customers in their homes, which she will undertake in her spare time. Her goal is to save enough money to open a bookstore in the space that she is now using as a garage. She knows that she still has a long way to go toward this goal, but she will not give up her hope of making it a reality soon. This is María's ninth loan with MFP. She and her group have always shown themselves to be very responsible and punctual in their payments, and this is something that makes María very happy. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase natural health products so that she can begin selling and distributing them to customers in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for her new business

loans.name: Barrio Obrero Ii Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Barrio Obrero II” están representados por la señora Juana y conformada por 19 socios los cuales van cursando un ciclo mas con la institución. La presidenta al igual que sus compañeras se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos y algunos productos de acuerdo a al época, los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta de abarrotes, empanadas, comida, golosinas, víveres, , venta y elaboración de masitas y repostería, atención tienda de barrio, venta de libros, confección de prendas de vestir y al servicio en empresas. El grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo juntos y expresan su voluntad de trabajar con el crédito otorgado por la institución la misma que les será de gran ayuda para el fortalecimiento y expansión de sus diferentes negocios y actividades, algunos de ellos ya ha trabajado con grupos solidarios por lo que cuentan con experiencia y desean seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus familias un mejor futuro. El refinanciamiento esta dirigido a la compra de herramientas, materia prima, expansión de sus talleres y otros que se traducirán en la capitalización de sus actividades para poder obtener mejores ingresos que ayudaran a mantener a su familia con una calidad de vida más razonable.
texts.en:
Juana represents the Barrio Obrero II Group, which is comprised of 19 members who are in another cycle with the Institution. The president, like her colleagues, sells cosmetics by catalog. They also sell some seasonal products. The rest of the members are in different activities like selling groceries, empanadas, food, sweets, and supplies. Some members make and sell pastries and baked good, run neighborhood stores, sell books, make clothes, and work in businesses. The group is in their second cycle together. They express their desire to work with the loan given by Institution. It will be a big help to them to strengthen and expand their different businesses and activities. Some of them have already worked with supportive groups, so they have experience. They want to keep working to give their families a better future. The loan is to buy tools, buy raw materials, and to expand their shops.
