Others will use the loan to put money into their businesses in order to get better income that will help support their families with a more reasonable quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rosario Emperatriz

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza con mucha alegría, ya que le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Ella incursionó en este negocio porque es una actividad que le permite tener libertad en cuanto a su tiempo, ya que puede disponer de él según le convenga y tener momentos con su familia. Rosario se toma muy enserio su trabajo, ya que sabe que si le pone mucho empeño logrará salir adelante y logrará cumplir sus sueños. Ella quiere para el futuro tener un local en su propia casa donde pueda implementar un bazar, para ofrecer otros artículos aparte de sus cosméticos.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que el resto de su grupo, con el cual se lleva muy bien. Con el dinero solicitado comprará productos cosméticos en oferta para venderlos a su precio real y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and children in her own house. For the past 15 years she has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products, which she does with much joy given that it provides her the necessary income to give her family a good quality of life. She got into this business because it provides freedom with her time, given that she can use it in a way that is convenient to her and that allows her to spend time with her family. Rosario takes her work seriously because she knows that if she works hard she will be able to get ahead in life and accomplish her dreams. In the future she would like to set up a bazaar like locale in her own house, so that she can offer other products besides her cosmetics. This is her sixth loan with MFP; she is very punctual in all her payments, as is the rest of her group, with whom she gets along with well. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase cosmetics products on sale, to sell them at the real market price and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise (cosmetics products).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up his store

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice A. est un jeune homme de 30 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il tient depuis 4 ans un magasin d’alimentation général à Kpele Konda, un village d’environ 160 kilomètres de la capitale du Togo, Lomé. Patrice désire avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son entreprise et par conséquent augmenter ses revenus pour un meilleur devenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Patrice A. is a young man aged 30, married and the father of three children. He has run a grocery store for four years in the village of Kpele Konda, located about 160 kilometers from Lomé, the capital city of Togo. Patrice wants to use this loan to expand his business and thus increase his income and offer his family a better future.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To extend the area of her restaurant and buy essential ingredients for her cooking

loans.name: Joaquin Mauricio

texts.es: Joaquín es soltero tiene 4 hijos de 13 - 11 -9  y 7 años respectivamente, todos sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y dependen totalmente de él. La familia vive en una casa prestada de un familiar y en condiciones muy humildes, su expectativa es tratar de mejorar su calidad de vida. Joaquín cuenta con un taller de chapería para vehículos el cuál lo trabaja personalmente y está consiguiendo mejorar y ampliar el mismo. Existe competencia mediana ya que en la zona hay algunos otros talleres similares. El crédito es para capital de operación destinado a la compra de pinturas  y herramientas. Joaquín que por quinta vez acude a nuestra institución en busca de financiamiento  habiendo cancelado oportunamente sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
Joaquin is single and has 4 children ages 13, 11, 9, and 7 respectively; all his children are studying and depend completely on him. The family lives in a house that is barrowed from family members, and is in very humble conditions. His goal is to try to improve his quality of life. Joaquin has a body shop for vehicles in which he works personally and is trying to improve and expand the business. There exists average competition given that there are other similar body shops in the area. The loan will be used as operation capital to purchase paints and tools. This is the fifth time that Joaquin has sought our institution in order to acquire a loan having promptly paid his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase paints and tools).

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés vive con su esposa e hijos, la esposa le colabora en los gastos de la casa ya que tiene una fotocopiadora. Viven en la casa de sus suegros, anteriormente era empleado de una empresa, en la actualidad tiene su propio vehículo con el que trabaja en servicio de taxi. La competencia es media ya que existe mucha demanda por el servicio. El crédito para el que saco fue destinado al mantenimiento del vehículo, cambio de llantas y algunos arreglos más. En los créditos obtenidos de Agrocapital tuvo buen comportamiento de pagos. Es su cuarta secuencia. Los anteriores créditos los cancelo con normalidad, cabe mencionar que el Moisés tuvo algunos días de retraso. Sin embargo todos se cancelaron con normalidad.
texts.en:
Moises lives with his wife and children; his wife helps with household expenses as she has a photocopy machine. They live in their in-laws house. Previously, he was employed by a company, but currently he has his own vehicle that he uses to offer taxi services. Competition is average given that there exists a high demand for the service. The loan that he requested will be invested in the maintenance of the vehicle, to change the tires, and to carry out other additional repairs. In his previous loans from Agrocapital he behaved well and made his payments accordingly. This is his fourth loan. His previously loans were paid as planned, but it is worth to mention that Moises was delayed some days in his payments. Nevertheless, they were paid as planned.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Los Pinos Group

texts.es: El grupo de mujeres los Pinos son originarios de la comunidad de Coxom a ocho kilometros del municipio  su principal actividad de las integrantes del grupo es la elaboracion de güipiles  ellas vienen trabajando hace siete años con cinco miembros del grupo a principio del febrero del dos mil nueve se incorporan dos personas mas que son hijas de las integrantes, con el unico objetivo que ellas aprende el arte para que dicho grupo no desaparesca.  En dicho trabajo la dificultad que se afronta es la falta de capital  y por ser personas muy sencillas no se tiene acceso ha la banca  ellos escucharon por una emisora local que ASDIR da creditos en grupos  visitan las oficina para solicitar un credito que lo invertiran en la compra de telas, conos, bastidores, moldes ya que tiene un pedido por las fiesta del municipio, el grupo viene trab
texts.en:
The women’s group Los Pinos are originally from the community of Coxom, 8km outside the city. The main activity of the group members is making Güipiles (traditional clothing). Five of the group members have worked together for seven years. In the beginning of February 2009, they added two more members who are the daughters of current members. They want the girls to learn this traditional art so that the group continues. Lack of capital is a problem for the group. The women live simply and so do not have access to bank loans. They heard from a local radio station that ASDIR provided group credit, and visited the office to request a loan to invest in fabric, spools of thread, frames, and patterns. They are already working on an order for the municipality's festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Miguel Geronimo

texts.es: Miguel Geronimo T. Ríos tiene 42 años. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha dado lo necesario a su familia. Miguel tiene que recorrer muchos lugares en busca de clientes por lo que tiene que ofrecer sus productos. A pesar de si edad es un hombre que ha luchado para obtener lo necesario para su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas todos los financiamiento han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. el deseo de Miguel es seguir manteniendo su propio negocio ya que es su principal fuente de vida e ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel Geronimo T. Ríos is 42 years old. He buys and sells clothing. He has dedicated himself to this business for over 12 years; through this business he has been able to always give his family what is needed. Miguel has to travel to many places in search for clients to offer his products. Despite his age, he is a man that has worked hard to obtain what his family needs. The loan that he is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase t-shirts, pants, and skirts. All the loans that he has obtained have been a great help to his business. Miguel hopes to continue maintaining his own business given that it is his main source life and income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase t-shirts, pants, and skirts).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Paubla De Los Angeles

texts.es: Paubla de los Ángeles Mejía G. tiene 49 años de edad. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde, la actividad económica a la que ella se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, por lo que no fue fácil salir adelante con este negocio ya que tuvo que realizar muchos sacrificios por lo que tenía que proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella empezó a vender en la puerta de su casa por lo que las tardes sacaba una mesita en donde colocaba ciertas golosinas y ciertas personas que pasaban por su localidad eran sus clientes, con el paso del tiempo fueron aumentando sus productos y decidieron seguir adelante. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas en general, refrescos naturales y jugos.
texts.en:
Paubla de los Ángeles Mejía G. is 49 years old. Her business is located in the house where she lives; she runs a small convenience store. She has dedicated herself to this humble business for over 16 years; it was not easy get ahead with this business given that she had to make many sacrifices to give her children what they needed. She began selling at the door of her house in the afternoons when she would take out a small table where she would place sweets; certain people that would pass by became her clients, and as time passed her products offered increased and they decided to move forward with the business. The loan that she is currently requesting will be employed as work capital to purchase basic grains, general sweets, and natural drinks and juices.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase basic grains, general sweets, and natural drinks and juices).

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Esperanza C. Q. es socia del Banco Comunal Maluay;  vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre  que se encuentra a unos 45 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca vía al Valle, este sector se caracteriza por tener  unas llanuras y paisajes muy bonitos y todo el camino nos regala su  belleza natural.

Rosa es una socia muy alegre, tiene 25 años y se encuentra casada,  tiene 3 hijos de 4, 3 y 8 meses de edad  su esposo es albañil y los fines de semana la ayuda  en el hogar, en su matrimonio le va muy bien porque han logrado entenderse mutuamente, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa que la presto el tío de su esposo

Rosa trabaja como costurera desde que salió de la escuela, ya es toda una experta por los años que lleva ejerciendo esta actividad;  adicional confecciona  forros para ternos y los llama portaternos y está en planes de ponerse su propio taller.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando junto a la fundación, nos cuenta que los créditos anteriores la han ayudado mucho,  con ellos ha logrado estabilizarse económicamente y le gusta más el sistema de  ahorros que ofrece la institución.

El préstamo que realizó en la fundación lo va a invertir en el pago de una letra de un terreno que está adquiriendo.

El  sueño de Rosa  es de tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Rosa Esperanza C. Q. is a member of the Communal Bank Maluay; she lives in a community with the same name which is located about 45 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca on the way to El Valle. This region is known for having very beautiful plains and scenery, and the surrounding area offers us its natural beauty.

Rosa is a very happy member. She is 25 years old, married, and has 3 children ages 4,3, and 8 months. Her husband is a mason and on the weekends helps in the household. They are doing very well as a married couple because they have been able to understand each other. Rosa does not own a house, and because of this they live in a house that she borrowed from her husband’s uncle.

Rosa has worked as a seamstress since she finished school; she is now an expert because of the many years that she has been carrying out this trade. She also makes the lining for suits that she calls ‘portaternos’, and is planning to open her own sewing shop.

This will be her third loan cycle working with the foundation, and she tell us that previous loans have helped her a great deal; with them she has been able to become economically stable and she also enjoys the savings system offered by the foundation.

The loan that she acquired through the foundation will be used to pay for the deed of a plot of land that she is acquiring.

Rosa dreams of having her own sewing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the deed of the purchase of a plot of land.

loans.name: Carmen Ivelia

texts.es:
La señora Carmen  Ivelia C. Ordóñez  es socia del Banco Comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre que se encuentra a unos 45 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca vía al Valle, este sector se caracteriza por tener  unas llanuras y paisajes muy bonitos y todo el camino nos regala su  belleza natural.

 Carmen  tiene 33 años es casada tiene una buena relación conyugal, concibió 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 3 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia en el Colegio Miguel Merchán, su segundo hijo en la escuela Nicolás Sojos, viven en casa propia fruto de su trabajo de varios años y sobre todo con la ayuda de su  esposo que trabaja en la construcción,  nos manifiesta que es una familia muy feliz.

Carmen trabaja vendiendo productos para la belleza de la mujer como productos Yambal, empezó hace cinco meses con su negocio y le va muy bien porque tiene mucha clientela, son productos muy conocidos y tienen una buena acogida en el mercado, una dificultad que ha tenido es que tiene que caminar mucho porque visita a sus clientas de casa en casa, siendo una gran ventaja que los productos son buenos y se venden.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando con el banco comunal y le agrada la manera que les enseñan a ahorrar y para acceder a los prestamos no tienen que realizar muchos tramites.

El préstamo obtenido en la Fundación  lo va a invertir en la compra de un stock surtido de productos Yambal para satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientas.

Su meta es seguir  incrementando las ventas de los productos de belleza para la mujer Yambal y llegar a obtener la estrella número 1 que en la empresa entrega.
texts.en:
Carmen Ivelia C. Ordóñez is a member of the Communal Bank Maluay; she lives in a community with the same name which is located about 45 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca on the way to El Valle. This region is known for having very beautiful plains and scenery, and the surrounding area offers us its natural beauty.

Carmen is 33 years old, is married in a good marital relationship, and conceived 3 children ages 12, 10, and 3; her eldest child studies in the Colegio Miguel Merchán, and her second child in the Escuela Nicolás Sojos. They live in their own house, which is the product of many years of work, especially with the help of her husband that works in construction. She tells us that they are a very happy family.

Carmen works selling beauty products to women such as those of the Yambal brand; she began this business 5 months ago and things are going very well because she has a large clientele, her products are well known, and the products have been well accepted in the market. One difficulty that she has faced is that she has to walk a great deal because she visits her clients from house to house, with the great advantage that her products are good and sell well.

She is in her third loan cycle working with her Communal Bank, and she likes the way that they have been taught to save and that they do not have to carry out many transactions to gain access to loans.

The loan obtained through the Foundation will be invested in the purchase of an assorted stock of Yambal products to satisfy her clients’ requests.

Her goal is to continue expanding her sales of Yambal beauty products, and to gain the ‘Number 1 Star’ honor given by the company.


Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of an assorted stock of Yambal products.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Pomalca.

Hace 2 años compró una fotocopiadora y la instaló en un pequeño ambiente de la casa de su padre que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad, luego empezó a ampliar su negocio con la compra de golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y cosméticos para venta.

Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso estable con la que cuenta su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero eventual en la cosecha de caña de azúcar, el principal cultivo producido en el lugar.

Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de material para la fotocopiadora y además ampliar su negocio con la venta de útiles escolares.

Ana María planea comprar con las ganancias que perciba a futuro otra fotocopiadora y una computadora para trabajar haciendo tipeos y trabajos de investigación para los escolares de la zona, así planea ayudarlos y también apoyar a tres de sus hijos que aún se encuentran estudiando.

Ella es muy conocida por sus vecinos los que la consideran una mujer reponsable, emprendedora y que siempre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a 49-year-old mother that lives with her husband and 4 children, 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Pomalca.

2 years ago she purchased a photocopy machine, and installed it in a small area in her father’s house located in the center of the city; she later began expanding her business with the purchase of sweets, soft drinks, and cosmetics to sell.

This business is the only stable source of income that their family counts on, given that her husband works as a seasonal laborer in the sugar cane harvest; this is the main crop cultivated in the area.

She is requesting for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,200 PEN that she plans to invest in the purchase of materials for the photocopy machine, and also school supplies to sell and in that way expand her business.

Ana Maria plans on purchasing with future earnings another photocopy machine and a computer to type papers and research for the students of the area; in that way she will be helping them, and also supporting her three children that are currently studying.

She is well known by her neighbors and is considered to be a responsible woman, who is enterprising, and also is always looking for a way for push her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to expand her business.

loans.name: Julia Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Julia Yolanda C. Y. es socia del Banco Comunal Maluay, vive  en la comunidad  Conchan de Milagro vía a santa Ana  perteneciente al sector el Valle.

Julia tiene 28 años,  de estado civil casada, concibió dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia  en la escuela Tomas Rendón del Valle, su esposo trabaja como estuquero,  se llevan muy bien en su vida conyugal  ayudándose mutuamente en los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada por un hermano.

Julia es costurera aprendió el oficio por sí sola,   trabaja sólo por obra  desde hace cinco años elaborando  pantalones, sacos, chalecos, faldas, etc., como trabaja en su casa no tiene horario fijo pero casi todos los días labora desde las 9 a.m. a 12 pm.   y  de 2 p.m.  hasta altas horas de la noche ya que debe distribuir su tiempo con los quehaceres del hogar.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando con la fundación, se  sinte muy agradecida por que gracias a los préstamos que le han entregado ha logrado arreglar sus dos maquinas de coser  y comprar una plancha.

Con el préstamo obtenido va a  comprar una cocina  a gas que le hace falta.

Su meta es estudiar corte y confección para llegar a tener el titulo de sastre.
texts.en:
Julia Yolanda C. Y. is a member of the Communal Bank Maluay; she lives in the Conchan de Milagro community on the way to Santa Ana, which belongs to the El Valle sector.

Julia is 28 years old, married, and has two children ages 7 and 4; her eldest child studies in the Tomas Rendón del Valle school. Her husband works in construction applying stucco; they get along very well as a married couple as they help each other with household expenses. They do not own a house and for that reason they live in a house that they have barrowed from a brother.

Julia is a seamstress; she learned this trade by herself. For the past five years she has worked on order making pants, suits, jackets, skirts, etc. Because she works at home she does not have a fixed work schedule but almost everyday she works from 9am to 12pm, and from 2pm until the late hours in the evening given that she has to share her time with household chores.

This is her third loan cycle working with the foundation; she feels very thankful because thanks to the loans that she has been granted she has been able to repair two sewing machines and to purchase an iron.

With this loan that she has acquired she will obtain a gas stove that she is missing.

Her goal is to study how to cut and fashion clothing to earn a tailor title.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia C. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Eufemia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eufemia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian R. vive en la comarca  Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar,  este joven se ha caracterizado por ser un docente  muy responsable, honesto, con  buena conducta y moral crediticia,  su esposa trabaja como docente  en la misma comarca donde ellos viven,  son una familia humildes que han luchado para seguir  adelante y para seguir estudiando , actualmente  estan en el ultimo año de magisterio,  Adrian con el crédito anterior logro comprar unos terneros, aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral , seguir estudiando y salud para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Adrian lives in the region of "Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas de Nueva Guinea". He is asking for his second loan with the institution called AFODENIC. This loan will be used to build a house and in doing so, improve his living conditions. This young person has the personality to be a teacher. He is very responsible, honest, has good conduct and is financially responsible. His wife works as a teacher in the same district where they live. They are a humble family that is trying to move ahead and continue studying. Actually, they are in the last year of teacher's college. Adrian, with his last loan, bought calves. He hopes to have a better house, a steady job and good health for himself and his family

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea es casada, tiene dos hijas  mayores de edad, vive en la colonia Jerusalen de Nueva Guinea, trabaja en la Escuela Alejandro Vegas Matus desde hace 20 años como docente de primaria,  con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una  cocina, y ahora esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación  en su casa y seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia,    se ha caracterizado por ser una   profesional  con mucha experiencia, honesta y muy trabajadora,  cuentra con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como  agricultor en la finca que estos poseen. Andrea aspira tener una vivienda bonita y bien acondicionada, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea is married, has two adult daughters, and lives in Colonia Jerusalen, Nueva Guinea. She has worked in the Alejandro Vegas Matus school for 20 years as a teacher in the primary school. With the previous loan she was able to successfully construct a kitchen. Now she is requesting her 7th loan from AFODENIC in order to add a room to her house, and to continue to improve the living conditions of her family. She is a hardworking professional who is experienced and honest, and has the support of her husband who works on a farm that they own. Andrea wishes to have a beautiful, well furnished house, to have job stability, to continue her studies, and to have a healthy family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to construct a room

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie Y. is a 44-year-old rice farmer from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She has four children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old, and a very supportive husband who manages their two-hectare rice field. Margie hopes the rice field will be able to provide her family with enough food, clothes and income to meet their daily needs.

Margie would like to request a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan as additional capital for her rice farm business. The loan will help pay for the farm equipment she has borrowed. She likes the CEVI program, and hopes that with her loan she will be able to sustain and improve her business. Her dream is to buy more rice farmland.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. pay farm equipment rent

loans.name: Blanca Isolina

texts.es: Blanca Isolina esta solicitando su 2do crèdito para construir una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia, en su comunidad es conocida por ser una mujer que  ha luchado por seguir adelante en sus labores, a pesar que es  madre soltera ha luchado  para que a su hijo no le falte nada  ya que desde que nacio ha luchado con su enfermedad,  es una docente muy responsable con sus deberes y es muy querido por sus alumnos y padres de familia, su sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de Educacion, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia  ya que son de escasos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Blanca Isolina is requesting a second loan in order to construct another room in her home and therefore improve the living conditions of her family. In her community she is known for being a woman who has fought to advance her goals. As a single mother she has struggled so that her son's needs would always be met, in spite of an illness he has had since birth. She is a teacher who is very responsible with her obligations and loved by her students and their families. Her dream is to finish her studies and become a fully licensed science teacher, to find stable work and to help her family since they have few economic resources.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Damaris Nohemi

texts.es: Damaris Nohemi espera ser beneficiada por  segunda vez con  el fondo Kiva, para invertirlo en construcción de una habitación, trabaja como tecnica del Ministerio de Educaciòn, le urge construir una habiatcion y así mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar ya que AFODENIC ofrece un interés bajo  y  politicas de creditos accesibles para las personas de escasos recursos econòmicos, tiene capacidad y voluntad de pago, es una joven trabajadora, honesta y muy apreciada en su comunidad, su esposo trabaja como taxista y comparten los gastos familiares y  los compromisos, su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda digna y bonita, seguir estudiando para asi obtener mejores conocimientos y ser cada dia una persona mejor.
texts.en:
Damaris Nohemi hopes to receive her second loan from Kiva in order to build a room. She works as a technician in the Ministry of Education. The room is urgently needed to improve the living conditions of her nuclear family. AFODENIC offers low interest, and the loan policies make loans accessible for people with scant economic resources. She has the ability and desire to pay. She is a hard-working, honest, and very appreciated young woman in her community. Her husband works as a taxi driver. They share the family expenses and their commitments. Her biggest dreams are to have a decent, attractive house; to keep studying to gain more knowledge; and to be a better person each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. is from the village of Linangkayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old, and married with two adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing pump boat services to local community members. Norma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
“Never give up,” says Artemio of Barangay Labni, Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is a responsible father of four children and a loving wife to Victoria. He and his wife are helping one another to earn a living for their family and educate their children.

Artemio works as a motorcycle driver in his village, while his wife is managing a general store at home. Their income is budgeted to meet their daily needs with school allowances for their children.

Improving their small businesses requires financial capital. Artemio would like to borrow 5,000 PHP for motorcycle maintenance and for improvement of the store. He believes that he can improve their standard of living with financial assistance.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn manages a village store which is situated in front of her house. She is 30 years old, married and living with her family in the village of Rizal, Santiago City. Arlyn is able to generate an average gross income of PHP 4,000 a week, which is just enough to meet her family's daily needs. With a desire to make her business grow, she is borrowing PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes that the business will grow and become more successful. Arlyn says that her income from the business is a big help to her family. She is patiently doing her best to make her business productive.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
“Time is gold!”, says Marcela E.. She is a young mother who lives in Barangay Labni, Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She was only 16 years old when she got married to Erwin and they now have three children. Despite the hardships of life, they are doing their best and never lose hope for the future of their children.

Marcela's husband is working abroad, while Marcela manages a business buying and selling vegetables in their village. She also sells food snacks to bring in more income. Every week she has a gross income of PHP 1,150 which she uses for their daily needs and for the education of their eldest child. They want their children to be successful someday and are giving them the education they need. Because of her interest in improving and strengthening her business, Marcela would like to borrow PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders as additional business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

Nina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be Nina's first loan from HSPFI. loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success,” says Rachelle J. of Barangay Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Remelito and they are very determined to uplift their living conditions. Her husband is working as a tricycle driver while Rachelle manages a small recycle business, buying and selling materials like empty bottles and cans and anything else they can sell. She is able to earn a weekly income of PHP 1,000 from the business and it is being used for their basic home necessities. She also saves some money for the future education of her son.

Rachelle now wants to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders for additional business capital. She would like to develop her buy-and-sell business and plans to have a general store someday.

I. order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Khim I. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the field.

Mrs. Khim I. is 48 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed I. a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right I. the photo.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a mother, Mrs. Delia G. has always aspired to provide well for her children's future. But in Sitio Cambagting, Barangay Cabacungan, La Castellana, the village where they lived, employment opportunities were scarce. Her husband, Edmond, earned a minimum daily wage as a truck driver, which was not enough to feed their 10 children. Despite of all the adversities that her family faced, Delia strived hard to supplement her husband's income and provide for her large family. Her skills as a cook inspired her to start a food vending business and offer home-cooked meals to her neighbors. 

With virtually no capital, she started her business by cooking 3 to 4 dishes in small quantities, and putting all of her income back into her business. As demand for her cooked food grew among her neighbors, it became obvious that she needed a larger revolving fund. This moved her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001, and with the additional capital from her loans, she was able to increase her food production in volume and variety. 

Now that she is 58 and her husband is 65, their life has improved. Nine of her children have their own families, some earning their own living and some help in her food vending business. Only the youngest still attends school. Her husband's income as a truck driver and the PHP 3,000.00 she nets from her food business is enough to cover their household expenses.

For her 13th loan, she borrowed PHP 10,000. She used some of the loan funds for her food vending business, and she used some to buy a piglet that she can raise in her backyard and later sell for a profit. That loan has been repaid in full and she never missed an installment. 

She is now borrowing PHP 17,000 for her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She intends to invest the loan funds in her food vending business. 

In the picture, Delia is standing in front of her food stall with her daughter, who helps her in the business.


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Deng

texts.en:

Because selling water is a profitable business for family, C. has requested a loan to purchase a small truck with a barrel for her husband's business. The main source of income for her store comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. She has been engaged in this activity for more than two years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Arlene’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the overall living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Teresita P. is a resident of Barangay Ineangan Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now 50 years old and has been blessed with four children, two boys and 2 girls. Because of financial difficulty, she and her husband, Alexander, help each other to provide for the needs of their family, especially for their children’s education.

Teresita, on the other hand, is vending different products such as vegetables, cooked snacks, fruits, etc. She sells her products house to house and she is able to generate a daily gross income of PHP500. loans.name: Vut's Group

texts.en:
There are five low-income people who have decided to seek a loan for different purposes. One of these people, Mr. R., 39, has been chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. Most of R.’s life is spent on the river fishing with his wife in order to raise income. They typically generate a daily profit of $5 to contribute their family’s living expenses. R. said that he feels so happy in his current work that is a profitable one for his family, but unfortunately some of his fishing tools are broken. He would like a loan to buy new fishing tools and to repair some broken pieces as well. The other members of this group loan are:  
Mrs. S., who is pursuing a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house for her family.
Mrs. N. is a fish catcher, who is asking for a loan to buy more fishing equipment.
Mr. C. is a fisherman and he will use his loan to repair his old house.  
Mrs. P. will use this Kiva loan to build a new small house for his family’s living purposes.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing equipment

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Engaging in Fish Vending is not an easy business to take on. It requires patience, hard work, love and dedication to achieve any semblance of success. 

Mrs. Marissa B., 44 years old, is married to Mr. Joseph Maximo B. who helps her in running the business. They are blessed with 4 children, the oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. They live in the village of Brgy. Canmoros, in the town of Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. 

Mr.& Mrs. B. wakes up at 4:00 AM each day to buy fish from the wholesalers. They deliver the fish to their permanent customers in the village and in the surrounding community. For 9 years, Marissa also has been engaged in selling dried fish, Ginamos nga Isda (Fermented Salted Fish), and other Sea Food products. Because of her dedication, hard work and perseverance, she and her husband were able to reach their goal to send their children to school, build their house in stages while maintaining their good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon.

At present, the 2 older children have already finished vocational courses but each would like to continue their education and earn a bachelor's degree. While waiting for the next school year to start, so they could enroll and start attending college, they are earning their own income by selling fish in another fish stall in the market. Delia saves their profits in a fund for their college tuition.

Delia is grateful for the continued support she gets from NWTF-Project Dungganon through the loans she borrows at easy installment payments. Her previous 12th cycle loan amounting to PHP 12,000 was fully paid on time and she is now borrowing PHP 12,000. This will be her 13th cycle loan that she will have a revolving working capital for her fish vending business.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina S. is from the village of Saray, Iligan City. She is 44 years old. Gina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products,  including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.en:
A. Inoyat is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. Inoyat has dedicated herself to the sale of eggs at Tursunzade’s egg market for the past 16 years. In order to support her husband with household expenses she decided to invest her small amount of savings to this kind of business. Inoyat started her business with a small investment in merchandise. However, due to high competition, she has been acquiring greater amounts of eggs which has helped increase her earnings, albeit very slowly. Her plans are to invest more in her business through the purchase of additional product to sell. That is the reason that Inoyat applied for a loan of 3000 Somoni. With your support, you can improve the quality of life for Inoyat and her family and help their business grow and prosper.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the eggs for expanding the business.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo, or Romy as he was called, is living in the village of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. He is married to Marilyn and they have been gifted with six children who are in the high school and elementary level.  

He and his wife are helping one another in managing their business.  They operate a general store and also sell fruits and vegetables in front of their store.  At present, he is requesting to avail a loan of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great value in the business for it is their source of income and it helps them in sending their children to school.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Sanoatkhon

texts.en:
A. Sanoatkhon is 48 years old. She is married and mother of two children. Sanoatkhon is a very hardworking and independent woman. In search of a way to support her husband, as his salary was not enough for the family expenses, she started selling eggs 18 years ago. Now her husband is retired on a pension and her business is the main source of income for her family. Currently, Sanoatkhon needs money to fulfill all her customer’s orders. For this reason she applied for a loan of 3000 Somoni through our organization. The well being of Sanoatkhon’s family and her business are in your hands. She is sincerely grateful for your support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing eggs for selling.

loans.name: Narzi

texts.en:
S. Narzi is 46 years old. He has a restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. When he first started his business he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. His restaurant is located near a big factory that allows him to attract a large number of clients, especially at lunch time. Narzi wants this loan inorder that he may invest in more products to offer a more varied selection of dishes. He is asking for a loan of $1200 USD. With this money, Narzi will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit and in turn help his family move forward. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of Narzi’s business and they will be grateful. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
